author: {'steamid': '76561198014333343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1709179156}
review: I'm not sure if it's high praise, depends who you talk to, but this game feels like a Quentin Tarantino and Wes Anderson love child. I could probably talk all day about what makes this game great but is it not enough that it's a human story? There is more emotional depth here in this very short video game to rival or even exceed any "game of the year." And the best part is, you get to piece it all together, like a broken heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055712749', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1704235030}
review:
NOTE: If the game bugs and has too high of a resolution, visit here: https://blendogames.com/thirtyflightsofloving/faq.htm

Thirty Flights of Loving, like Gravity Bone, is a narrative experience rather than a game. There is some interaction, but it's limited, and extremely linear. It's a great experience that leaves you totally confused and absolutely wanting more from this weird world. You are utterly starved of context, dropped into the end of someone's life as you go through the events they went through before they arrived at that point.

I am far too out of my depth to critique this in any meaningful way, but I will say I heavily enjoyed this experience. I don't know what it all means, but I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007098487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1700952698}
review:
“Playing” this “game” is like being inserted in the Tarantino film trailer – just as dynamic, just as short with just as little agency (zero, to be precise). 
Pressing W and occasionally pressing E (with null of an impact when it comes to anything other than doors) has never been so stylish.

And while you’re being shamelessly railroaded down the rather vague but lively story, there will be questions like:

-	What’s with all the cats?
-	Have you just been hit with a short aerodynamics lesson?
-	Does the use of mini-balloons make police less or more threatening?
-	Is drunk sex really worth it?
-	Why pushing ducks into the pool is so satisfying?

And they will never be answered. Which is fine – that’s where “experimental” tag comes in. I’d also add such tags as: 
“not for everyone”, “not much to do but still fun”, “what the hell is this? This is not a game but I kinda dig it”, “I’m not even sure why I liked it, but I did”, “I think I did”, “no, I definitely did”, “but why?”, “who cares, it was short and sweet”.

Loving the simplicity, and the experience. Not your usual game, and it is a breezy 10-15 minutes leaving me wanting for more!

"El presidente is dead, long live mecha presidente!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198065045125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1698692980}
review:
No BS, Revisiting this game again over a decade later, still cool af.

Dev targeted a specific audience and hit the nail on the head. I'm a sucker for short story games and this is one of my favorites due to the art design and storytelling.

It's super short, but super cool if you're into that type of thing.

Developer commentary is also sick, giving you insight to how much goes into these types of games. Money well spent IMO

author: {'steamid': '76561197977779488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1549995227}
review: Do you want meat, or is an empty plate of steak juice and a gnawed bone just as good? Yes, what's there is cinematic. What's there also isn't enough. I'm not a great lover of minimalist poetry. I liked the first minimalist poem I ever read, and disliked almost every single one after that because they all make the same point even if it isn't their intention, that a mere impression with formal elements is powerful. Like those poems this game may have impressions of soul, but it's still largely structure and formalism without most of the good stuff (or much of the work, incidentally). If it ever goes on sale, and you feel like watching a fantastic 10 min. trailer for a game that doesn't exist, go ahead and play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063791971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1672439762}
review:
[quote=из сериала «Dexter»]Ты какой-то странный, еще страннее, чем обычно.[/quote]

Blendo Games — американская независимая компания по разработке видео игр, расположенная в Калвер-Сити, Калифорния. Компания в основном является инициативой одного человека (Брендона Чанга) и специализируется на одиночных видео играх различного жанра.
Thirty Flights of Loving вторая из ретро-шпионской серии, в которую вошла короткая новелла "Gravity Bone" и полноценная игра "Quadrilateral cowboy".
Thirty Flights of Loving была разработана для кампании Kickstarter, организованной командой подкаста Idle Thumbs. В игре используется модифицированная версия движка id Tech 2, изначально разработанного для Quake 2.

СЮЖЕТ
[code]
Трое персонажа планируют совершить кражу и по итогу сталкиваются с последствиями операции.
[/code]

ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ
[code]
Как такового геймплея в этой игре нет. Игроку предлагается пройти несколько уровней и понаблюдать за небольшими сценами, которые как воспоминания в хаотичном порядке повествуют историю игры.
[/code]

ИТОГ
[h1]Вся игра проходится от силы за 13-15 минут. Покупать её за полную стоимость нет никакого смысла так как в интернете можно спокойно посмотреть её прохождение. [/h1]
Если вы прониклись творчеством [b]Blendo Games[/b], то «Thirty Flights of Loving» стоит приобрести со скидкой и только.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025196133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1693161893}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990253266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1688949764}
review:
A friend of mine had been telling me to play this game forever, but I kept putting it off because I assumed it was a lengthy RPG style game for some reason, and I just don't have the time.

It's actually the most cinematic 15 minutes I've ever experienced in videogames and my jaw was on the floor the entire time while playing.

I feel like I need to go back through it a couple of times to piece together the narrative stuff I missed the first time round, but this is like, an essential play for anyone interested in games as an artform.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006550745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1688884285}
review:
This is probably closer to neutral than true positive, and sadly I'd say it's not as good as the creator's first game in this world "Gravity Bone." (Which is included in this, but also available on Steam for free.)

The game is an interesting, but very short experience. It is low on interactivity, but the visuals and music are both very good. Still a little more interactivity within the story may have helped here, though perhaps I have been spoiled by developments in the genre over the decade since "Thirty Flights of Loving"'s release.

Really the problem is the story, it's obtuse and over too quickly. (Playable in 10 minutes or so.) Really it could have benefited with being twice as long to flesh out some of the details, though I suspect the creator's intent was to keep certain elements unknowable. This led to an unfortunate "Wait, this is the end?" feeling on completion.

Still it's worth the price of a coffee, which is often all it costs on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127019080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1688761540}

Una cosa muy extraña, en el buen sentido diría yo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075513382', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1680280465}
review:
Recht kurz und sicherlich nicht jedermanns Sache.
Mich hat es aber unterhalten.

Das Spiel ist eine bizarre Kurzgeschichte über ein Bankräuber-Trio mit eckigen Kastenköpfen, schnellen Szenenwechseln und ohne gesprochene Dialoge, welches man unterschiedlich interpretieren kann.
Gameplay ist Walking Simulator mäßig sehr minimal, rumlaufen ein paar mal "E" drücken.
Sterben kann man dabei nicht.

Als Bonus gibt es einen Entwickler-Kommentar und das bereits vor Thirty Flights of Loving erschienene Spiel "Gravity Bone" wobei es sich um einen Agenten-Thriller in einer ähnlichen Aufmachung handelt, hier gibt es allerdings einige Platforming Passagen und andere Hindernisse, die einen umbringen können.

Für 4,99 Euro ist es IMHO zu teuer, aber wer auf so "Kunstspiele" steht, sollte sich das geben, wenn es mal in den Sales reduziert ist.

Superou muito o Gravity Bone e é uma otima continuação.

review:
Si bien, la forma de la narrativa es relativamente innovadora, la historia no me agradó en lo más mínimo. Parece todo inconexo y aleatorio. Parece ser de este tipo de historias con un "lore" que sólo vas a terminar conociendo si te das el tiempo de conectar todo y que terminas viendo en un video de youtube.

Me gustan los juegos con gráficos minimalistas, pero este simplemente tiene un arte tosco, feo y sin terminaciones. No recomiendo comprarlo ni jugarlo

author: {'steamid': '76561197992160522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 337, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1669155111}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving

Positives:
+ Cool retro graphics
+ Movie-like artstyle
+ Mostly good sound and music
+ Very weird (in a good way)
+ Makes very little sense
+ Entertaining and amusing
+ Nice fps gameplay
+ Gravity Bone is bundled as a bonus
+ Has got sad & meowing square cats in it (whats not to like?)

Negatives:
- Extremely short
- Some bugs
- Should have been free
- Bad speech sounds
- Some parts you cant do anything in
- Jumps a bit too much back and forth

Total Score: 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198038324496', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1668445266}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068554908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1667502048}
review:
TFOL is a lovely 12-minute Odd-yssey; a first-person... I guess it's a walking simulator. In about as much about as much minutes as normal people have fingers (that is to say: twelve), it paints a charming portrait of a group of fun-lovin' criminals and their downfall. That's about all there is to say, and between going through it a second time with commentary, and the two bonus puzzle/platform levels, it takes about an hour to 100% this game. But I can't fault it for being a well-crafted experience, and brings across its story efficiently. At five bucks, some people might be disappointed by a ten-minute game, and I don't blame them, but I think it's a fun experience worth having at least once...

FINAL SCORE: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11126, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1707024119}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is an amateur made first person story driven adventure game where you and your blocky crew are part of a heist gone wrong and must escape.  I won't get too deep into the story apart from mentioning that even a good, creative and sincere story can't save a sloppy technical implementation on a game.

The game features lazy low-polygon voxel "Minecraft"-like "art", making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the 1990s.  A lot of amateur developers see Minecraft's success and assume it's because it looks bad, not because it had unique and appealing game mechanics, and they try to emulate the success without understanding it.  It also happens to be easy, and doesn't need any proper talent in terms of game development/graphic artists etc.  That's why reviewers are faced with so many of these terrible games with confrontingly bad graphics.  Developers must learn that Minecraft succeeded despite the bad graphics, not because of them.

While you can set the game resolution and even customise the game controls, there's very little in the way of graphics tweaks at all, so there's no way to improve the lacklustre visuals.

Gameplay is okay but not great, and lacks polish, leaving this game in a state where you could probably get more fun out of watching a Youtube video of it than playing it yourself... and that's a problem, because Youtube costs less than this. 

Thirty Flights of Loving has an overly optimistic price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118626844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1660828808}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000107940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1709231783}
review: It's very short (I've beaten it multiple times), has virtually no gameplay, and uses a graphics engine from the 90s, any of which will be deal-breakers for some people. That said, there aren't that many games I like more on a minute to minute basis. The world-building, visual style and music are all great, and have stuck with me more than games I played for ten times longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234230228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1656986326}
review:
比gravity bone还要短，操作还要少，但是演出还是一等一的扣人心弦。

昆汀的混乱加上林奇的迷幻，放进一个建模极其粗糙的cs（source？）引擎里，就是本作了。

他看起来好像讲了什么故事，又好像什么都没讲。背景要素支离破碎，时间顺序反复跨越。

要的就是这个味。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993922877', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1655323090}
review: I decided to play Thirty Flights of Loving again after seeing that it name checked in the end credits for Virginia. Unlike that game TFoL's surrealism and brevity really benefit from the medium, and the fast movement and interactive world pull a feeling that could only come from a video game. Great short experience. The negative reviews make it sound like this game is inscrutable, but it's not at all, I genuinely don't understand where they got hung up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198989051349', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1654360203}
review: A bit too surreal even for me with all of the time jumps and disjointed storytelling but I still loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981457015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1679008967}
review:
If you like your video games to have in-depth gameplay, then this is not the game for you.
If you like story rich walking sims, then this is also not the game for you.
If you like avant-garde surrealist experiences that expect you to figure out most details of the plot yourself, and you are willing to part with a few bucks and ten minutes of your time, then I cannot recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015032607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1356595200}
review: This is the game that made me realise the glowing reviews for indie games need to be well and truly taken with a grain of salt. It's honestly the game that has jaded me with indie games as a result, and the critic reviews of it seem to be seeing things that others don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963025067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1496775309}
review:
This is more of an exploration of a different type of storytelling in games than anything else.
And as such, it succeeds. It tells a story in cuts, with the big setpieces cut out, and the emotional moments left in. 

I'd definitely recommend this if you are interested in games as a medium. If you are looking for a traditional gaming experience, this is not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069635016', 'num_games_owned': 2880, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1646933294}
review:
[h1]Beardy Boxy Boyz[/h1]

[b]Thirty Flights of Loving[/b] - это мини-сборник коротких инди-игр о шпионах на движке Quake 2.

1) Thirty Flights of Loving 
Типа нолановское "Помни" в мире кубических бородато-картонных мужских рож.
Много неожиданных телепортаций, мало понимания происходящего.
Просто ходим и иногда активируем какой-нибудь предмет, чтобы снова идти вперёд.
Ни к Пауэрсу, ни к Бонду приплетён принцип Бернулли в трёх опытах.

1.5) Thirty Flights of Loving с режимом комментариев
Пройдите игру во второй раз и узнайте, почему танцы уходят в космос, как рисовали кота и что наушники необходимы только в одной сцене.

2) Gravity Bone
Более экшен-ориентированный проект с щепоткой неожиданностей. 
Напоминает по большей части Hitman - есть задание, инструменты для его выполнения и обязательный выход с карты.
Миссий всего две, смертей - одна (или 6?).
Возможно, придётся грузануться на флагштоке.
Игра доступна БЕСПЛАТНО на отдельной странице в магазине Steam.

По итогу - две индюшки (одна платная) по ~15 минут каждая (если не тыкаться по углам), которые запомнятся только тем, как прикольно выглядят.
Для всего остального есть Jazzpunk!

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197986496984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1646604469}
review:
[i]„Umění střihu.“[/i]

Akce je naplánovaná, vyrážíme/
všechno je špatně, vydrž kamaráde/
běžím s časem o závod, nesmíme to vzdát/
probouzím se brzy ráno, ona už je vzhůru/
pijeme a tancujeme, dělám osudovou chybu/
už o nás vědí a dochází nám sil...

Jedná se o hru z roku 2012, kterou vytvořil Brendon Chung, stojící také za tituly jako [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/974090/Gravity_Bone/]Gravity Bone[/url] nebo [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/240440/Quadrilateral_Cowboy/]Quadrilateral Cowboy[/url]. Jako člen tříčlenné skupinky zločinců, budete účastníky jedné nepovedené akce, stejně jako několika předcházejících událostí. Autor se však rozhodl, že děj nebude předkládat chronologicky, zcela se obejde bez dialogů, a vše bude viděno z pohledu vlastních očí. Výsledkem je patnáctiminutová jízda, obratně kličkující prostorem i časem – plná akce, lásky a zrady, i oloupaných pomerančů.

Vedle důvtipné práce s okolním prostředím, je pak nejsilnější stránkou hry, především dynamika samotného vyprávění. Té je docíleno časovými zkratkami, za pomoci ostrých střihů, a to přímo během samotného hraní. Vzniká tak rychlý řetězec událostí, který nesledujete pasivně, ale posouváte ho vpřed svým pohybem. Vynikající je také hudební doprovod, skvěle podtrhující gangsterskou atmosféru. Za zmínku stojí i překvapivě otevřený komentář samotného autora, který se vám odemkne po dokončení hry. Dozvíte se tak o těžkostech při vývoji, nutných kompromisech, ale i vědomých nedostatcích finální verze.

Tento narativní experiment rozhodně neosloví každého, ale jestli rádi vyhledáváte neobvyklé zážitky, pak máte mé doporučení.

[i][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861342-Bionick/]Další recenze na mé kurátorské stránce[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024992017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1644892471}
review: An honest to God masterpiece, no game story has done so much with so little as TFOL. My only complaint is that I'm know trying to find a game that can match the immaculate vibes and tone here, and have thus far failed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072240228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1644295561}
review:
I'm pretty much the target audience for this game and I fully loved it--it real feels like there's enough here to reconstruct all the pieces with incredibly minimal instruction.

I also want to point out that TFOL is absolutely worth grabbing if you have any interest in game development--particularly if you're into developing this kind of game. The director's commentary is fantastic and really gives a sense for how the game took shape--largely emphasizing the practicality of the decisions and showing how certain models were constructed and why. As someone who knows only a little about the dev side it was really cool to see what design choices formed TFOL and how much of the story and setting was derived out of necessity or accident.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345970513', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1643389041}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054608922', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1644528290}
review:
Intrigante. Em alguns aspectos me faz lembrar de "Um Homem Com Uma Câmera", clássico do cinema de Dziga Vertov.

Vertov era um raro tipo de gênio que só surge uma vez em cada geração: um cara extremamente pretensioso que tinha talento o suficiente para transformar suas pretensões em realidade. Através do cinema ele pretendia elaborar o conceito do "Kino-Glaz", que pode ser traduzido como "cine-olho" ou "kino-olho". Mais do que um instrumento de captura da realidade, a câmera funcionaria como o terceiro olho do homem, permitindo, através da recriação de imagens em movimento interligadas, ver coisas que nossos olhos naturais não seriam capazes de ver. Mas a manifestação desse "kino-olho" através do cinema só seria possível se esse meio artístico fosse destilado e purificado. Apenas quando o cinema deixa-se de se escorar em outras formas de comunicação mais tradicionais como teatro ou literatura e criasse uma linguagem própria é que ele nos permitiria vislumbrar essa realidade alterada. O aviso que precede "Um Homem Com Uma Câmera" deixam claros os intentos de Vertov: "Esse filme é um experimento em comunicação cinemática de eventos reais. Sem a ajuda de intertítulos. Sem a ajuda de uma história. Sem a ajuda de teatro. Esse trabalho experimental almeja criar uma verdadeira linguagem internacional do cinema baseado em sua absoluta separação da linguagem do teatro e literatura." A conclusão a que Vertov chegou e que sua magnum opus demonstra com eloquência é que o cinema, em sua forma mais pura, é a seleção, manipulação e mistura de imagens em movimento. Diálogos, atuação, trilha sonora, enredo... Todas essas outras coisas são absolutamente desnecessárias para se fazer um filme.

Passados 93 anos, a pergunta que muitas artistas se fazem não é mais "qual a linguagem própria do cinema?", e sim "qual a linguagem própria dos videogames?" - pergunta em partes motivada pelo curioso fato de que, assim como o cinema de outrora parecia se escorar bastante nas artes cênicas, os jogos eletrônicos de hoje em dia pegam bastante emprestado do próprio cinema, com muitos sendo literalmente vendidos como "cinematográficos". A resposta a que Brendon Chung chegou parece ser "controle": games em sua forma mais pura são espaços audiovisuais em que o jogador tem o controle de ir e vir. É usando ao máximo esse elemento que Thirthy Flights of Loving tenta contar sua narrativa, dispensando inteiramente diálogos e logs em texto ou áudio e fazendo uso negligenciável de cutscenes ou seções em que o jogador não tem controle algum.

Brendon Chung não é nenhum Dziga Vertov dos games, então apesar de suas intenções louváveis, o impacto e qualidade de sua obra são limitados. Mas, por outro lado, é injustiça culpar alguém por não ser tão talentoso quanto Dziga Vertov. Apesar de suas limitações, Thirty Flights of Loving ainda é uma obra intrigante e que merece atenção.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013367814', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1710733745}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038499939', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 429, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1642791702}
review:
[h1]7,3/10[/h1]
Эта игра наглядная демонстрация того, что получится, если у амбициозного человека возникнет идея самому сделать кинематографичную игру. Игра длится около 10 минут, но создаваться она могла пол года-год, и это ещё с опытом предыдущих проектов автора и это очень печально, одному человеку практически невозможно сделать что-то годное.

Сама игра представляет из себя просто приколюшную инди бродилку с повествованием через окружение и внезапными, особо ничем не обоснованными, поворотами. Я вот так думаю сейчас, можно было бы сделать из этого какую-нибудь полноценную очень динамичную игру без диалогов длиной хотя бы в 2 часа, где игроку надо было бы постоянно куда-то нестись и быстро находу принимать решения, руководствуясь только повествованием через окружение, вот это бы мог выйти шедевр, напрягающий мозги.

Но всё равно игра неплохая, тут уникальный способ повествования истории (дробление) и игра не тратит ваше время впустую) В конце концов, игра дарит кое-какие эмоции, а это самое важное.

p.s. Кстати, все жалуются, что она очень короткая, но после прохождения в меню ещё становится доступно перепрохождение с комментариями разработчика и предыдущая бесплатная игра этого разработчика Gravity Bone.

[code]Подписывайтесь на Кураторство: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37365104/
Добавляйте меня в друзья, будем игры обсуждать :)                    [/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561199000366920', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1664430530}
review:
If you scroll through the reviews for thirty flights of loving (tfol) you will find a lot of the the same complaint. 

The game was too short for the price

And I for one think that this is flat out wrong and is the wrong way to judge this game. Yes it is short; a first playthrough will take you about 20 minutes max but that time is some of the most interesting, experimental, and playful the medium has to offer. Tfol smartly plays subverts conventions established by other games and weaves an engaging heist and romantic narrative through its jump cuts. On top of this every single room in tfol is a designers dream and makes use of environmental storytelling and carefully placed objects to guide you through its halls.

My point here is that the amount of craftsmanship that has gone into this game is high and creates an engaging experience for the player despite its length.

you also get gravity bone on here and even though that game is free its nice to have them both together in one package.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024753734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1639323015}
review: Even though I like Gravity Bone, I couldn't stand playing Thirty Flights Of Loving. Gravity Bone is weird, but its weird nature pulls you in to the game and makes you ask questions. Thirty Flights, however, just irritated me. I didn't enjoy my time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046259139', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1639351125}
review:
I'm coming fresh off this game, and I use that term very loosely.  This is an art project telling a story in non-linear segments through the medium of Id Tech 2.  And in that regard, it's fine.  I lack the credentials to evaluate it as a piece of art.  As a game, I can't say it's worth the $5 asking price.  The gameplay is a cup of water spilled into an empty Olympic pool if that makes any sense.  I will applaud the orange-eating though, you sure can eat some oranges.  The term "walking simulator" comes to mind, but the environments are filled with so much detail and stylization that it feels almost wrong to call it that, despite it being an apt term.  The game is over 9 years old at the time of this review, but I couldn't tell honestly.  It's an experience that places itself in such a unique point of time, and uses older tech in such a way that it becomes an almost timeless experience.

Overall this game gives me mixed feelings, which I suppose means it has fulfilled it's purpose as an art piece.  My experience with this game was positive.  Would I recommend it as a game though?  No.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034025441', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1639366166}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981140305', 'num_games_owned': 912, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1635626460}
review: Ignore the negative reviews. Albeit short, this game tells a beautiful story. On sale, it costs the fraction of a movie ticket for $2.49. You would blow that money on a redbull at the cornerstore. Quit your whining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067625216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1564542599}
review: I get that this game was groundbreaking to some at the time of release, and I understand it's had an impact on other game developers that have been inspired by its very unique, abbreviated storytelling. But, ultimately, the experience is too short and too shallow to be worth spending money on. Thirty Flights of Loving is a toy that you play with once. As other reviews point out, play the prequel, Gravity Bone. That's also a toy you play with once, but it's free. I don't mind paying for a short experience, but at least in 2021 neither game is revolutionary enough to warrant financial investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061737345', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1503072291}
review:
[h1]Quirky, but shallow[/h1]
The unfortunate thing is that [i]Thirty Flights of Loving[/i] isn't bad, it just suffers from a bad case of style over substance. It's predecessor, [i]Gravity Bone[/i], which is included in the package, is actually a considerably better game. It's wittier, at points more memorable in terms of level design, and contains more conventional 'gameplay'. The issue comes in the fact that Gravity Bone is available to play online [i]for free[/i].

Thirty Flights of Loving tries to focus on narrative, rather than gameplay. It shares a similar art direction to Gravity Bone, with vibrant colours and boxy, polygonal characters.

There's still genuine charm here, but after its initial novelty, the game feels like its only flair is in its aesthetics. There are some games that benefit from leaning into visual aspects over their gameplay, but many of these titles have randomly generated elements or are considerably larger in scope. Thirty Flights of Loving is a linear experience that lasts less than an hour, which doesn't leave much room for replayability. The game is just a string of action movie setpieces and clichés. 

Overall, after finishing, I felt the same sensations I felt years ago watching the second Transformers movie. There was enough flashy stuff to keep me entertained while I was watching, then I left feeling a little manipulated and hollow for having realistically gained so little from the experience. It's all of the climactic scenes from a heist movie, but without any of the nuance and humanistic characterisation that actually make an engaging story. The other half is another, better game that's available online for free.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198072893076', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1625732653}
review:
Шутер от первого лица, в котором всё понятно без единого выстрела.

При своей крайне малой продолжительности Thirty Flights of Lovind (и Gravity Bone) демонстрирует поразительный нарративный дизайн. Без единого слова и всего за несколько минут Вы понимаете какие были взаимоотношения между персонажами. Вы видите два состояния - тогда и сейчас. Что к этому привело неважно, что говорят персонажи неважно. Зарисовка подходящая для кинематографа. 

Да, суммарно в игре вы проведете не больше часа. Возвращать ли за неё деньги после прохождения? 
- Решать Вам. 
Покупать ли её вовсе или посмотреть эти 15 минут на YouTube?
- Тут, пожалуй, я могу дать лишь один ответ: Да, покупать. На скидках или за полный ценник неважно. 
Неважно и вернёте ли вы деньги потом. Главное - напишите своё мнение. Эта "игра" более некоторый перфоманс, о котором нужно высказаться в ответ, чем попытка просто сделать игру на продажу. Порекомендуйте или поругайте увиденное. Поделитесь своими впечатлениями.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082570231', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1624722514}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is a remarkable game. Yes, it's short - less than 20 minutes long - but it tells a surprisingly deep story for that 20 minutes, and makes you feel fully involved in it and the fates of the characters. That's no mean feat. I felt more for the cast of this game in those 20 minutes than I have for characters in games of 30+ hours. 

The game wants you to experience the story, rather than have it narrated to you, with each moment in its timeline presented as a short vignette that guides the player through the highs and lows of this tale. If you go into this expecting a short, impactful, cinematic experience that doesn't ask a lot of the player, I don't think you will be disappointed. 

One for fans of The Stanley Parable, Jazzpunk, Off Peak and other off-kilter games that leave you thinking long after the credits roll.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033250709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1620584310}
review:
The game is fairly benign for the most part. Story, gameplay, and aesthetics are all not great imo, but that's whatever I guess - at least it's short, and I can forgive a lot for a small indie game. For what it is I didn't think it was offensively bad so I would probably have not bothered reviewing it except that I completed the game but experienced almost a dozen crashes while doing so. Changing the resolution crashed the game once. Turning on anisotropic filtering crashed the game. Changing some of the other graphics settings crashed the game. At one point simply opening the menu crashed the game. Another time during my playthrough there was no particular obvious cause - it just crashed.

So all up my experience was definitely a confused but negative one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994242946', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1619377318}
review: I'd buy this for a dollar. Both TFoL and its apparent prequel compose a nice little vignette about lost loves, and I think - despite the stupendously-short length - it all comes together well enough to be effective in its storytelling. Plus, any game that uses Brazil for a soundtrack gets extra points.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050247990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1612353440}
review: It's cinematic, but it understands that good movies are all about the editing and the way you cut from shot to shot or scene to scene to create meaning, not sweeping vistas or complicated camera shenanigans. I'm not going to pretend I've got some conspiracy board trying to connect all the blendo games references into a cohesive narrative, but it's interesting, there are some legitimately beautiful moments, and it's basically pioneering a new way of thinking about narrative time in games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307386406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1707970365}
review:
one of my favorite games. take thirty minutes and see a game do something new.

Thirty Flights of Loving occupies the same space for me as the EP Wispy, No Mercy by the band Citrus. they're beautiful pieces of art you can experience in less than twenty minutes. they're genre-defining. they're the peak of their kind.

i'm tempted to say there's nothing quite like it out there; there is Jazzpunk and Paratopic, both of which i like even if i don't hold them in quite as high regard. (also looking forward to playing Adios.)

give it a shot. experience something unique. 

(my favorite games of all time are moon: Remix RPG Adventure, Donkey Kong: Jungle Beat, and Doom (1993) if that helps you predict how much you might agree with me.)

(also, i had a brief issue with windows scaling wonkiness that was easily fixed. if you encounter similar issues, right-click the game on your task bar, go to properties, go to compatibility, check "disable fullscreen optimizations". you might want to mess with the high DPI settings on the same page.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026231217', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1596623498}
review: I enjoy short narrative experiences, but Thirty Flights of Loving just didn't click with me. It felt more like someone experimenting with a game engine. To me, it seemed like Blendo wanted to make a game that had smash cuts and thought to themselves: "Okay, definitely putting smash cuts in, how can I make a short story that's as simple as possible while keeping smash cuts" and then, had nothing particularly interesting to say with that technique. I really do think it's pretentious after playing it for a second time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048639588', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1613711071}
review:
At no point during the 12 minutes it took me to complete this game did I understand what was going on. So I replayed it again with the developer commentary and I still didn't understand any more than the first playthrough.
The dev commentary provides somewhat neat insight to game design, but at a high school level.
There's a whole interactive exhibit about the Bernoulli Principle placed inexplicably after the end sequence, that was my favorite part by far.

I don't know what this is but it is not worth $5, I think I got it free in a bundle once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010939085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1613369242}
review:
Technically not a true walking simulator since you can die from fall damage.
Oh, and you can bunnyhop as well.

---

Actual Review

The stories for the games are brief. Thirty Flights isn't really interesting due to poor narrative. Gravity Bone actually has a cohesive story and feels like playing a spy film short film.

It feels like a couple of experimental games you'd find on Kongregate, not a purchasable product which is why I cannot buying this package.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990639403', 'num_games_owned': 3539, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1612324968}
review:
The sequel to Gravity Bone, which is short (11 minutes), fun, and free.

This is short (also 11 minutes), fun, and $5 at full price. 

I enjoyed my time with it - and it was also in my library (bundle? sale? who knows) - but I definitely wouldn't recommend it at that price. 

Recommended if you have it already somehow as I did, or play(ed) and enjoy Gravity Bone and see it on sale for $1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324392051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1610307401}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving se anima a utilizar el montaje para contarte una historia no lineal, en un juego cuya estructura si lo es. Breve y conciso, no necesita más de 15 minutos para contar lo que quiere, y de una forma más que satisfactoria para el jugador. Los walking sim suelen estar llenos de ideas, pero este aún así sorprende con lo que hace, utilizando el mismo motor que con gravity bone. La creatividad en pos del diseño y de contar una historia con pocos recursos. Personalmente no va a ser fácil olvidar la escena de la boda. Sin dudas el juego más cinematográfico que jugué.

review: Alright, so this is an important game in the same way Un Chien Andalou was important. Most of y'all won't enjoy it as entertainment but it introduced a lot of techniques when it comes to the way videogames are presented. If you're a game developer or aspiring to be one it's a must play, it's only 20 minutes long. If you're into walking sims and such it likely is up your alley. Otherwise you might want to skip this one and play Quadrilateral Cowboy by the same dev, one of the greatest games of the past decade.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960447094', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1668675154}
review:
I've played a lot of the game. I have 7 and a half hours as of this writing and that's about 45 playthroughs give or take. I've played this game countless times to understand and study the game. (I bet you didn't know you could press in the seat in the bar.) This game is probably one of the best narrative interactions I've found. This style of game allows you to piece together the story. In the way of a Her Story or Gone Home. This is a mystery to uncover wrapped in a story about one last heist. It's entirely environmental story telling and I believe does it very well but it expects you to do things that a lot of other games don't. Figure out the story for yourself.

This also comes with Citizen Abel's last game Gravity Bone which is very much in the same vain as thirty flights. It's about the same length but where Thirty Flights is purely communicated via emotions and scenes Gravity Bone allows itself to use on screen text and voice to fill in bits of the narrative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165879234', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1600381390}
review:
Bad game, amazing interactive short film. 

While this offers very little in the way of actual game play, the amount of care and effort put into the world and the way it tells its story by its developer make this something really well done.

Although I would not recommend this to someone who actually wants to play a game, but someone who likes the other aspects of games that make this medium unique and important.

Its worth noting that even though this game barely reaches thirty minutes for a single play through, I have already past the point of no refund due to my total playtime.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982210733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1599334836}
review: An art house movie of a game, fun, and though provoking, the one jumping puzzle is the only rough spot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198421399626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1642754788}
review:
In my opinion, Thirty Flights of Loving is a film (or put it more precisely, a film trailer, because of its shortness) in game form.

One unique technique it employs is sudden scene jump (I am not sure of the exact terminology), common in filmmaking, but almost non-existent in gaming. It tells a story (or snippets of a story) of a crime gang with a car crash, a betrayal, a wedding and a motorcycle ride. You need to fill in the gaps in the plot by yourself. The music is also reminiscent of crime film trailers.

Is it good? I don't know, but at least it's unique.
Since it is short (a playthrough lasts 15 minutes, the bonus contents last 30-45 minutes), cheap and unique, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136033395', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1654949694}
review:
I really like this game, it's simple, short, but really cool.

This game includes Gravity Bone and it's sequel Thirty Flights Of Loving. Both of these are really good games if you're into walking sim type games, which I am.

I'm pretty surprised that this game has a mixed rating on Steam. I mean, sure I've played other walking simulators that are more in depth, longer and overall better than this, but this is still really good in my opinion, especially for only €5. I might however be slightly biased because this is one of the games that introduced me to walking simulators, a genre that I honestly love.

So, while I've played better walking sims, this one is still real good and I would recommend it if you like these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063349189', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1598029693}
review: Holy. What the. Smash cut smash cut smash cut. How did this 15 minute game do a better job of telling the same story that I have seen in 120 minute long movies?? There's certainly more flair, and some surrealism. I loved this so much. I don't know if something so short is worth $5, but on sale, for sure. There are some elements here that I'm dying to see implemented in other videogames.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176214365', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1597222768}
review:
短小精悍，（在当时）叙事手法大胆新颖创新。一些镜头的转场和蒙太奇都很惊艳。对于色彩的运用和氛围渲染的能力都很出色。我非常喜欢里面的配音配乐，很称场景和氛围。这是我能追溯到最早使用跳跃式剪辑并做得很出色的游戏互动式作品。

关于剧情：
这款的游戏剧情改编自一篇短篇小说；整体给我一种王家卫电影风格的感觉，很感性，很意识流，喜欢的人会很喜欢。
[spoiler]游戏中，展示给玩家的是一场抢劫案之前和之后发生的事，并以非线性叙述。女性甜点师是玩家的恋人，还是个优秀的狙击手，另一位被通缉的男性是玩家扮演角色的最好的朋友。他们曾为主角庆生，曾经快乐的场景仍在脑海中，与最终的结果对比之下却是显得结局如此悲剧与惨烈；他们曾经骑摩托兜风，因逆行而出事故（可能）。最后的追击战，可能是导致主角死亡的原因。最后这三位抢劫案的黑手并未得到好下场。最终end那里的一些关于飞机的理论与模型，也可以解读成一些故事相关的隐喻。这里我不过多展开了。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032544483', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1577225481}
review:
There's something to be said for the difference between art and pomposity.

Art is something that most everybody can connect to because it relates to them.
Pomposity is when you -think- your ideas are so high-brow, that you spit shit on a canvas and call it divine.

This game is random and aimless, and presented as this great show piece.

The Beginner's Guide
Stanley Parable

Both superior.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081483826', 'num_games_owned': 973, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1576655535}
review: Should be free. Essentially just a walking sim with very little other interactivity at all. Finished in less than 20 minutes, and that's with fuckups aka walking back and forth desperately trying to find out what there was to actually do (spoiler: it's almost nothing), you can complete it in even less. Saying that there's a "plot" or a "narrative" is technically true, but if you actually want a good story, play just about any other game. Hell, terrible fanfiction like My Immortal delivers a better story and tells it better than Thirty Flights of Loving does. Avoid unless you want to waste your time and money

author: {'steamid': '76561197985235696', 'num_games_owned': 1923, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1589825014}
review:
Should be totally free, took longer to fix this game than play them both through.

Thirty Flights of Loving is pile of short scenes in scrambled order while Gravity Bone has two short missions. Later seemed bit like Jazzpunk, but due the length and very low amount of interactive stuff to do it doesn't get there. Basically you get the same experience by checking video walkthrough.

If you are going to play this at some point would recommend putting "+set r_mode -1 +set vid_fullscreen 0 +set r_customwidth 1920 +set r_customheight 1080" in games launch options at Steam. That fixed game crashing for me and could play them both through without any issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058159844', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1578376378}
review:
If a game is ‘narrative-driven’, that’s an alarm bell to me. Not because I don’t like narrative, or even because I don’t like a game that’s mostly narrative, but because most developers don’t quite seem to understand that having a narrative focus doesn’t mean you can just disregard interactivity as an element of that narrative. The good examples ([i]Spec Ops: The Line[/i], [i]Undertale[/i], etc.) seem to get that unless the story in some way involves the player’s input, that story, no matter how clever or interesting, can be nothing more than a backdrop to the gameplay.

[i]Thirty Flights of Loving[/i] doesn’t understand this, but more importantly it also lacks any meaningful gameplay for its weak, self-indulgent storytelling to serve as a backdrop for. It’s going for a sort of edgy film style, with quick cuts between non-linear story segments, a technique that doesn’t really work when the character is player-controlled, since the onus is on you to match the pacing of the individual segments with the frequency of the developer-controlled scene transitions.

In general, it just doesn’t work. I’d love to be able to say it’s bold and innovative, but it’s really just a colourful new skin on something that’s been done to death by now. If the story was interesting I might have recommended it; if the story was told in a unique way, I might have recommended it. With [i]any[/i] engaging gameplay whatsoever I would almost certainly have recommended it, but as it stands, [i]Thirty Flights[/i] just doesn’t have what it takes to be worth your time or money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993148381', 'num_games_owned': 4356, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1578407831}
review: [i]Thirty Flights of Loving[/i] is a very short first-person story with limited interactivity. It quite effectively draws the player into its story through the use of jump cuts between scenes that clearly take place in sequence, but with notable gaps between them, inviting you to fill in the details of its plot. While perhaps part of the charm, the very primitive graphical style may be a turn-off for many, but the soundtrack is pretty good. Although very cheap, I'm not sure that I'd recommend buying this on its own (I received it as part of a bundle), but it's an interesting experience to play through while it lasts - overall I'd give the game a qualified recommendation

author: {'steamid': '76561197964113917', 'num_games_owned': 1914, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1577531826}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is an indie darling that everyone was recommending back when it came out. Coming to it later, you can see where it had an influence on future games, like Jazzpunk and Paratopic. The game is short, and lasts about 15 minutes and includes a free copy of Gravity Bone, the developer's previous game. While I liked the storytelling in this game, there was not really enough content lengthwise to make it work; however, the developer apparently included a little story in the manual, a thing you wouldn't know to check for, that would let a person watching carefully put some of the pieces together.

I got to give a shoutout to Jenn's plot analysis at
https://steamcommunity.com/app/214700/discussions/0/792923684203713499/
it really fills in some of the details I didn't understand.

Anyway, if you liked Jazzpunk, you'll probably like this. I'm glad I bought it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066949287', 'num_games_owned': 5674, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1577263482}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013771109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1575829729}
review:
An original approach to first-person story-telling, more akin to a walking simulator than anything. It's difficult to call this a game in the conventional sense - more a vaguely interactive animation - but it's an interesting one that's worth 10-15 minutes of time.

It's not, however, worth £3.99 at all (the price at the time of writing). Even if you have more money than you know what to do with, you'd be better spending that £4 by donating it to a puppy shelter or something than paying so much for this. Get it in a bundle instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157201361', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 793, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1575438865}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965523856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1590100950}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020946141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1574285845}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983084710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1574966717}
review:
I have my problems with this game.  It's a bit expensive for what amounts to a 10-minute walking simulator, there's no real player choice, and there's no real gameplay of any kind.  All that, and yet I absolutely loved my time with it.

This game reeks style.  It's more of a short film exercise in condensed, minimalist storytelling than a real game, and it tells a gripping story: spies, heists, daring escape, betrayal... with no dialogue, whatsoever.  Everything is told through context and environment, leaving the player/audience to interpret for themselves.  My biggest problem is that there isn't more, that we only get this one short story (though Gravity Bone works as a nice companion piece).  Otherwise, definitely a worthwhile experience.

Though I recommend this game, it's definitely not for everyone.  If you're interested in "games as art" or are a game developer looking for some environmental storytelling inspiration, this game is right up your alley.  Just... maybe wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980730548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1573797490}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032496823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1450745906}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is a short movie with some minor interactive elements that attempts an abstract, character-driven heist story. Unfortunately, the 15 - 30 minutes of content is not enough to establish character motivations, relationships with one another, or much else besides what they look like or their names. So, when we experience the thrilling 3rd act climax that is usually built up to, we watch as characters that we do not know or care about attempt something crime related. 

The interesting part of this product was the discussion about what makes something a video game versus a movie or just an experience that popped up briefly when the game was released back in 2012. Can something be a game if the only mechanic is to walk forward? Can a developer achieve success selling a 15 minute experience in a game store that offers refunds for players that have less than 2 hours of playtime? Can a movie or game give its audience only a glimpse of its characters and world and let the internet bards fill in the rest? These were all interesting questions back in 2012, and our answers have certainly had an impact on the evolution of games in the years since.

Overshadowed by the questions it raised, and unable to stand on its own content, Thirty Flights of Loving will be forgotten in time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972060669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1527223893}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961690834', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1572917483}
review:
I recommend this only because Quadrilateral Cowboy is such a good game and I want to support this developer; in reality it's really a mixed review because of the price vs content. If you want to know what this is like, Gravity Bone is free (and pretty cool), so go play that first. Unfortunately, Gravity Bone is literally half this game. Including Gravity Bone, the whole experience is no more than an hour if you are taking your time and I will say that I was shocked that it was so short. That being said, it's very good and, like Quadrilateral Cowboy, it excels at telling a story with no dialog. Still, it's a cool little story and very interesting. 

Play Quadrilateral Cowboy and Gravity Bone and, if you like those, buy this game and support the developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025034874', 'num_games_owned': 5305, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1360828800}
review: An amusing piece of indie game "art" that is utterly ruined by the twin forces of its brevity and its cost.  There really isn't much here that qualifies as a video game.  It's more of a short story.  Even on sale, this game (and it barely qualifies as a "game") is questionably worth its asking price.  The full cost of $5 for what is effectively a 10 minute video is laughable.  The historical low of $1.25 should be the base price and were Thirty Flights of Loving to be discounted beyond that, it may be worth buying.  That said, it's got a decent art style and is amusing to go through ...once.  If I paid 50 cents, I might be pleased.  IIRC, I paid $1.75 and I feel ripped off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118051510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1565908889}
review:
Think: Espionage, Interactive story, Retro
Kinda Like: Jazzpunk??? Damn, there's nothing like either of these games...

After a short "tutorial" and introduction to the characters, the retro-cinematic title card punches you in the head "Thirty Flights of Loving". It looks like something straight out of the 1960s, complete with a "Blendo Games" logo, "globe" logo (Universal??) among others. Surprised there was no "CINEMARAMA" logo used. Goddamn what an awesome "intro" (Gravity Bone's is even better IMO). Brendon Chung apparently knows his cinema...

What you see behind the title is a woman, clearly shot. She's angry, she's shaking, probably close to death herself. Her gun pointed directly at you, and she's pulling the trigger when no rounds are left in the chamber.  *Click* *Click* The game starts at this point. Of course you've got questions. You pick up another person who is close to death, and you try to find your way out the area...apparently leaving the woman alone. 

Why'd I use quotations for the word "intro"? The game is short, and the intro is a large portion of this game. This is more or a less a demo of what the developer can do. Think of it as an interactive story & not so much a game. Brendon Chung is close to an EXPERT at telling a story without using dialogue, and mostly imagery. He clearly shows his skill here. Although admittedly I had to play the game a few times to get what the game was trying to convey. There's no opportunity to branch away. This "game" is clearly trying to tell a story, and funnels you toward what it wants to share. Once I figured it out...it was sad really, betrayal is a theme in lots of stories. Appreciate what the story is telling. 

That said, the game is extremely short. Admittedly I bought this on sale. At half price, this is something everyone needs to take a look at. Full price? Maybe a niche audience. I still  prefer Gravity Bone's story telling by far, but I just hope Brendon Chung and Blendo returns to this world. 

 Oh, and the cats. You may find that gentle souls love cats...not timid, but gentle. Don't ever mistake a gentle soul with that of a timid one...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971321755', 'num_games_owned': 1392, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1565752792}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081477001', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1582048076}
review:
Actual avant-garde. Reminiscent of French New Wave experiments.

Funny how it's been seven years since this game's release and the method employed here has been adopted only by [i]Paratopic[/i] and [i]Virginia[/i].

It's by no means intelligent, but to make a game so different in form if compared to the usual ones, it just had no other choice but to stick to a very simlistic story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960458094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1563799978}
review: Gravity Bone was short and sweet, and i loved the way it told a story. It was also free. 30 Flights of Loving on the other hand isn't free. I finished it in like 9 minutes or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098612102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1562734893}
review: When I played the prequel to this game, gravity bone, I thought the sequel, thirty flights of loving would be pretty similar to it. We would jump on buildings, fight bad guys, do random but fun quests, and have a fun time. But I feel Gravity bone was a lot more fun than the one I had to pay for. Thirty flights of loving wasn't full of fun quests or action packed fun, it was just walking around in different scenes that don't even make sense. I felt like I was playing a completely different game that didn't even relate to the prequel at all. I wish they put more effort into this game so it would be more fun to play and not wasting time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111405359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1562513768}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980479660', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1535214839}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059219792', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1390108446}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving is not for everyone, it is less of a "game" and more of a VERY short and linear but oddly satisfying bite-sized piece of first-person storytelling. It's a uniquely minimalistic narrative experience that I find almost poetic, It's simple but not without its elements of interpretation. The entire endeavor will last you a brisk 15 minutes or less and while I think it works for what it tries to accomplish, the length and format will make it hard for many to justify spending any amount on this title especially when knowing so little beforehand. In any case, I recommend giving Blendo Games previous project "Gravity Bone" a shot, it is available for free and serves to both complement and give you a taste of the Thirty Flights of Loving experience. Thirty Flights of Loving may, perhaps, be a more brief trip than its title seems to suggest but it’s a trip worth taking nonetheless and one that I enjoyed every step of the way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061657340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1550114389}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061914709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1561826599}
review: It's a 20 minute game with a single platforming section. After the fact I thought two things, "What would change if this was animated short instead of a videogame?" after spending 15 flights or 10 minutes thinking about it the answer was "not a whole lot" and was this worth the £2 I spent on it during the sale or would I have been happier with two ice creams...

author: {'steamid': '76561198014849103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1561712568}
review:
What would happen if you tried to make a Hollywood-style action thriller... in something like a prettier version of Minecraft... and you had to squash the whole movie to fit into about 15 minutes?

[i]Thirty Flights of Loving[/i].

It's a short, punchy story that doesn't stop rolling along once you've set it in motion, and it delivers its disjointed narrative in steady beats - kind of like a music video.

My only caveat here is that it is very, very short, and so I recommend that you buy it either on sale or not at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984823723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1506910244}
review: An amazing game. It plays like something out of inception, but with everyone's head being big block the size of a microwave.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062301817', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1559656472}
review:
This is one of the weirdest games I've ever played, and I play a lot of weird games. 

If you want an absurd walking sim, this is the game for you.

It will keep you on the edge of your seat all the way. It will make you confused and amused. The pacing is amazingly good, which is not surprising given the length of the game, but still. I usually avoid doing name-dropping, but think Kill Bill as a small indie game. 

I'm also delighted that the dev included a commentary, as well as a shorter game called Gravity Bone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013285019', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1560398611}
review: This game is just a medium for someone who wanted to tell a story. It isn't a game. It is really just you experiencing a short story. As advertised. Brief, really low quality. Not a lot going for it and not much is explained. Simple controls but you move really fast, turn fast, controls feel really messy. You're intentionally teleported around the story, very choppily and sudden. You're often not doing anything. Move forward, go back or forth in the story, get back to where you were, keep moving forward. They probably could have saved even more of their budget by not programming ASD. The 2nd game more like a game, but I can't be bothered to continue after I jumped for a pole and died. I'll live with my wasted $5, but I don't recommend that you waste $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015111872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1560270674}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972330729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1411917429}
review: I was a huge fan of the early Blendo Games mods, based on Quake 2, Goldsource and Doom 3, but this just left me baffled. The filmic montages seemed contextless and artificially strung together, and I could not understand who the characters were, their motivations or even what happened to them. It seemed to rely on some prior knowledge I did not have. While I fully endorse all attempts to push the boundaries of this medium, this was not a successful experiment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218316741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1558861400}
review: At full price this game is positively laughable. It's janky, prone to crashing, always starts up at the wrong resolution, crashes when you change options, doesn't even have crouch mapped at launch, and the gameplay and story are so short and railroaded with bare bones everything that I wouldn't consider even touching it if it was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019656379', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1553919756}
review: This isn't a game for everyone. I wouldn't even go so far as to call it a game but more of an "interactive vignette". If you liked Jazz Punk then this is a great experience and if you enjoyed Gravity Bone then this is a must have. Recommended for someone looking for something different who appreciates an entirely new experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008107842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 922, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1388846376}
review:
뒤질놈의 예술게임 붐을 일게해준 버ㅇ겜.

지들만 알만한 지들만 맘에드는 얘기를
대충 널브러놓고 이건 갬성을 전달하는 게임이니
네모네모로 대충 만들어놓아도 이해해줘야돼
게임이 짧을수도 있지만 그게 갬성이라고.

하이고 씨이발....

위에도 말했듯이 난 예술게임이라는 장르자체가
문제가 있다고 말하는게 아니다.

예술 게임이랍시고 자기뽕에 취해서는
플레이 타임같은건 생각도 안하고
게임으로서의 즐길거리같은것도 생각 안하며
일부 사람이나 이해해줄만한 자기만의 세계관을 들이밀며
그게 뭐 대단한거인양 예술이니 짧게 끝나도 돼.
이런 알량한 게임들이 문제라는거지.

이런놈들이 늘다보니까 다른놈들도
아! 나도 대충 버ㅇ싸놓고 게임이라고 우기고
대충 내 개버ㅇ철학 싸재껴놓고 설명안해도 팔리겠구나!
이러는거임. 

스토리엔 연출이나 빌드업이란게 있는데.
이런 게임들의 특징은 뭐냐면
"버ㅇ이 왜 버ㅇ일까? 그건 우리들만의 생각 아닐까?"
이딴 생각들 나열하고 예술이라 하는거임.

우린 게임을 하고싶은거라고
니들 사상팔이에 돈을 낭비하고 싶은게 아니라.
사상을 팔고싶으면 사상을 먼저 소개하고 돈을 받으라고
왜 우리가 니들 버ㅇ자랑을 돈주고 봐야되는데?

author: {'steamid': '76561198183900411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1543957044}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050157835', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1554969685}
review:
Sorry, but it's a nope from me.  After playing I read a thread interpreting what had just happened, and I was like "Oh, is that what that was about?"  Everything happens in jarring, disjointed fragments, that leap around like flashbacks.  This game likely has a very specific/niche audience. If you like really strange (or maybe artsy) games maybe try this, but otherwise probably best to give this short game a pass. 

(I'd been wanting to play this and won this game free in a giveaway.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048865581', 'num_games_owned': 2541, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1552779676}
review:
If I were blue-eyed and ignored everything about this, then I'd say this: "Thirty Flights of Loving is like a fever dream. A fever dream that's really efficient at weaving a narrative in a matter of minutes".

But this leaves so much out of it.

To start off, the game's 9 minutes long. I don't care if it's 3 minutes long, i just want a good experience. TFoL doesn't care for that though. TFoL is laziness. Here's why:

The developer made a game called "Gravity Bone". The game's in the same engine and was made years before this was made. This game's technically much more unstable. That game was free. This game costs 4.99€. That game was longer and had more gameplay elements. It also made a more coherent narrative.

The game starts in 720p every time. It doesn't keep track of your settings. 

When I saw that the game boasted about its commentary, I was pretty excited. Half-Life: Lost Coast and Deus Ex: Human Revolution both had amazing commentaries. Gabe's voice talking about the technical aspects of Half-Life; DE:HR's charming developers talking about the development process in intense detail with some of them interacting with each other once in a while, causing great banter. As long as your mic isn't terrible, I'm interested in developer's commentary. It can add new perspectives and make any game way better. Well... the developer of TFoL is a lazy bastard. It's text boxes. Well, maybe the text is interesting and useful? No, not at all. It's just him going unnecessarily off topic about boring stuff and very basic storytelling mechanics that are so obvious that it's painful to read his text that he wrote, thinking he was so clever and that he was about to blow our minds. "The slits in the planks are to show that you're high up.". Yeah, no shit, Sherlock. We know these things. We know that drawing attention to something is important. He actually even insinuated that we might not understand where we are at one point (spoiler, it was obviously the apartment of either the protagonist or the only other character in the apartment. Not to mention that it didn't even matter to the story). 
Don't make a developer's commentary if you have nothing to say. No, scratch that. The developer seems to think that we're either mentally challenged or that we're just children who picked up their first video game today. 

From that commentary, you'll also see the main issue with this game. This was a prototype at first. A prototype to the slightly longer FREE game. When he said that he didn't have the whole game together from that prototype, I burst out into a chuckle because from what he says, around 60% of the game was already done. 


When looking at the developer's site, you can see an FAQ, where there's a question along the lines of "Is there DRM?". He says there isn't, because he wants to create the best experience for the user possible. Fucking irony, isn't it? 
The game's a trashfire on the technical side. Multiple small bugs, crashes, the settings don't work and so on. 
The developer's commentary is garbage and exists for the creator to pat himself of the back for this game.
The game has no real gameplay and it's extremely basic on the side of the story too. 

The game's 4.99€. That means the developer think that this game's so good that you should pay 5€ for it. The nerve that it takes to create something so weak and meager, pretend like it's some clever game that totally has more to it than meets the eye and then ask for what is the equivalent of a full day's food or a game like Plants vs Zombies/Simulacra/QUAKE/The Binding of Isaac or even the full movie about the making of Kingdom Come (You know, actually good external developer's commentary) is fucking ridiculous. It's like a rich trust fund kid writing a book how much he worked when his dad gave him a job as Vice President in his company for 6 hours.
There was no real effort. There is no clever storytelling. There is no hidden meaning. It's surface level stuff, no matter how much you say it isn't.

Ironic... I wrote this review for longer than the game was...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960817851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1547457554}
review:
I played through this when it first came out. At the time it was an amazing take at storytelling which I had not seen before. Very innovative and artsy.

However now it seems somewhat dated and hard to recommend at 5$. I would recommend getting it at a sale just to experience it for what it is and then head on to games like Virginia and more modern takes of this kind of storytelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991367479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1547133657}
review: It's a waste. Maybe a minute longer than Gravity Bone, same gimmick. But less gameplay. But at least I know I can remove 'Quadrilateral Cowboy' from my wishlist now. If this developer had an actual bigger team and would focus on the story, and have others make some compelling gameplay, it might be great. But as is, it might as well be an animated Youtube video. Which is fine, but it doesn't need to be on Steam for 5 €uros. Or even 1,69.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052938043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1576872620}
review:
Zuerst: Ja, das Spiel ist sehr sehr kurz. Es gibt keine Möglichkeit es wirklich selbst zu beeinflussen. Es gibt keine echten Dialoge usw.... Eigentlich ist es auch gar kein richtiges Spiel.

Trotzdem kann ich es eindeutig empfehlen! Es ist wie ein kleiner Film, ein Kunstprojekt, dass eine schöne Geschichte erzählt, einen überrascht, tolle Szenen aufmacht, besondere Stimmungen erzeugt. Man muss sich nur darauf einlassen und nicht auf ein "Ziel hinspielen".
Freue mich sehr auf weitere Teile!

review:
