author: {'steamid': '76561198088029673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1439561801}
review:
Оригинальная игра (Gravity Bone) -- которая входит в комплект, но об этом не указано - даже поинтересней. Простота и решимость, оригинальная подача материала.  

Изследовав подобные произведения искусства, я всегда испытываю алкоголоидно-опиатную эндорфиновую наркоманию и опьянение. Мне не хочется думать, чтобы не разрушать созданное. как оставившее 3d-вкус полусухое вино не хочется разрушать, заедая его чем-то. Одна из тех вещей, которые могут перенести предметно-ориентированное и заведомо неправильное мышление обратно в мир тягучих образов.

Во второй же части  добавили больше экспериментов с течением игры.  Как в [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/327410/]A bird story[/url] по отношению к To The Moon. Хорошо ли это? Чтобы это стало нечто большим, эксперимент должен быть не самоцелью, родившимся в процессе создания игры либо замысленный заранее, только рожденный как преодоление поставленной сверхцели, талант создателя можно увидеть по тому, как и с какой легкостью он сам реализует поставленные казалось бы титановые сверхзадачи.

Если бы я был менее опытен, я бы разкритиковал [spoiler]неизбежный фатализм глав героев[/spoiler], но теперь я понимаю, как это не страшно. Чудность этой игрульки как раз в том, что тебе предлагают ощутить то самое, ощущение литературного героя, который не до конца ощущает замысел хозяина, но подозревает нечто потусторонннее. Это просто превосходно. И я-то понимаю, что [spoiler]смерть[/spoiler]есть вопрос стилистический, просто литературный прием, музыкальное разрешение.
Очень понравились некоторые придумки, например, представление героев. Ещё немножко больше в игре - и можно было бы разгадывать временной пузель. Либо сам главный герой видит прореху в ткани бытия, видя заранее своих соратников ранеными, либо это временная закрутка.
В данном случае этот опыт, когда тебе дают почувствовать мировоззрение резко отличающееся от своего собственного, в случае игры даже лучше, чем в случае книги, где есть связка автор-книга, а тут есть еще и играющий.
Но во второй части это ощущение слабее и не вызывает такой культурный шок, как в первой. Поэтому ставлю лайк за первую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006541362', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1436680391}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is the best answer to the question "How much narrative can you fit into a 15 minutes time frame?".
You'll spend those 15 minutes as an unnamed member of a team preparing an heist and excaping from it.
Also included, once you complete the game, is the first game "Gravity Bone" where you play as a spy in two different missions.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-charming graphics and art style

-top notch soundtrack

-extremely good story told in a condensed and non-linear way

-quirky sense of humour

-"Gravity Bone" is just as good and gives you 15 more minutes of gameplay

[b]CONS:[/b]

-very short and linear

-while the soundtrack is very nice the sounds (guns, vehicles etc..) are unimpressive

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=479957749 

The fact that, once it was over, I wished it'd have been longer, a full game, is a testament to the game's top notch narrative. But perhaps its power truly lies in how well it tells a story and engages you as a player in such a short time.

The game is indeed very short, linear and with little replay value but it'd be experienced at least once as a token of great storytelling: I agree the full price is too much for what it offers but it's absolutely worth it when on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979093805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1436609599}
review: So cool!

author: {'steamid': '76561198158075287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1436153349}
review:
It's not a "game", but more or less a self-contained television episode or short film. If you keep that in mind, I think you'll be pleasently surprised just how well the story is presented, despite very little in actual text and voice accting on par with the adults from Charlie Brown (seriously, everyone talks like "Waaah wahh wah wah wah").

I've seen better stories in games, but I don't think I've played a game yet that has told a story like this, without using any words.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031443418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1388271372}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving, as well as the accompaying Gravity Bone, aren't so much what I'd call video games, strictly speaking. Rather, they are interactive narratives, focusing not so much on the common aspects of gameplay and agency, and instead on the tools of exploration only really available to the gaming medium in order to tell their stories. A lot is left to the player's imagination, but there's just enough context to present something cogent and engaging. Aesthetically, I love this, with both its references to old-school espionage films and reliance on simple modular design. I recommend this strictly to experience this type of storytelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034675822', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1366182000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043396711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1347087600}
review:
Wow... Just Wow... why was this game bolstered to be a magnificent art peice?  None of the game play is coherent much less entertaining...  I would not recommend this game to anyone as it does not seem to have a purpose nor original collected story with which to even begin to form some cogent semblance of gameplay.

The Game rushes you into a heist... or is it a cocktail party? its tarantino-not vignettes are fast and non-sensical. they do culminate... but into what? Nothing of substance... then, when you think the sweet reward of death will come... you are greeted with a bizarre lesson in... physics? 

  No fun here. I would run screaming and lick my wounds playing a classic of the golden age if I were you... Willy Beamish, Deus Ex, or the high res warmth of HD Final Fantasy VII.  Just don't want to think about Thirty Flights.... anything but that....

author: {'steamid': '76561198052471232', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1426896181}

author: {'steamid': '76561198087382371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1381514760}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018502464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review: Unlike many "cinematic" games that are obsessed with copying film, I think Thirty Flights pulls off a movie-like pace and editing style better than any other game I've seen. And I think that's what this game was: an experiment in using the schizophrenic yet calculated timeline and editing of a Tarantino film (for example) and making it work within a video game boundary. It sounds pretentious, but at the end of the day, it's an interesting look at how we can tell stories in video games and that's most definitely a positive (and sorely needed) effort in our medium.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961699643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1662530699}
review:
I understand why some feel cheated by this game, but I didn't at all. It's a genuinely brilliant demonstration of how you can use snappy editing in games to tell a story that is thrilling, violent, funny, romantic, tense, wistful and tragic - and somehow manage all of that in ten minutes. I've gone back to it (and Gravity Bone) several times, just marvelling at all the fabulous little touches.

Worried about the price? Fine: wishlist it, wait till it's on sale, you'll pay the price of a cup of coffee for something far more memorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016558234', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1434227329}
review:
Well, that was weird. There are a lot of neat details and interesting characters in this "game", but most of the gameplay comes in deciphering what's going on and what one has experienced after the actual game is over. It is a work of strange art that would not be out of place as an installation piece in a MOMA... just don't expect particularly compelling gameplay, intricate puzzles, or most of all longevity.

If you can find this on sale for 0.99 or so, or even 50% off, it would be worth it just for the experience. It's just not for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017271295', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1382788499}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041084889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1434101832}
review:
It's intresting as all hell and has some simple and elegant design decisions, that add up to a well told story, and some inventive ways of looking at narrative delivery. Wouldn't call it a masterpiece but I sure got my moneys worth just trying to decipher the thing. At the very least it felt good giving money to this guy since Gravity Bone and his other Citizen Abel games were free and I got atom zombie smasher as part of a bundle.

Sometimes the amount of time you play something and the amount of time you can spend thinking about something aren't directly porportional to each other. This is one of those times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041876677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review: I played through this game twice because I thought I had missed something and lost. I hadn't, there is basically no gameplay whatsoever. If you notice, my playtime is 23 minutes. That's for 2 complete playthroughs. If you understand the value of a dollar, pass on this game. You may as well go to your local theatre and watch a 2-hour film for 5 bucks, I can guarantee you can find one with a better story and presentation than what Thirty Flights of Loving brings to the table.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033159562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1431281807}
review:
[h1]A disappointing follow-up.[/h1]

I was a really big fan of Gravity Bone, and so I bought this game even though I knew it would be short. However, while the length did not disappoint,the game did. Compared to Gravity Bone, Thirty Flights Of Loving focuses more on trying to tell a story and ends up jumping around a lot in time and space and features more interactions with non-player characters. Unlike Gravity Bone, which had at least a few jumping puzzles, there is really no challenge at all to the game. The story also feels much less player-driven: as I mentioned before, it jumps around a lot in time instead of allowing the player to explore and experience the game at their own pace.

Not worth $5.

If you haven't played Gravity Bone, the original game, I implore you to check it out. It's a really cool, mysterious game that does a lot in a short time. And it's free to download at the Blendo Games website.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048565955', 'num_games_owned': 1320, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1431244661}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035581377', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1384005574}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998273415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1381993283}
review:
[b]⊕[/b]It’s a nice-looking game placed in a cool era+setting. I found the characters to be memorable, if only in role rather than name. The story is interesting once it's broken down for you or played through multiple times. It's the Momento style of story-telling, not just a random series of events that some are making it out to be. There is a fleshed-out poignant tale buried somewhere under the condescension.

[b]⊖[/b] My overall time played was accrued through more than one playthrough. It is VERY short. For having such an interesting story, it's poorly told. The artsy factor actually detracts from the experience in this aspect. It would have been much better if the story to have been expanded upon, but I feel that's not what they were going for, for the sake of brevity. Unfortunately, a lack of any consequence makes it little more than a walking simulator that blows right by over the course of ten minutes or so.

[b]✎[/b] This game is not worth $5.s it a travesty upon gaming? A sin that cannot be redeemed? Is it the worst thing that has ever stolen the money of players everywhere? No. It's just an overpriced art game, so calm down and stop giving it so much hate for the sake of cheap comedy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051507840', 'num_games_owned': 1675, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1526407234}
review: Thirty flights of loving is a shell, the sort of game that looks artistic but really does nothing more. The way the story is set out it appears to be hiding something, some jucy story piece or message but it just isn't, peel back the outer layers and there's just nothing. Hollow set linear pieces that bearly constitute gameplay disguised as art and nothing more. Who can blame the guy? The proffessional reviewers ate it up like candy, not wanting to be the one to point out the fact that there was just nothing. A clear case of the emperors new clothes

author: {'steamid': '76561198098257938', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1425242036}
review:
"Большие Идеи портят кино. В кино самое главное — сделать хорошее кино. И если в процессе работы тебе в голову придет идея, это отлично. Но это не должна быть Большая Идея, это должна быть маленькая идея, из которой каждый вынесет что-то свое. Я имею в виду, что если ты снимаешь кино о том, что война — это плохо, то зачем тогда вообще делать кино? Если это все, что ты хочешь сказать, — скажи это. Всего два слова: война — это плохо. То есть всего три слова. Хотя два слова будет еще лучше: война — плохо." - Квентин Тарантино (к слову об этой игре)

TFofL - игра-кино,боевик и драма,экшен и чёрный юмор. Всё это предстаёт для нас в виде фильмов Тарантино,хотя этот фильм исключение - смотрится за 5 минут! Да,эту игру можно пройти за пару минут и она успеет показать нам всё.

Сюжет: Трое героев собрались провернуть большое ограбление и что из этого вышло. Так-же тут есть ещё одна игра про агента в стиле Бонда и что случилось с ним.

Графика: Типо мультик,с персонажами которых можно распечатать на бумагу,а после вырезать и сделать фигурки. Ну знаете,есть такие...которые вырезал,да. Остальное держится на уровне,в некоторых местах я был разочарован. Однако локации интересные.

Геймплей: W,S,A,D + Е,ПРОБЕЛ,ЛКМ. А большего и не надо! Это же кино. В некоторых местах можно взаимодействовать с предметами и объектами,например: взять мандаринку,почистить, съесть со вкусным звуком,после которого самому хочется. Остальное происходит само,мы лишь отчасти принимаем участие.

Саундтрек: Аля Тарантино,а в других местах музыка напоминала старые фильмы. Звуки хороши,для такого всё ок.

Итог: Если вы знакомы с творчеством Тарантино или просто классических боевиков,то советую ознакомиться. Не шедевр,но годно. Я мало чего могу объяснить,просто это нужно самому пройти. 

[h1]Моя оценка:[/h1] [b]7 из 10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041944840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1425017395}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving and its predecessor, Gravity Bone, are both wonderfully quirky adventures of espionage made by Blendo Games. I recommend them as experiences but that is all they are. They hardly qualify as games so I wouldn't pay full price for them. Gravity Bone was originally available as a free download on the Blendo Games website. While it was short, it had some minor gameplay elements. It had the use of items and some minor platforming but ,overall, the game felt like a tech demo. It felt like it was only a sample of what was to come. So when Thirty Flights of Loving was released I assumed that it would be a full length game with more items, more locations, more vague Gravity Bone spy story, and more platforming, puzzle solving, etc. But Thirty Flights of Loving has even less gameplay. You more or less walk through the story with little to no interaction. While it was a fun experience, I don't believe that it is something that should be advertised and sold as a game. It should have been released for free alongside Gravity Bone on the Blendo Games website.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004277022', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1424218790}
review:
I didn't understand what I was playing during my first playthrough, which took like 15min, then I did another one with dev commentary. I found the second playthrough really helpful because it explains some parts of the game, what the creator tried to convey, what problems he encountered during development and he also gives some advice on game/level design.

Overall, this game is quite special because you basically go from point A to point B, you get teleported suddenly between sections and there are no connections between those. I liked the included prequel (Gravity Bone) way more than Thirty Flights of Loving because it had objectives.

5$ is a bit pricey though since you're probably going to play it for like 1h and never play it again.

ps: don't bother with the advanced video settings unless you're a 3D programmer ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994321880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1367823600}
review:
Originally an early prototype for Blendo Games’s Gravity Bone, TFOL is difficult to classify within traditional gaming genres. Is it an adventure game, an action game, an art game, or an elegiac love poem? Well, it’s all of these and none. 30 Flights is an indie gamer's indie game. It occupies the same experimental vein as Proteus, The Path, and Journey. I know that may scare some of you off, but it shouldn’t. TFOL is basically a slick crime caper gone awry. Like Reservoir Dogs? You’ll probably enjoy this.

As one comes to expect from indie indies, TFOL features simple graphics, quirky humor, an innovative yet enigmatic narrative structure, and great music. Despite its age, the Quake 2 engine has never looked this good. The blocky retro-visual style is utterly charming: think Minecraft meets No One Lives Forever.

Thirty Flights of Loving focuses its sharp satirical lens on the over-the-top cinematism rife in video games and their tendency to imitate big-budget Hollywood Action movies. But it is also a powerful and moving homage to the stylish, discontinuous narration of French New Wave films. The game has often been compared to the work of Tarantino, but both the plot and razor sharp editing owes more to the formal innovations of Jean-Luc Godard's seminal film, A bout de souffle. 

Much of the central game experience involves trying to piece together its intricately crafted story. Temporal and spatial leaps await the player at every turn. Brendon Chung has a knack for capturing the gritty underworld vernacular that our anti-heroes inhabit. Interspersed throughout the game are moments of transcendent beauty. In one, Anita sits peeling oranges overlooking her vast apartment courtyard. The sound is particularly used to great effect here, realistically capturing the nocturnal soundscape of a large urban metropolis. In the climactic gunfight, the action recalls the poetic rhythm of Koyaanisqatsi and Baraka. Without relying on dialogue text, voiceover narration, or UI, Brendon Chung manages to convey an entire world and story through the environment.

To what degree any of this makes sense depends on the player’s perception. What exactly went down at Cugat airfield? Who is Winston Borges (a.k.a. Mo Golden, Moco Rococo, The Big Pai-Goo)? Is Bernoulli’s Principle the key to unlocking this puzzle? These are just some of the many questions you’ll ask yourself in 30 Flights of Loving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047383681', 'num_games_owned': 1403, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1389439209}
review:
Looked promising and interesting when I saw the screenshots. Finally got it for half-price in the sales (IDK £4 seemed a bit steep) so I was really excited when I got to play it. I started it up and was like "Ooh this is interesting..." and then again two minutes later "Um I don't really get it but it's going somewhere right..."

And then five minutes later it was over. FIVE MINUTES OF GAMEPLAY (Not inc. the 15 minute game you can get for free from the intertwebz). At half-price it still wasn't worth it. Nowhere near!

Potentially an interesting concept/ story, rushed into a tiny, meaningless prototype thingy.

At the very least this game should be free.

Tl;dr: I want my £1.99 back.

Thirty Flights of Loving 9 / 10

A five minute Quentin Tarantino game/movie;  
An interactive movie trailer between Pumpkin and Honey Bunny;  

Yeah no sh*t -  this lasts only five minutes; so I played it ten times for a total of 50 minutes hoping to get some Steam Cards.... (warning - did not work : p)

Do you make games?  You figure out how to fit something like this into your game as an Interlude and Bingo you have a Hit within a Hit;  hilarious and intense potential. 

Check this out....

author: {'steamid': '76561198080097474', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1420349211}
review: While the game IS fun, and the art style is one that I enjoyed, for the price it is not worth it. It costs about half the price of a movie ticket, and you can beat it in less that 20 minutes. I in-depth played it (Stopping to read all the cards, payed extra attention to the environments, and tried to explore best I could, etc.) AND played through a second time on commentary mode, only to find myself clocked in at a little less than an hour. I wish  the game were a lot longer and offered a lot more. It's a great story, but for 5 dollars you should just watch it on youtube.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037654546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review:
For the love of God, do not buy this game.

The game can literally be beaten in around 20 - 30 minutes. Now, one might argue that the game is still enjoyable for the "art" or "story", but the game has neither that are exceptional. You can try to dissect some hidden meanings or interpret the vague ending anyway you want, but there is NOTHING there. This is the type of game that's left ambiguously vague because the creator is just uncreative and is taking advantage of dumb people. The game has NO replay value. It isn't a short and quick game because there is no game at all. It's not like a quick arena game that's addicting and you want to replay, no, it's nothing of the sort. And as I mentioned before, it isn't even a game that you'd want to replay to see if you can interpret the deep and powerful meaning behind the game's story. I will now write out the entire game to you right now.

You walk down some stairs into a bar.
Two guys just stare at you. You can't talk to them.
You smash a few bottles to try and intice a response. The two guys continue to stare and not care.
You go into a "hidden" door to your secret base where you meet your two best companions.
Staring female and staring male. Interacting with them shows two soundless cutscenes (approx 30 seconds long) of their "professions".
Their professions imply they are thieves and are about to make a heist of sorts with you.
You can pick up some guns and ammunition on the tables. This does nothing at all. You're essentially clicking them to make them disappear.
You go into a plane.
Scene changes instantly.
Oh no, your best friend, staring guy, is bleeding on the ground.
You push him around an airport in a cart because you're weak and can't carry him.
The airport is crowded with rejected minecraft characters that ignore your prescence and walk through you.
Flashback to you and staring girl in an apartment. Implications you two are in love.
You walk up a stairwell. There are more staring people on the rooftop having drinks.
You sit with staring girl.
Scene changes instantly.
You go back to pushing your dying best friend, staring guy, around in the airport.
You get a gun suddenly and shoot birds(?) out of the air. (THIS IS THE ONLY GAMEPLAY IN THE GAME ASIDE FROM WALKING AND THERE IS NO CONSEQUENCE IF YOU DO NOT SHOOT THE WHITE BIRD THINGS. YOU HAVE NO AMMO. NOTHING MATTERS.)
You get into a car with staring guy. The car drives by itself.

The end.

You beat the game goodjob. Yes, it was 30 minutes even with taking your time. Yes, that was the whole game. Yes, you paid ten dollars. Yes, that's all you're getting. Yes, you didn't miss anything or unlock anything. You're still going to replay it out of disbelief of being ripped of so hard, aren't you? Okay, go for it. ...You back? Yes, that was indeed it. No, I agree. It wasn't profound and it didn't change your life. Yes, I'm upset with it too. Yes, it is odd how people are actually recommending this game. No, I don't think there is a coincidence that it is mostly tumblr beasts raving about how good the game is. Yes, I agree that we can only hope God gives them a quick and painless death and takes their blogs with their souls to hell.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME

author: {'steamid': '76561197973086896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1356163200}
review: Don't expect to get an actual game if you buy this. It's more of a random series of events that you're forced to move through. It's artistic...maybe? The short game "Gravity Bone" that comes with it is a lot more fun than Thirty Flights of Loving. All in all, about 5 minutes of game play. Definitely not worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997936496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1417854058}
review:
I loved it!
There's basically no game here, but it's packed with a crazy amount of love and thoughtfullness. It's a 10 minute story that really draws an atmosphere. TFOL also includes Gravity Bone, which is some sort of prequel to this game. Loved them both.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992620025', 'num_games_owned': 962, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1427089436}
review:
Note: This version contains a slightly improved version of Gravity Bone (the previous game in the series).

Thirty Flights of Loving is a fantastic example of taking techinques from other media and applying them to games, but within the context of what games do well. Heavy with smash cuts, it relies on the player's tendency to adapt to unclear circumstances and lets you figure out what's happening an run along to keep up with the brief (and mostly indirect) story.

A must play for any designer because of its unique take on narrative, it's also a fun (and short) game for anyone interested in something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112343503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1405539955}
review: Introduced to this game by Odd_Bucket and found it very enjoyable. Strange and colourful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067486026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1416454328}
review: I was really interested after playing the quick demo and prequel Gravity Bone. I loved the art style and gameplay as it was similar to Jazzpunk which is a game I really enjoyed. But after the 30 minute gameplay to complete not just Thirty Flights of Loving but replay Gravity Bone I am really wondering where my 5 dollars went. This game would be really cool, interesting, and well worth it if the game had more sustenence. Instead it just felt like a simple tech demo with really great ideas but lacked what was necessary to back it up. It would be really great if this was released as an alpha and the developer treated it as episodic adding new content every few months but unfortunately that won't happen. Maybe I'm missing something, maybe I am comparing it to Jazzpunk too much, but I am pretty disappointed in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069726109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1382835431}
review:
I'm going to start by saying I LOVED Gravity Bone, the "prequel" to this. Gravity bone had exploration, challenges and gameplay. Thirty flights of loving has none of this, as other people have said it is a "interactive" movie. Well the only interaction is with the W key to walk forward, If you like linear "tunnel" gameplay then maybe it's you're type of game. The transitions between sections are the worst jumps of any game and create a confusing and chaotic experience. 
More work was put into the end credits area and the "how aircraft work" section, I'm not kidding a whole room is dedicated to showing how air flows over wings and what creates lift, Really if I wanted a game about planes I would play Flight simulator X or IL2. Overall this game lets down its prequel, if you want an interesting gameplay experience play Gravity Bone, or chess
I understood the story and it still disappointed me and left me feeling ripped off.
2/10 nice music

author: {'steamid': '76561198116492609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1585658165}
review: TFOL no es un videojuego, es una experiencia, un experimento narrativo breve pero intenso. Apenas hay interacción, apenas hay desafió pero saldrás completamente fascinado. Para aquellos que disfrutaron del dolor de cabeza que les produjo The Stanley Parable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061356849', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1463324738}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960446959', 'num_games_owned': 699, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1643073399}
review:
If you're the sort of person who doesn't like a movie when the ending is ambiguous, don't buy 30FoL.

If you like games that let you increase arbitrary numbers so they are higher than other peoples' arbitrary numbers, don't buy 30FoL.

If you like examining your preconceptions about what a "game" is and enjoy narratives that require the cooperation of the audience, then bring your lunch to work tomorrow and spend that money on 30FoL instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035806796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1414380261}
review:
Let me start off by saying this is much less a game than it is an art piece.

Thirty Flights of Loving takes you on a short and wonderfully confusing journey through dramatic and intense sequences. It took me about 10 minutes to beat, but the developer commentary gave me insight into the process of developing the game. 

It feels very personal, and when it ends it leaves you wanting more, but having more would potentially spoil the experience.

If you're looking for a short artsy game with a story that you have to work for, then consider checking this out. If you have it in your Steam library and haven't played it yet, give it the 10 minutes of your time it asks for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965372374', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1388291348}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995690653', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1404137521}
review:
[i]I literally regret all the 149 cents I've spent on "this". Not because of the small amount of money I've spent. I regret I've supported, even a little, a developer like that.[/i]

Look, I LOVE arthouse. I love games without traditional gameplay (visual novels or whatever they are called). I love The Path, I love Dear Easther, I love The Stanley Parable, I love The Vanishing of Ethan Carter.
BUT THIS. Critics claim it's brilliant, 'cause it doesn't present you linear nor transparent storyline, so you have to decide all the plot and intrigue for yourself.
I don't have problems with the plot, my problem is that those claims are lies. This "game"... Geez, I can't name it nor "game" nor "visual novel" in fact. Ok, this "thing" doesn't even trying to do something good. Like, literally, I can't see the developer trying to be good in any aspect of this... "thing".
Graphics, animations, sound design etc. are not intentionally simplistic, they simply lack any art style or tech, programming is horrible. In the most horrible sense possible. [b]That leaves you with a story... Except all those "visual novel" games I love tear their asses to present the story in most beautiful, unusual and most memorable way. And this "thing" not even trying.[/b] Supposedly intentionally, but in fact, because of untalented developer who couldn't make any idea.
It's not Malevich's Black Square. It's simply a square. Not even sure it's black. [b]It's pseudo art.[/b]
In developer commentaries it was said, that the scene with floating objects was initially bug, but dev decided to make it a part of the "game". Well, the WHOLE damn "game" is like that, in fact. SOLID BUG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040658846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1454378185}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046911850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1357200000}
review: Colorful, elliptical, and a rare example of a game that takes genuine influence from cinema, rather than rummaging through its dumpster. It's best seen first-hand than explained (it's very brief).  While the ambitious pull a hammy trying to create gaming's CITIZEN KANE, Brendon Chung created what could be its HOLY MOTORS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060821109', 'num_games_owned': 1214, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1359532800}
review:
I really enjoyed the experience of playing Thirty Flights of Loving, but know what you are getting in to. It's a really interesting narrative, but I almost think it would have been better suited as a short film than an interactive experience as it's completely linear and you aren't really adding anything by being in control of the character because there are very few things to interact with.

But that being said, the presentation is great. The art direction is compelling, Chris Remo provides another great soundtrack, and the scene right after the open credits got to me more than any AAA game I can think of. I wish it was a little bit longer (about 15 minutes) and include a bit more interaction, but it's still an absolutely worthwhile experience. Although if I'm being honest, when I wanted to play it again a few months later, I ended up just watching a YouTube playthrough because it's almost the exact same thing and I didn't have to fire up Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011225420', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1356854400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033868502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1399805784}
review:
I wouldn't really call this a game in the literal sense, despite having some game elements. But rather consider it more as an artistic piece accompanied by a great story. The mixed reviews certainly show the confusion behind this, as it really does come down to how one interprets this. 

If you have expectations on what this is, throw them out the window before getting this. In many ways this is ahead of it's time, fusing artistic expression as an interactive piece. 

I hope to see more of this style on Steam in future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997388394', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1345618800}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970644409', 'num_games_owned': 6457, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1350630000}
review:
[h1]Short, Sweet, Bloody, Like![/h1]
Rating : Great

Short game that is told in scenes in a asynchronous way. 

Blendo games is known for releasing games that take radical different approach to story telling and does this again in this game. It's like you watch the most important pieces of a movie shuffled around. The game has some activity where you have to walk and solve some easy puzzles (?) to advance, but other than that it is just enjoying the scenery, trying to understand and connect the story.

The game was build in a modified Doom engine using a typical style which totally fits the game mechanics. Audio and soundtrack are great and fit the game perfectly.

You can speed run this game in 5 minutes I think, but normally when you relax and enjoy the game it should take about 30 minutes. Because the story is so jumpy, it invites you to play it again just to look at the parts again. 

In the end the game reminds you that a game doesn't have to be long to be good and that a story can also be told by leaving out all the unnecessary parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985691188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1404579868}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996544387', 'num_games_owned': 1018, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1345878000}
review:
It does some interesting things in trying to tell a story in a non-linear way, using techniques you find in film like cutting backward and forward in time. Unfortunately, it ends up being a lot like a film, you have very little impact on anything, you just hold W  to move forward until the next scene is triggered. 

There's nothing in this game that you couldn't experience just as well by watching a Let's Play video.

review: Very much a case of the emperours new clothes as far a games go. This is an art film masquerading as a game. There's so little to it in terms of meaningful interactivity and it's so short in terms of play-time that it's hard to recommend it  versus watching a lets play. Certainly there's a story there, and the art style as used in Chungs earlier 'Gravity Bone' is endearing, but it's a curio at the end of the day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970064749', 'num_games_owned': 5475, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review: Thirty Flights Of Loving is an 'art' game which means there isn't much to do and terribly short. Although the 'game' got some interesting parts, no one should pay 5 euro for a 10 min demo. That's right you complete this demo in 10 minutes. So would i recommend to play it? If it was free yes but sadly that's not the case.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025067675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1409567655}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving ist weniger ein Spiel als vielmehr ein interaktiver Kurzfilm von gut einer viertel Stunde Länge (ohne Entwicklerkommentar und Nebenstory, wohl gemerkt!). Dabei überzeugt der minimalistische Stil durch beispielsweise das nicht Vorhandensein von Dialogen und setzt deswegen umso mehr auf verschiedenste Stilmittel wie Rückblenden und Zeitsprünge etc. Besonders zu Erwähnen ist die musikalische Untermalung, die der sowieso charmanten Präsentation seine eigene Note verleiht.
Knapp 5€ sind sicherlich zu viel Geld für knapp 1 1/2 Stunden Gesamtspielzeit (inklusive Nebenstory/Entwicklerkommentar), doch wer auf der Suche nach einer interaktiven Geschichte ist, die einen zum Nachdenken animiert, der sollte getrost zuschlagen. Die Erfahrung TFoL möchte ich nicht missen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961551681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1410040497}
review:
More-so episodic art than anything else, with vidyah games as the medium.

I really dug both this and Gravity Bone. It plays like being in an art-house Tarentino style crime caper. It's a nice break from the cookie cutter style gameplay found in the majority of modern games. 

Playful, artsy, stylized, beautiful music, and generally all around good throw-back style puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075061528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1410019441}
review: Disappointed! After two playthroughs, the first of which i was wondering if my computer was skipping frames by the millions, I must conclude that this is a cross-cutting bit of a mess.  It's a shame if professional critics can't see through this here emperor's new clothes. Perhaps it's a result of reviewing all too many similar games that makes this seem like best thing since sliced bread for game journalists.  I suppose if you're into (slightly) interactive art installations with nice music and confusing jumps back and forth in time this could be worth a try. For anyone else it's a bit of a waist of time, sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019862517', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1648933716}
review:
Thirty Flights of Game Design:

I you are into more modern games that force-feed you story, you probably won't like this game. It takes a quite different approach by explaining the plot through small chunks of information, forcing the player to piece together the events that happen. The result of this is a confusing and interesting series of small levels that  continue the plot. This game is meant to be a ride more than a game I would say, though there are game elements involved through small objectives or the possibility of death.

For five dollars, this game is an interesting experience. I wasn't sure what to think when I beat it, but I liked that feeling. All I can say is that if you are a fan of interesting game design, you must play this game. If not, meh, I enjoyed it a lot. I think it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983313439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1405272071}
review:
Brilliant, as long as you know what you're getting...

First and foremost this is more a short interactive story than a game, there's not a lot of player input. The game mainly consists of moving from one scene to the next with story unfolding through jumpcuts. Now if "short interactive story" hasn't put you off already than buy this game, granted for 5 euro it may seem steep, you'll get through it in about 15 minutes the first time.

As a story this is incredibly well put together, you'll play through it the first time and kind of know what's going on, and then you'll probably end up playing through it maybe 2 to 3 times more as you try to figure out the sequence of events. Plus the games wacky art style and music are more than worth the price of admission. I'm honestly a huge fan of this game.

On a side it comes with the prequel "Gravity Bone" which is also awesome and features the same type of style, so there's two reasons to buy it. However you can download "Gravity Bone" from the net for free and "test run" how you feel about this type of game if you're nervous about spending the 5 euro. But honestly I'd recommend buying this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056015562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1408549829}
review:
Spiel? Film? Kunst? Ich weiß es nicht, aber es hat mich verblüfft und beeindruckt zurück gelassen. Über die Grafik gibt es nicht viel zu sagen. Alles ist eckig, ähnlich wie bei Minecraft. Aber irgendwie schafft es das spiel eine unglaubliche Stimmung aufzubauen. Anfangs weiß man überhaupt nicht was los ist, oft springt man plötzlich an einen anderen Ort, zu einer andern Zeit. Daher fühlt es sich an wie ein Film in dem man den Hauptdarsteller steuert.
Ich kann nichts schlechtes über das "Spiel" sagen. Die meisten werden es eh über das HumbleBundle bezogen haben. Wenn es seit  dem noch nicht angefasst wurde, würde ich empfehlen es endlich zu tun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147960255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1546370566}
review:
First of all, the gameplay is roughly 2 hours long, if you give it a chance and play through a few times, check out the prequel, and take a stroll through the director's commentary. 

This game seems to be about the past. This is not only conveyed through the signs on the wall telling you to "Forget," but through the fact that the mechanics tell you to move forward, and yet the game sends you elsewhere in most unexpected ways. You get a glimpse at marriage, the gunslinger life, death, regret, and drunken ecstasy. But it's only the attention to detail that makes it work.

Yeah, this game should be cheaper since most players will only play TFoL once without checking out the pprequel which is included with the purchase. But it's trying something new. So take notice, and then assess its success or failure accordingly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042380931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1413001730}
review: What can i say about this game that the trailer doesn't say. this game is quite possibly the most action-packed game of this century, there are so many conflicts in this game so many loving characters, so much character developement within this game that is only 5 bucks! There are mininal amount of words that can describe the depth to what is game is carrying out do yourself a favor and buy it it's an emotional roller coaster that will leave you in tears and will also make you laugh at times , The only problem i have with this game is that there are not even close to thirty flights and the only loving in the game is when you fuck the brains out of this chick. Although with the tragic ending there is i suppose it tells you that love is the only thing eternal and we only have a small amount of time before we die so live it up and never look back 5/5 must buy game of the century. This game will teach you what love truly is, what friendship truly is, and what courage truly is. out of the the 40 times i've played this game it has made me cry almost everytime i've played it is just such a good game i CANNOT stress this enough i need another one of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018161255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1358064000}
review: 게임의 극적 구성, 상황 조성 등이 일품이다. 제작자의 연출이 돋보이는 작품. 트레일러로도 확인할 수 있듯이 13분 내외에 '게임'이라고 할 수 있는 부분이 끝난다. 전작인 Gravity Bone도 포함되어 있는데, GB는 그나마 '게임'이라고 할 수 있는 플레이어의 조작이나 그런 게 있는 반면 TFOL은 그런 게 더 없다. 그래서 나도 전작을 해보고 이번 작을 할 때 뭔가 더 허무한 느낌이 있었는데 제작자의 코멘터리를 보면서 이 순간에서 이런 생각, 고민을 했구나 하는 걸 되뇌며 나도 무언가 장면을 연출할 때에 유익할 것 같다는 생각이 들었다. 순수히 "슈팅 게임"을 하려고 하는 사람들은 굳이 살 필요가 없을 것이다. 나는 이럴 줄 알고 샀고 의외로 얻는 게 있어서 좋았다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050219817', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1387059104}
review:
The problem with this game is that it's actually good, but it's so short, that by the time you start to like it, it ends. After I played the free prequel (Gravity Bone) I bought this thinking "that must be a full fledged game ambiented like Gravity Bone", but I honestly felt cheated. In reality this game felt even shorter and less fun than the free prequel.

Gravity Bone had some stuff resembling puzzles where you needed to think what to do, but this didn't improve or expand on that at all, and actually cutted back on that, to the point it almost felt like a short film instead of a game.
The good points about this game are the ambience, the story and the music.

Maybe if you group this together with Gravity Bone you have something close to better length.

In conclussion I would play the shit out of a full game ambiented like these games, but this felt like a demo.
Hopefully some day...

author: {'steamid': '76561198119521516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1435019602}
review: It's an art project. It's also really short, (like 30 minutes total). It's also linear and doesn't include much gameplay except picking up syrup and walking. It's also really amazing. It's has an interesting concept, amazing music, and beautiful art. Also, if you want an arthouse game, get this one. It's no were near as pretentious as Dear Esther. Even the NAME Dear Esther is pretentious! So, if you have a couple extra bucks lying around, get this. If you go into this game expecting an action-packed spy thriller, you might be disappointed, but this game is presented better than any game I played, and it doesn't try to be what it's not. Definately get this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046837740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1405172996}
review:
Not worth the price of admission, you would be better off putting that 5 bucks towards the stanley parable if you want a good example of a narrative story driven game. This is just a mess, the pacing is horrible, the jarring jumpcuts distract you from the gameplay (i'm all for transistions to scenes, but when they are done like they are here, they are just offputting)

The story is a basic crime caper gone wrong that is a 12 minute walking simulator, I had more fun in the options menu and the prequel that was added to this game for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037550080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1471109751}
review: Fascinating storytelling. Really well done. It's very short, but if you like games that experiment a lot with narrative and storytelling techniques, definitely check it out. Also, Brendon Chung's previous game, Gravity Bone, is included with this, and you should check that one out too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052314573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1405125836}
review: The game only has one flight in it. 1/30

author: {'steamid': '76561198071701208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1405080996}
review: I'm all about experimental gaming and narrative-dedicated games, but Thirty Flights of Loving is too short and abstract to be meaningful. It attempts to play off its poor, blocky graphics as "stylized." I would be fine with paying this much money for a 15 minute game if it featured a meaningful, elaborate narrative. Sadly, it comes off as unfocused, choppy, and incoherent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121201587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1405063988}
review: An interesting experiment, but not worth $4.99.  I understand on some level why it got such high reviews, but from the standpoint of someone coming into it expecting to play a game, I was disappointed.  As the player, I did not have any real sense of agency as the game hurried me through series of strange, loosely connected events toward the all too fast approaching end.  At least in the prequel, Gravity Bone, there was some exposition and I had items I was able to use to interact with the environment.  It was sparse, but there were game mechanics there.  This is less of a game to be played, and more of a very short expressionist film to be watched.  If you come expecting an interactive story, you will be disappointed.  Thirty Flights of Loving is more akin to the experience of visiting a particularly short house of illusions at a carnival.  You can only go one linear direction, it's confusing, disorienting, and by the time you get out you feel slightly cheated for having spent as much money as you did on such a mediocre experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095434719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1404662431}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089897834', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1381959252}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993548268', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review:
This is a very niche title that unfortunately the game critics fell in love with.
Thirty Flights of Loving is a non-linear, no-dialogue "game" that tells a rather simple story in a manner that came across to me as self-indulgant.  
This is not Memento.  Instead this is 28 Grams.  It is a trivial story where the designer said to himself "Wouldn't I be brilliant if I just threw all of the information at the player at random!  Yes!  Yes I would be brilliant!"
You can finish the game in under 15 minutes.  I have a hard time even calling it a game because it has less interaction than Dear Esther or Gone Home.  It also doesn't have any of the actual story elements or choices that usually accompany a visual novel.  It is more of an esoteric experiment.
There are people who will love this game.  The ones that "get" it will be head over heels about it and consider the designer as brilliant as he clearly considers himself to be.
Everyone else should stay far, far away.

Personal opinion: 1/10
This is the kind of game that you tell your friends about just to make fun of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128545945', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1404539763}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971043004', 'num_games_owned': 3063, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review: This is not a game, it's not even a story, it's a tech demo at most for what could potentially be an acceptable game or story. The metacritic reviews on this title seem to think it's already awesome, but I officially think the critics are all high on something to believe this is worthy of a score over 70. There are way better games out there for $4.99 or less, and you shouldn't spend more than $1 on this, if anything at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038866086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1399382403}
review: Short? Yes. Dialogue? None. Still one of the best stories I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964306170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1408929208}
review:
Know what you are in for. This game is very short (20-30 minutes) but at the same time very unique and experimental in the way it uses games as a platform for storytelling.

If you don't want something that's "too up it's own ass for it's own good" then this is not for you.

But if you are facinated with how games evolve as a medium for expression and storytelling and want a game that is willing to experiment with the fundamentals of what we traditionally consider to be games, then Thirty Flights of Loving is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991462816', 'num_games_owned': 1065, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1404394566}
review:
This is not a game and barely an ineractive story. There is no fail-state (i.e.: a way to lose) and anything you interact with has no consequences. Furthermore, this piece of software holds too little content and you can finish it in under 10 minutes. With no challenge or choices, there is no replayability.

0/10

review: Not for everyone. If you plan on purchasing, wait for the sale and be sure you know what you are purchasing. Short game, not worth it unless you plan on speedrunning it (which I do) or if you want to play "gravity bones" (which is included). Took 5 mins to beat, and didn't understand the story till the second playthrough. Much more of an art project and visual novel than a full-fledged game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025457489', 'num_games_owned': 1511, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1404173453}
review: This is tough. I've heard nothing but good things about this game. It's on PC Gamer's Top 100 list. I wanted to like it. I did like it...kinda. Let's be clear. The first part (or game if you will) was amazing. It was fun. It was unique. It was artsy without being pretentious. It brought a smile to my face and I liked it. It was so different. Such a great non-game game. But then there is a second mission (or prequel) hidden away. This is where it all went to shit. Now it tried to be a parkour style adventure and failed miserably. Why is there two locks on every door? Why is that damn flag pole so hard to land a jump on? Why do I have to keep starting over from the beginning because of your poor platforming mechanics? Honestly, I would have paid $9.99 for the first game even thought it was just 5 minutes long. But it was 5 minutes of bliss. The second (longer mission) makes me feel ripped of at 99 cents.

review: An excellent adventure, telling a story with no dialogue and repeated flashbacks and forwards. That all this is done with the Quake 2 engine is even more amazing. It is complete worth your 30 minutes, if only to experience the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107651627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1481294441}
review: Recomiendo encarecidamente este juego si buscas algo "experimental". No te gastes los 5 euros en él si no has probado Gravity Bones (gratuito, de descarga en la página de Blendo Games) y si lo has probado, espérate a las rebajas. De todas formas, lo recomiendo, es un juego cuanto menos curioso y diferente a cualquiera que hallas probado, aviso que entre los dos juegos apenas llegarás a media hora, no cuenta una historia mejor en 13 minutos que otros juegos en 13 horas, cuenta mejor una historia en 13 minutos que otros juegos en 13 horas <-[DayoScrip], te mete en la historia de una forma muy especial, pero sin ningún tipo de diálogo o texto, eres tú quién ha de sacar las conclusiones, el único requisito para entender el juego es ser un poco inteligente y estar atento, si a alguien le cuesta entenderlo le recomiendo que pruebe algo no tan complicado y juege a algo mas simple, como las chapas  :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198001876972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1403662784}
review:
Very high metascore... for what exactly? I loved Gravity Bone, and I'm glad this included a copy with the purchase... but the game engine crashed far too often for me to enjoy it, that, and the game is much shorter than Gravity Bone, with less interaction, and less puzzles. 

Get it on sale if you can, just to be able to play Gravity Bone (although you can get a copy of that for free on the internets) 

I *want* to recommend it, because it was still an interesting experience, but I can't in all honesty do that. (Sorry to the few folks I suggested buy this game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198135662264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1403583231}
review: Very short and unique experience. I personally thought Gravity Bone was better, but this game pulls you right. Sit back and enjoy the 15 minutes it takes to play the game, then play Gravity Bone. Cause Gravity Bone rocks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998110832', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1381444954}
review:
Blendo Games, a single man team, has crafted an enjoyable and fascinating sequel to “Gravity Bone”.

The art style and feel of the game is simple but it works. Blendo Games goes with what they have and don't let the lack of high-end art stop them; they make it work with beautiful execution.

There is very little to no dialogue, but the story is pulled off really well. It uses that design limitation to its benefit with creative solutions consisting of disjointed gameplay events and visual cues. Blendo Games is a professional miniaturist at arranging an emotional narrative with a very tight design scope resulting in something spectacular that could rival some of the traditional storytelling used by AAA game studios.

I’d recommend playing “Gravity Bone” if you can to get a taste of what both games have to offer; it takes about 15 minutes and is free at the developer’s website: http://blendogames.com/

author: {'steamid': '76561198055241764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1453010046}
review: While I admit I received this game as a gift, I would definitely recommend a purchase if you want a brilliant narrative experience. This game is a work of art, having brought me to an emotional state in my first playthrough that I have yet to encounter in other games. It's both something to appreciate and something to learn from, especially if you're looking into the design of game environments and narratives. If you're not willing to purchase it for yourself, I assure you it makes a great gift for a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993714204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1359014400}
review: A tiny little spy movie, presented in the form of a first-person shooter. Really amazingly inventive, clever, and compelling. Not something you'll be exploring deep gameplay in forever, but it really does something fascinating with the way it tells its story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963833495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1358755200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970491285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1342767600}
review: Brendon Chung is an incredibly talented solo indie, and TFoL is him firing on all cylinders: an eclectic and captivating world filled with interesting graphic design, inventive and economical non-linear storytelling, and its length is perfectly judged.  This game includes its prequel, Gravity Bone, which is just as good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063162127', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1495220214}
review:
Wow wow wow !!!  88/100, vous etes sérieux métacritic là ?! Vous mettez des notes pourraves à plein de bons jeux et 88/100 à cette d'aube ?
Vous vous foutez de nous ou quoi ?!

Ce jeu, je l'ai fini en 15min, puis je l'ai recommencé avec un pote plusieurs fois juste pour se moquer de ce jeu encore et encore. 
Une histoire invisible (ou incompréhensible, à vous de voir), aucune action, des graphismes like minecraft (en moins bien), un jeu codé avec les pieds, de l'argent perdu, du temps de votre vie en moins, du plaisir gâché.
Rien que de pensez au jeu me donne la nosé et une envie de bonne grosse diarrhée sérieux !

C'est dommage parce que ce jeu a un potentiel mais là c'est vraiment une grosse blague sans dec'.

Je recommande ce jeu aux pigeons ! 

PS : Avis à ton ceux qui ont acheté ce jeu... Vous êtes une belle bande de BLAIREAUX (moi on me l'a offert, mais pour m'offrir ça, il doit s'agir d'une vengeance ou quelque chose comme ça).

author: {'steamid': '76561198030268465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1393697388}
review:
Это очень странная и которткая Игра. Для любителей инди и в общем всего необычного. После прохождения игра заставляет задуматься, но только не задуматься о проблемах общества, о будущем и прочем. Она заставляет нас задуматься на что я только что потратил 100 рублей, что я вообще делал в течении часа, о что всё это означает. В общем на самом дле игра для тех, кто ищет смысл между строк и унего это хорошо получается. Смысла в игре полно. Вот тока догадаться до значений каждого действия, это надо Голову ооочень сильно напрячь.
Подытожим:
игра для философов
для кого то это будет 1 из 10 А для кого то 9.7 из 10
лично для меня Это 7.7

review: Every review I've seen of this game said: Tells a better story in 13 minutes than most games can in 3 hours. Or something along those lines. Let me just say, I have no clue what was going on during this entire game. This is NOT worth $5 to be completely confused. Either I'm missing something, or this game is absolutely terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970954288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1401588612}
review: Hard to recommend this one. It's different, and I can appreciate the art that went into putting it together, but I just didn't enjoy it. It's literally 10-15 minutes of 'game'play (mostly just walking), and at the end I was left baffled as to what had just happened.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998116681', 'num_games_owned': 3140, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1401581811}
review:
Короткометражное, сумбурное, низкосодержательное, малоинтерактивное кино в духе "я у мамы Тарантино". Резкие смены сцен и подбор музыки явно рифмуется с работами режиссёра. Одна из тех игр, которые излишне полагаются на повествование через окружение, как бы в пику современному мусору, который впихивает слишком много текстовой или диалоговой экспозиции, а так же бесконечные навигаторы и стрелочки с заданиями. Только все они забывают, что игры в первую очередь являются интерактивным искусством, и самая важная часть повествования передаётся через игровой процесс.

Несмотря на то что снимки экрана выглядят стильно, а музыкальная подборка довольно хороша - сюжет и сценарий совершенно простенькие, да и повествовательных элементов в окружении не так, чтобы достаточно. С технической стороны тоже не всё гладко, программа умудрилась "вылететь" трижды, за то непродолжительное время.

Ну по крайней мере я самостоятельно не лазил в wikipedia, чтобы узнать принцип работы крыла, а теперь знаю.

Gravity Bone
Игра, предшествующая Thirty Flights of Loving, однако содержащая намного больше игрового процесса. Причём не самого полированного.

Комментарии разработчика.
Самая интересная часть. Как минимум даёт контекст к некоторым моментам игры и раскрывает довольно странные факты. 

В целом если и брать, то только по минимально возможной цене

author: {'steamid': '76561197984325401', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1693959949}
review: This is seriously unique, artsy, and overall fun to play. The visuals are pretty minimalistic and nice. The music is incredible and helps to set the mood for each specific setting in a really nice way. The player has to piece together the story, making due with what one can of it in a non-linear fashion.  I could somewhat see why this game wouldn't be everyone's cup of tea but it has an alluring charm to it that I think they might be overlooking. It's definitely worth the 5 dollars, going to a deserving indie developer.

review: Completely challenged my view as to what a video game could be. Interesting use of non-linear storytelling. Hope to see more from BLENDO. author: {'steamid': '76561198077728810', 'num_games_owned': 1990, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1400345854}

15 minutes of disjointed, confusing story telling that left me trying to figure out what was going on. It's non-linear style gives no warning that it is about to/has just changed a part of the narrative, leaving you with the feeling that this 'game' has just glitched and left you in a different area, with no clue as to what is going on.


I'm sorry. Don't bother, You're truely not missing anything.

++Spoiler++ 
Took me longer to find the 'secret door' behind the portrait, than to play the rest of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961969805', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1342767600}
review: I love Blendo Games and I even enjoyed Thirty Flights of Loving, but I have a hard time recommending it. I feel that Gravity Bone (the free prequel) is a much better piece of game design. If you absolutely need more of that sort of thing or are really into games that explore storytelling in videogames, by all means ignore me and give this a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009343868', 'num_games_owned': 1013, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1400039358}
review: Very short, but very interesting game. More art than game really. Blendo merely gives us a taste of what they could offer with time and a budget. I found the experience satisfying, but I'd also suggest picking the came up when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021287786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1360656000}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving does not feel like a game. But understand, right now: this is not a failing. What is it then?
As near as I can tell, Thirty Flights is a non-linear interactive story played out across several charmingly presented and deeply odd instances involving smuggling and espionage. The tale has it all: romance, excitement, Jeff Goldblum, ducks, mutes, illegal substances, and comradeship. 
It also has one of the best soundtracks I've ever heard. 
So, what does Thirty Flights of Loving does feel like?
A bloody good time. 
You will play through it again and again - okay, at least twice - following the same path, but trying to figure out quite what just happened, and why, and how; and when exactly it ended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026911806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1387898851}
review: This game got me excited then disappointed me with how short it is. It has too interesting scenes that seem to be alluding to a greater story but then it just stops. If there were perhaps a dozen of these short segments, all adding to a larger story, then this could be a really great game. I don't know if I would pay $5 for it again but it’s definitely worth a play if you can get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965740181', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1392890982}
review:
If you want another Gravity Bone it's right here. As in, it's also literally in the game. If you didn't like Gravity Bone not sure what you're doing here.

Buy it on sale though. $5 for a 10 minute story is insane.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040758875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1380894061}
review: I found it quite short and a bit boring. The game skips through the story, making it inconsistent and hard to follow, and it's never really involving. You're just passing through the things that happen, you don't do much, just run along. I would not recommend this to most people.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971170060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1398546251}
review: I want to like it, but I just can't recommend it.  This is a regression from Gravity Bone in almost every way.  30FL's nonlinear bells and whistles aren't enough to dress up this barebones hesit story--gone is narrative confidence of GB, dropping the player into and out of an ongoing plot and explaining nothing.  Worse, there's no game to this game--even the minimal puzzle and platforming elements of GB have been boiled away.  30FL can basically be completed by holding "w" and tapping "e." Staking out your own place on the ludology/narratology map is one thing, but it is genuinely difficult to determine what the developer thinks has been added by making this game instead of, say, a cartoon or comic--the unfortunate side-effect of which is to make the player feel (with some justification) that he or she has fallen victim to some sort of dodge or hustle in paying money for this "game."  I recommend Gravity Bone; I cannot recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970843187', 'num_games_owned': 3357, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1397363977}
review:
I downloaded Gravity Bones (prequel to Thirty Flights) for free and played through that game... took all of 5 minutes.  It only took me 12 minutes to finish Thirthy Flights.

I appreciate the method of storytelling here, but the story is very disjointed... and for only 12 minutes of play and as far as I can tell no real replayability.  I'm sorry to have to say... but get this in a bundle or for dirt cheap... the $ per enjoyable minutes of this game is not great.
