review: Великолепно!3$ точно стоит!Хотите увидеть крутой сюжет,экшен,либовь и квадраты в одном?Игра для вас!И кстати про геймплей за 15мин.Вы забыли что есть ещё доп.задания!Оценка:9/10(руссификации не хватает)

author: {'steamid': '76561198068487212', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1379436375}
review:
Любите эффектно снятые exploitation-movie? А боевики о Джеймсе Бонде? Фильмы Квентина Тарантино/Роберта Родригеза? Тогда Thirty Flights of Loving для вас.

Thirty Flights of Loving это продолжение игры Gravity Bone, истории о бандитах из 60-х, и еще пары игр, в которые никто все равно не играл. 

Говорить о Thirty Flights of Loving примерно то же самое, что пытаться пересказать сон недельной давности. Это та игра, которая попросту переворачивает все каноны повествования в видеоиграх, по ходу прохождения всячески привлекая к истории самое пристальное внимание, используя классические для exploitation-movie постановочные ходы (в операторской, режиссёрской работе).

Эта игра – просто праздник для глаз, учитывая то, что все выполнено с использованием пиксельных кубиков. Но это и прибавляет определенного шарма данной графической новелле.
Итог: про Thirty Flights of Loving не нужно читать. В неё нужно играть. Игра получилась насколько неоднозначной, настолько же интересной. Такая игра – редкий гость на рынке. Их почти никто не покупает, но это не делает игру хуже. И тем, кому она понравилась, она понравилась по-настоящему. Прекрасный повод потратить лишние 15 минут, при этом получив действительно новый видеоигровой опыт.

Оценка игре – 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003701514', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review:
Сложно назвать сюжетом те не связанные обрывки, которые нам показывают. Никаких воспоминаний о игре не остается, цена, даже такая низкая, не оправдана. Продолжительность у нее не более 15 минут. Серьёзно, если посмотрите прохождение на видео, ничего не потеряете. Если хочется хорошего сюжета без геймплея (ходьбу с парой прыжков сложно за него считать), лучше пройдите To the Moon.
За те же деньги можно купить много других хороших игр, от которых вы получите больше удовольствия и времени прохождения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002502137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1361606400}
review: Short and strange game that I can't say I enjoyed. Should probably replay it a couple of times to maybe understand it better but there are too many other great games available that I rather play. So this will be my first game I won't recommend, but maybe I'll change my opinion of it in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054995351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1396669666}
review: This is a very odd interactive experience that I have difficulty calling a game. It's fun, and strange. Very short, with little replay value. Still, I enjoyed it while it lasted. I would feel ripped off had I paid full price for it, but I think I got it on sale for a buck. Certainly worth that. Hope this helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025139563', 'num_games_owned': 1788, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1396587108}
review: Really loved Gravity Bone (A free game by the same developers.) and thought this would be a longer game with a similar style but instead it was shorter than the free game and much less enjoyable. I am completely baffled by the fact that the developers would ask people to pay for this 10 minute boring demo with a lousy story and that steam would approve it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043038197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1396575465}
review:
It's really hard to recommend this game. I'm not saying I think it's bad (I think it's brilliant), I'm saying that it seems like it's directed at an extremely small audience. I think most will see this as a rushed, incomplete game, but others will likely view it as an extremely interesting look at narrative in video games. It's a short game, can probably be played in less than twenty minutes, but you experience so much in that span of time.

I like it. You might too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006321953', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1365577200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061157558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1357459200}
review: Simple and short this game with worth a chortle or two in my book. The box head people and the random..conversations? I guess that's what you could call them lol. Regardless, if you're looking for something different that wont take you days to beat, try Thirty Flights of Loving! It took me out of my comfort zone and put me in a new universe. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013075159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1396198547}
review: Came into this with no idea what to expect, It came with a humble bundle. It started out very promisingly, but it stopped before it got anywhere imo. What was available to play was very interesting and kept me engaged, but the total play time was less then 30 mins. Ultimately a cool storytelling concept that left me feeling that I hardly got my feet wet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979057603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1396133669}
review:
This is quite possibly the worst excuse for a game I have ever encountered. The game consists of about 10 different rooms, each taking about a minute to get through and suddenly out of nowhere you're hit with a The End sign and a bunch of walkthrough credits with comments about the great decisions they made and how they decided on them. These great decisions are along the lines of weird random jump cuts  that change the entire scenario for no reason. There's also a room with displays of a bunch the game models and animated GIF video timelapses of screenshots of their creation. How impressive is that?

Also, there's a scene at a wedding where the characters randomly start rising up towards the ceiling. The developer notes say this was a bug, that they left in because it was so much better. Um, excuse me. This just proves how little effort they put into the game. Find a bug? Fix it? Nah. Let's just say it makes the game better. The game is practically on rails. I played it twice and nothing I did changed anything in the game beyond the room I was in.

I recommend buying it if you want to see possibly the worst game ever. It cost £4 and for some reason has a very high metascore of 88. I have also heard real game reviewers saying it's a brilliant game. I'm not really sure what's going there, but it's clearly something shifty that needs to be looked at. I know I will only be relying on user reviews in future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039118485', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1392447445}
review: Save yourself $5 and go play Gravity Bone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000829323', 'num_games_owned': 974, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1396110366}
review: I really enjoyed the music and style of this game.  That being said I don't think most people on Steam are interested in an experience like this on a games platform.  Surely the storytelling style in this game couldn't be applied to a fully featured game, though it would be interesting to see someone try.  If you want to be a guinea pig and think that the screenshots look sorta cool, buy this game when it goes on sale for $1.25 or less.  If you don't like the style of the game in the screenshots don't even bother.  This is probably the biggest style over substance game on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031576167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1364972400}

review:
First of all this game is [b]NOT[/b] worth €5.
This game is very short, I mean less than 10 minutes short and is just as frugal with the actual gameplay.

That being said I thouroughly enjoyed those 10 minutes. I bought this game on sale quite cheap so I wan't bothered that much by the length. The game has a lot of charm and I thouroughly enjoyed the story and the music.

If you are interested I would highly recommend playing Gravity Bone (the free prequel) first. You can download it from their website http://blendogames.com/ 

I do recommend this game but if you want it wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014198995', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1393146115}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993890173', 'num_games_owned': 4445, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1394585873}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving is a bad game, if it can be called that.  It's horribly linear with very little interaction.  Play time totaled 15 minutes, and that's going through it twice.  The story is actually pretty good but it's not a "game".  On the other hand, the free bonus of Gravity Bone made my it worth my money.  Although again short it is a game (about 15 minutes for 1 time through), it has interaction, it's entertaining, and I liked the whole feel of it.  My thoughts are they should have sold Gravity Bone with Thirty Flights of Loving as a bonus.  For $4.99 I would say not worth it, get it when it's on sale if you get it at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961761740', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1394383078}
review:
I get it, concise and well-written stories can be better than drawn-out ones. This does not mean, however, that because this game was simple, used an old engine, did not have any elements of gameplay, voice acting, or interactivity; that it was any good. It is not a "game" there is nothing different you would experience from that of watching a video of a playthrough of it, so at best it could be considered a short viewer-driven films. Even then, the "story" depicted was bland, generic, cliche', any of the words you can think of to infer that it added nothing new to discuss beyond its almost complete lack of content and quality. 

Normally this wouldn't be an issue, bad games are common, but when the "professional" reviews gush over how amazing it is; 9.5/10 and whatnot, you can't help but wonder if perhaps they are trying too hard to make "art" out of a joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075224118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1394369214}
review:
Very cute short story about love.
The narrative is cut in a very unique way ; the sort of thing you rarely see in video games. 
If you want to give it a try, wait for a sale though (I bought it at -85% on the Valentine's sale) ; the gameplay is very short, and probably doesn't justify the full price.

review: Get ready for some of the craziest 20 minutes of your life. Jump cuts galore await in this zany story of love and crime. If you're like me, you'll play it through a second time immediately after the first just to figure out what happened.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052898457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1650764504}
review: Many people complain about the length of the game, but everything that is packed into this short experience is worth seeing. A second or third playthrough is even more rewarding than the first. You begin ito pick up on things you had missed before. The developer commentary adds another level of depth to the game where he explains details about the development process. Sure, it's not for everybody, but it's perfect for the audience that will appreciate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989053541', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1447834683}
review:
It's not a conventional game. If that's a red flag for you then don't ignore it; you will not enjoy 30 Flights of Loving. The gameplay actually lies in trying to piece a perfect understanding of the story in your head, which is easier said than done. There's all sorts of little clues and details that enable all sorts of crazy and dynamic theories in this 10 minute title (it is actually that short) and due to the quick flow of the story and stylish presentation; I've managed to log 4 hours in while being quite entertained.

Unfortunately you have to find joy in that kind of thing. There seems to be a tiny niche for it and I think this game is really good at what it does. It's a simplistic game to look at but it's also quite a creative one that I felt was worth grabbing on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119985015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1392802197}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999304281', 'num_games_owned': 1369, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1392685061}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving: [b]3/10[/b]

Perhaps it was because I had gone into the game with high expectations (friends saying it was great, Extra Credits recommending it, and it having an overall 88/100 Metacritic score), but I expected a great game. A good game. At least a decent game… when I beat the game, I had a sour taste in my mouth, exclaiming “what the fuck? That’s it?!? …”. It’s difficult to say that I feel “burned” in my purchase due to the fact that I paid about $1.50 and the fact that I didn’t do any research other than “other people generally like it” (something I would chastise someone else doing)…but I feel incredibly disappointed in the game. 

The first thing that I simply must state is the fact that it is short. I was “warned” of this beforehand, and I was cool with it. I’m fine with short games, so long as they “last” a bit (my view is one hour, thirty minutes and on is acceptable in most circumstances)…but this game lasted exactly 12 minutes. Yeah…12 minutes, from when I started it, to when I was done with the entire game. The fuck? I confused about the plot and game in general (I’ll discuss that shortly), so immediately after the game was over, I decided I was going to play it again to see what I was missing. Surely I missed something in regards to the plot or something. Thankfully, I thought, there’s a developer commentary, and so I selected that. Now, normally, this does a lot for me; as someone who’s obtained a degree in the field I find these things fascinating… but I was immensely disappointed in the commentary. Most of it was describing things that frankly wasn’t interesting (“Normally, ninety-degree angled hallways aren’t great, but after adding a bevel…”, “…I don’t approve of littering.”, etc.) and even after stopping to listen to the commentary, not only did it not shed any more light on the plot, but it lasted 15 minutes (with me taking my time and exploring, too). That adds up to 27 minutes. For beating the game twice. That’s not acceptable.

I was interested in reading some of the critic’s comments on why they enjoyed the game, and a reoccurring theme was that they enjoyed the ambiguous nature of the story, and the frequent use jump-cuts. I didn’t. Let me explain what happens in the story ([u]spoilers, obviously[/u]): you start in a hallway, letting you learn the controls of the game (WASD for movement, mouse for camera, tough stuff). You then enter a bar, unable to interact with any of the characters, who oddly stare into your soul. All you can do is consume alcohol (which does nothing, I add, other than disappearing and making a sound), and interact with a fake painting (which is among numerous paintings), opening up a secret passage, leading to the introduction of two characters (which is, admittedly, my favorite part of the game, although that’s not saying much). After this, you board a plane, and, after you leave, you’re immediately thrown into an unknown situation: your romantic interest is pointing a gun at you, in a strange location, and bloody. This is just a short summary of what you’ll encounter. And, sadly, this is about a third of the game. There’s so many random cuts to different parts of the story that you never really learn enough about the characters to care about them (and, I’m not sure if I’ve emphasized this already, but the game is short). Perhaps, in a strange way, peeling oranges with your loved one might be an intimate moment between two characters and the player, but when you’ve known the character for about two minutes, it didn’t mean anything to me. Also, I simply have to pose the question: why the hell were there three rooms dedicated to “Bernolli’s Principle” (something to do about high and low air pressure)?  

So…yeah…I tried to be objective about this game and find redeeming qualities, but I just don’t see any. I mean, it’s a functional game, I guess…?

[b][u]TL;DR:[/b][/u] Literally twelve minutes long, extremely brief and ambiguous plot, commentary about 90 degree hallways. Don’t waste your time with this game, no matter the price. Had I known what I know now, I wouldn’t have played the game even if it was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045384155', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1392624043}
review:
The rating via metacritics was probably based on the opinion of the developer's mother and spouse for f*ck sake. It's just a load of kiss ♥♥♥ crap.

It's shorter than a midget's as$hole.If you blow it through it's less than 10 minutes.I had to play this twice just to make sure I wasn't doing anything wrong or avoiding anything crucial.And then I played once more with additional commentary - it made me even more of a unsatisfied towards the entire game from how carelessly thrown together it seems to be based on how the comments were written. I literally kept thinking in my head 'This has to be a f*cking joke' once I saw "The End" and game related credits in the muesem full of generated people in bundles of three that only consist of three different character models spammed throughout the entire location and some things regarding airplanes. Because yeah- gotta add some flying related thing for the sake of adding depth to the title "Thirty Flights of Loving" other than you having a romance for some b*tch that almost killed your best man.

Basically the game is literally contsructed based on mistake after mistake, yes sometimes imperfections add charm, but in this case it just seems like they were simply too lazy to bother fixing the issue and they decided to cover it up thoughtlessly. It was just like "Oh ..sh!t the crowd generator is causing peope to float in the wedding scene!?! That's alright! Let's just add some blurry effects while the player drink off the bottles while everyone else is dancing- and make the player assume they're so drunk that they can no longer correlate reality from alcoholic delusions!Why?Because it's ARTSY and adds a NARRATIVE touch in the game!!!"

The gameplay itself feels like you're on a grid, you get tossed from one scene to the next.Its also rather disorientating and disrupts the entire flow of the 'story' it is trying to convey. I really don't see how it's artistic.I see it as lazy,choppy,painfully short,and dull. It's not even very aesthetically pleasing for the simplicity of the graphics.It would be able to get away with it IF (and I emphasize if) it was a deep and enriched story telling game. But sadly- it fails miserably on that aspect.So yeah, not only it's FUGLY- but it's stupid.

The game also includes its prequel called "Gravity Bones" and I found it to be a bit more interesting, and innovative than it's sequel.Its even to my surprise a tad longer..But it still doesn't help the game as its own indvidual piece. It just felt like I ate a stale and bland cupcake with just a bit more sprinkles and frosting than the last one.

TL:DR It ain't worth it at all.
I'm surprised they even had the guts to call itself a 'game' the only thing you really do is walk around , sometimes press 'e' and get slammed with ♥♥♥♥ty sequences the second you step on a area that triggers it.It's sloppy, it's short. It's dull and it takes the the pride in being vague which in their language means artistic when in reality it's meaningless rubbish.I've never seen a game that costs five dollars but it's just as valuable as a crummy indie flash game you can find online for free. And even if it's on discount- I would say skip it...There are more interesting things to do in 15-20 minutes than to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057819213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1392540980}
review: If you think this is gonna be a long run a gun indie game then stop reading and leave. This game is a really short story packed game. When you beat it you'll either be confused or mad; probably both. But there's the beauty behind this game, this game allows you to interpert what happened in the 10-25mins you played due to game set up and lack of dialoge. If Ernest Hemingway created a video game, I bet it would looks like this. Using the iceberg princible the story gives you bare minimun of details and setting, then you as the player must piece together what happened. And that's about the whole game, So if you love good story games and don't mind playing it over and over again to try and solve what happens, then this game is perfect for you and I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970843265', 'num_games_owned': 1406, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1392573515}
review: Gravity Bone은 Passage와 함께 내가 인디 게임을 처음 접할 때 충격적인 게임이었다. 오래된 퀘이크2 엔진으로 만든 이 게임은, 이른바 '단편' 게임이라 할 정도로 매우 짧지만 매우 강렬한 아트 스타일을 보여주었다. 나는 이 게임을 하기 전에 Gravity Bone보다 더 난감하며, 게임이라기보다는 뮤직비디오와 비슷하다는 이야기를 들었다. 그렇지만 어쨌거나 전작이 그러한 성과를 보여주었으니 기대는 하고 있었다. 그런데 세간의 평은 틀리지 않았다. 아니, 반은 틀렸다고 할 수 있는데, 뮤직비디오라 하기도 부족했기 때문이었다. 이 게임의 아트 스타일은 Gravity Bone과 비슷한데, 캐릭터를 누르면 배경 이야기가 빠르게 지나가는 것은 좋은 표현이었다. 그러나 본격적인 게임이 시작하고 나서 게임은 스토리텔링을 위해 지나치게 화면을 끊는다. 굳이 그렇게 표현할 이유도 없는데 화면을 끊는 것은 어딘가의 단편 애니메이션에서 본 것이 아닐까 싶은데, 비디오 게임은 직접 조종하는 것이기 때문에 성가시기만 해 어줍잖기 짝이 없다. 비선형으로 해놓은 진행은 호기심을 불러일으키거나 효과적이기보다는 역시나 성가시기만 하다. 내가 직접 조종한다는 느낌이 드는 부분도 거의 없다. 개인적으로는 개발자에게 비디오 게임보다는 3D 애니메이션을 제작하기를 권한다. 애니메이션으로 봐도 그렇게 뛰어나지는 않지만...개발자 커멘터리가 있는데 게임이 이래서 보기 성가시다. Gone Home의 개발팀이 보여준 것과 같은 게임에 대한 이해가 제발 있었으면 좋겠다. 차라리 Gravity Bone을 '장편' 게임으로 만드는 것이 좋았을 텐데...

author: {'steamid': '76561198074555569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1392570743}
review:
Honestly, I did not enjoy this game one bit. The storyline (if any) was just confusing, and I didn't feel any connection to the characters when it ended. The other game included, Gravity Bone, didn't provide any answers towards what the plot is either. I can see that an attempt to envoke a connection to the characters was made with flashbacks, but it just didn't do it for me. Not to mention when I managed to die (attempting to make a shortcut to the exit in the first part of Gravity Bone) the game kept crashing when I tried to load my save, which forced me to restart. Had this been later in the game, I would have been very upset.

I suppose the only good from this game is that it at least controls well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025482261', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1392557781}
review:
Ce jeu est à essayer, mais vous n'allez [b]absolument pas vous amuser[/b].
Il se concentre plus sur la manière de raconter une histoire que sur [i]l'histoire elle même[/i] ! Une vrai blague quand on sait qu'il est en promo pour la saint Valentin.
De plus, ce jeu souffre d'une durée de vie extrêmement courte, l'histoire étant linéaire, la rejouabilité est très limitée.
Il s'agit peut être d'une performance technique, car on dirait que tout a été fait [i]from scratch[/i] avec quelques animations procédurales, mais les modèles étant relativement peu détaillés, on ne sais pas trop pourquoi aimer ce jeu.
Un vrai gros point d'interrogation pour ce jeu à la limite entre le jeu interactif et le film d'animation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047840435', 'num_games_owned': 7525, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1370234643}
review: What made me want to play this game is how critics say that it has great story telling. When you start playing, you find a hidden passage in the wall and a gun behind the counter. Once you go through the door, you collect more guns and ammo for them. However, they are never used since the "game" is entirely about the story. From this point on, it feels like the game is rushing through its story. Key word on the rushing. One moment, you are riding on a plane. The next, you are walking down a busy hallway. What makes this strange is that there are no transitions from one scene to another. This often makes it feel less like real story and more like a random collection of clips from several movies. Add to it that the whole thing ends in 15 minutes, and it feels more like a test program. They included another game called "Gravity Bone" that feels more like a real game, but it still does not feel like it is enough to worth buying. If you can play this on a friend's computer, do it that way. My family got it because it was part of a bundle. As a standalone product, I would not recommend buying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059999187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1392498094}
review:
[h1]SPOILER ALERT!!![/h1]

[b][i]I didn't really understand the game until I read the excellent explanation [u]below[/u] from Reddit.[/i][/b]

"Says [b]Jazzputin[/b]:
Here's what I think went down.
1. You are a thief. You meet with two other master thieves, Anita and Borges, who have planned a heist. You proceed to fly to a building at which the robbery takes place. [SHOWN]
2. You spend a day in the hotel planning/waiting for the heist (this the part where you see Anita throwing orange peels off the building). [SHOWN]
3. As part of the heist you must pose as party guests, so you attend a party on the roof and everyone gets drunk. [SHOWN]
4. You hook up with Anita (this is where things start to go wrong in the story). [SHOWN]
5. You and Anita wake up in a hungover stupor; Borges is missing. [NOT SHOWN]
6. Because the whole gang got drunk and woke up hungover and not ready for the heist, the heist is not set up properly and goes terribly wrong. Borges and Anita are both seriously injured. [NOT SHOWN]
7. You and Borges escape through a mall/airport sort of place. [SHOWN] Anita manages to escape on her own somehow, despite her injuries. [NOT SHOWN]
8. You and Borges, still escaping, face a standoff with police. [NOT SHOWN]
9. During the standoff, Anita arrives in a getaway car, you get in and a chase ensues. [NOT SHOWN]
10. The chase becomes deadly once Borges starts shooting at the police. At this moment the seriousness of the situation hits you; you realize you will not make it out of this. At this moment you have a fantasy: you realize you are in love with Anita, and you fantasize how nice it would be if you, her and Borges could live a simpler life if you just got away (the motorcycle scene). [SHOWN]
11. In real life your car approaches a head-on collision with a semi, you can hear/see the semi in your dream and you come back to reality, and your car collides head-on with the semi. [SHOWN]

I think the very end is ambiguous on purpose; it's not clear whether you survived the crash or died. The lobby you find yourself at the end could be a metaphor for the afterlife, or an extended life-flashing-before-your-eyes time for your character where he views previous parts of his life like museum exhibits."

author: {'steamid': '76561198078996399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1392598970}
review: This game is a very short exercise in creative and finely honed storytelling.  A lot of thought clearly went into its design.  In a short space of time, using very basic tools, Thirty Flights of Loving is able to make you think and feel more than much longer and more highly produced games.  The blocky LEGO-like characters while incredibly basic still manage to express emotion and lend the game its own unique style.  Due credit must be given for the finely honed way in which the game engages the player's imagination.  However, it's hard to shake the feeling that this is more of game programming student's project worthy of an 'A' grade than a fully realized game.  For $1.69, I found it worthy of my money and time if only for the fact that it got me thinking about game design and how to engage player imagination in a streamlined fashion.  I would not have appreciated this game as much if I had not played through a second time with the developer commentary.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970629464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1437571035}
review:
This is actually really cool, it's rare to see games do so much with so little. With cube heads, a simple linear path, essentially no words (okay, that's a lie, I guess I mean no [i]dialogue[/i]), and about fifteen minutes, it manages to be something of a masterclass in game storytelling, communicating at a level of effectiveness that verbose, exposition-heavy "AAA" rollercoasters would kill for.

For me, the use of sharp cuts ahead in a scene, or between scenes, was worth the price of admission alone. It's a technique I've of course experienced in many many films, but I don't think I've [i]ever[/i] seen it used in games before, and it's a wonderful way of both creating (or perhaps emulating) a certain style, and putting you in the headspace needed to make the most of each scene.

Yes, it's "only" fifteen minutes long, in the same way that, I don't know, Swift's seminal essay A Modest Proposal is only a few pages, or your favourite song only lasts three minutes thirty. If you're one of the people that (bizarrely, I maintain) measures experiences by dividing cost by length, this isn't for you. And I wasn't, you know, floored; blown away in amazement. But it is [i]quietly[/i] amazing; a significant accomplishment content to sit and do its own thing while the world shows off noisily around it. I think people with an interest in the presentation of narrative in games - beyond mere text dumps - should really check this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110538493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1426258107}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994454106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1392461260}
review:
Very short, but it has lot of punch to it i enjoyed how short it is. I love the fact that this game's design chose to not have words but rather use the surroundings as well as visual shots to tell what is happening.

 The first time you play threw it its a WTF Just Happened and its interesting as well as strange, Over time the comentairy as well as playing the 2 games really tells you what is happening in the story and some part are were they are. Moreover, its short little tressure and good look at game design from the persepective of linairty with NO SPOKEN WORDS,  just a short shot from a gun

. well over all i say take it for what it is cuase as far as i have seen is there is not to many fast pased games like this that were good way to understand game design from the experience. I liked it as well and wanted to know more about were it all came from. 

i am sure some peole will be like wtf i don't get it i just spent 5$ AND  du fuck did i just pay for all i got to say is look at it with a open mind and you will find some cool stuff out of this little game. weather in game disgine, movies, or story writting there is some thing to learn from this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998011533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1364454000}
review: Let's say you find this game on Steam for a dollar, and you're thinkin', "Hey, this seems kind of neat.  Those reviews make it look interesting, too."  Even at one dollar, this game is still a wretched mess of pretentious insignificance.  The gameplay is horrid, the unique visuals tire very quickly, and there's no enjoyment to be had out of this.  If I remember correctly, I finished the game in something like ten minutes, and it's one of the few times in my life where I legitimately wanted those ten minutes back.  Put that dollar you're thinking of spending to better use elsewhere, and skip this tripe.

If you like story games, I would recommend Dear Esther and not this game.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198008051327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1405012065}
review:
Pierwsza myśl - o kurde, silnik Quake, to musi strafe jumping działać! o kurde, działa!

Po 10 minutach trafiłem na napisy końcowe. Połowę tego czasu spedziłem na ustawianiu grafiki.

Tytuł bardziej skierowany do znajomych autora, bo tylko oni ogarną niektóre inside joke'i, które nam gra serwuje. Produkcja indie, spoko, ale nie za taką cenę. Warte max 0,99€. No i nie można tego traktować jako typową grę, tylko 'interaktywną historię', którą samemu trzeba sobie w główce poukładać.

Dużo zgrzytów jest. Cofam rekomendację.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970812066', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1527370708}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980520636', 'num_games_owned': 3697, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1391932958}
review: 'Thirty Flights of Loving'?  More like 'Barely Thirty Minutes of Gameplay'.  Hell, you can barely call it gameplay.  There's a vaguely interesting story here, but it's so entangled in the games non-linear plot to actually be worthwhile.  The sound track is okay, but the visuals are lazy (LOOK AT THE CUBE HEADS!  Just like in Minecraft!  You liked Minecraft right?).  Of all the shitty 'First Person Story' games I've played in the past two years (Gone Home, Dear Esther, etc) this is probably the worst.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969908751', 'num_games_owned': 2625, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1357459200}
review:
This is the shortest 'game' I have ever played on Steam. I took about 20 minutes, and I did it all again to make sure I wasn't missing something. Seriously, when it ended, I simply couldn't believe it. It's shorter than most flash games.

However, even if you ingore its ridiculous length, you still have the fact that it's barely interactive enough to even be called a 'game' in the first place. You just run from one area to another and things happen around you, to an extent, but nothing much happens to you. In short, you are not even involved in this tiny title's escapades. merely a biwildered bystander.

Luckily, I got this in some bundle or other so it didn't cost me very much. For the poor shmucks who actually payed good money for it (15 dollars for 15 minutes  (or so) 'fun' .... I feel genuinely sorry for them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094959049', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1668987686}
review: Крутая игра! На 10-15 минут прохождения. Сюжет наркоманский :D Советую всем!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023555368', 'num_games_owned': 3336, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1391658918}
review:
The Metascore for this game is very misleading. It isn't even an appropriate score if you try to call this "game" artwork--it's poorly made no matter how you look at it.

You can literally beat this in 20 minutes and there is no replayability. There are two "games" inside here, in reality both are more like mini-games. Gameplay is entirely linear, there are no secrets to find, no character development, plus unoriginal and boring gameplay elements. There is no redeeming factor to this game; it's not even priced fairly.

I am genuinely sad that I bought this for more than 50¢. This developer and publisher have yet to release a quality title on Steam and they offer no further support or updates after release. The game will stay in this bad condition, with no new content or updates. 

Thirty Flights of Loving uses a modified and extremely dated Quake2 engine. If you try to quit or load/save at the wrong spot, press esc at the wrong time, or don't do precisely the right thing at the right time, you will easily trigger the "Quake2Engine has crashed" message--fittingly, they didn't even bother to insert the game name in place of the engine name! Don't worry too much because the entire "game" will be over in less than 20 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996899722', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1393101234}
review: Well, that was certainly a thing.     There are some interesting parallels here with Dear Esther.. It's more of a narrative story than a game.   It was certainly short.. and amusing in places.    It's more of a freeware demo than a 4 quid game.  I picked it up in a sale, so can't complain though.    Fun. Short.  Interesting.  The developer comments sprinkled throughout are a nice little touch too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029957435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1366354800}
review:
Before going on to explain why I actually didn't like Thirty Flights of Loving, bear in mind that I enjoyed Dear Esther (an interactive story with no real gameplay).

Thirty Flights of Loving takes approximately 15 minutes to get through and by the end of it, you're left thinking what you just played. I won't call it a game because like Dear Esther, it is an interactive story. The story in Thirty Flights is non-linear, meaning you're told the story in the incorrect order and you're essentially left to piece it all together. While this is a plus, as it helps you take the story as you're required to pay attention and really think about it, the story is nowhere near long enough to be worth the amount you pay.

Typically, I would say that for every £1 (or $1) you spend, a game should give you one hour of gameplay. Now this game is £4, so following that system, you should get 4 hours of gameplay, but even with Gravity Bone included, you don't get that much gameplay, since there is very little replay value. I would say this is the kind of game you would find on a free games website, not something you would pay for. It's just not worth it.

Just to clarify why I liked Dear Esther and not Thirty Flights, Dear Esther actually has some level of replay value, since each time you play, the script changes. So in order to fully understand the story within Dear Esther, you would need to play it multiple times to get all the dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017945768', 'num_games_owned': 1163, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1376075640}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004308546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1390940640}
review:
It's very short; Thirty Flights of Loving, Gravity Bone and the TFoL Developer's commentary did not even take one and a half hour for me to finish. Good to know.

It is not a traditional game. The game(s) has a start and an ending, but not what I expected. It starts out "normal"; as a lover of adventure games I felt at home. Then there were a few sharp turns and before I knew it, it was over. :)

I really liked it. It's interesting and surprising. It keeps you on your toes. The music (TFoL) is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004581351', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1390879292}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is an interactive art piece, pure and simple. It's similar to "Dear Esther" in that there is no actual game play, however, the story is fun and it's visually appealing. The style reminds me of Mine Craft using that popular cubism style. The story was fun, kind of like a 70s hiest movie. If you jump right into it you may be a bit confused but a second play through will bring clarity, since the time line in the story is non-linear. Which brings my next point, also like "Dear Esther", the game play is relatively short. I'de say there is about fifteen to thirty minutes of game time. Over all, it was an enjoyable experience though.

However, i have the same issue that i had with "Dear Ester". These games are great but they last a very short time. Also, they have virtually zero re-play value. Given that, i don't think i would have paid full price for either of them had i known this. Let's give some perspective...Dear Esther is 10$ with around a hour and a half of game time...Thirty Flights of Loving is 5$ with around twenty-two minutes of game time...a [b]movie ticket[/b] is around 10$ and normally about [i]two hours[/i].

These artistic game experiences are great but i would only recommend buying them on sale. Thirty Flights of Loving was on sale for just over a dollar, Dear Esther was on sale for around four dollars i think. Wait for the sales, but definitely buy them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971629679', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1527462319}
review:
Ce jeu est la suite de Gravity Bone, qui est inclus dans le menu principal :
- Si vous hésitez à dépenser vos sous pour un jeu qui se termine en moins d'une heure, Gravity Bone est disponible gratuitement sur le site de Blendo Games. Jouez-y et voyez si vous avez envie de retourner dans cet univers barré.
- Si vous avez acheté Thirty Flights of Loving, pensez à jouer à Gravity Bone avant de commencer !

Pour la petite histoire : ces deux jeux sont les épisodes 6 et 7 des aventures de Citizen Abel, des mods pour Quake 2 et Half-Life (The Puppy Years), trouvables sur le site de Blendo Games. Mais vous pouvez vous en passer ; Gravity Bone et Thirty Flights of Loving sont des histoires indépendantes et infiniment mieux ficelées que ces mods.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057801593', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1390653449}
review:
This is an experimental, highly linear game which sees you only walking through scripted events to move the disjointed narrative (which leaves a lot to the player's imagination to discover) forward. Think of it as an interactive, yet not-so-intruiging short Pulp Fiction kind of story. The entire experience takes about 10 minutes and there's a developer commentary option too which is text-based and is mostly about the game creator himself than the game but some of the facts are cool to read. The game itself has its moments and it gets pretty intense towards the end.
As an added bonus, the developer's previous game, Gravity Bone is also included in the package and can be played from the main menu. The irony here is that the main gem of this package is indeed the older one. Gravity bone is more interactive and has a much less bizarre narrative than 30 Flights of Loving. I guess this is really for the niche audience who'd like to have this kind of experience. I personally enjoyed it but exhausted every single aspect of it in less than 2 hours. If you want gameplay, stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065038118', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1410146204}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093354076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1390617352}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006967997', 'num_games_owned': 1037, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1390597225}
review:
Spoiler free review:

It's a challenge to describe this game without giving it away. It plays more like an interactive short film than anything. The story is told in anachronic order with sudden cutwaways and relies on the scenery and subtle (and not so subtle) cues to tell the player what's happening.
It's short and sweet, and a great achievement in the medium.

Do I recommend this? Yes and no. A very niche sector of gamers would like this. The player character does very little and the lack of action may rub some people the wrong way (well except maybe for Gravity Bone, the free to play prequel included in this release, which has some action).

But if you enjoy a good piece of fiction and like to piece togheter the events of the game and you don't mind the experience being about ten minutes short, by all means buy this thing!

On a personal note, I loved it and played it a few times with the developer commentary to gain a better insight of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007301943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1388338898}
review:
Une arnaque grossière. Pour l'inventivité narrative certains seraient prêts à pardonner beaucoup de choses, il en reste que la durée de vie et le contenu ne justifient pas le fait que ce jeu soit payant; Gravity Bone avait au moins quelque chose à raconter, même si ce n'était pas beaucoup. Là, on se retrouve avec un jeu certes prenant et intrigant mais tellement court et vide qu'il ne présente que très peu d'intérêt.
C'est peut-être un jeu inspirant, mais il ne faut surtout pas l'acheter; attendez un bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967662283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1584197848}
review:
la verdad si me arrepentide comprarlo, despues de que lo jugue por los cortos 15 minutos... hasta mi hermano me pregunto... y eso?? que fue?... despues lo volvi a jugar y lo volvi a jugar ... no "jugandolo" mejor como si fuera una pelicula y descrubriendo los detalles... realmente disfrute el juego, contando una historia corta entretenida y bastante bien llevada... me encanto la forma en como lo contaron pero si tienes que tener una mente muuuuuuuuuuuuuuy abierta para gastar 5 dolares en el juego (aunque lo compre de rebaja) 

al final despues de verlo detenidamente y analizarlo y amar su arte de caras de caja... me gusto ... pero realmente hubieran sido un poquito mas generosos con ponerle un poquitin mas de historia... un poquito mas largo hubiera sido bueno... solo eso me hubiera gustado

author: {'steamid': '76561198002911323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1390263802}
review: This game sucks. Don't buy it. I neglected to read the reviews since it was only $2 but even then, it wasn't worth the money. It's either a game or art, but if it's art it shouldn't be something we want to be rid of 13 minutes after looking at it. That's just what this is. A nonsensical, out of order, poorly programmed "art game" that tries to be cutting edge by doing shit that filmmakers have been annoying us with for 20 years already. Just go watch a youtube video of the game and save the $2... actually, don't. Your 13 minutes is more valuable than whatever the "avant guard" BS the artgame is trying to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989858088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1552409492}

review: What? What?? That was my first reaction after completing this 10-15 minute game.  I think I have an idea of what the story was about, but I had to look up some plot analyses to double check.  I was surprised to see I missed quite a few little details, but man... what a weird game and story.  It's kind of a heart-breaking story... I think... but I'm not sure because I still really don't know what happened.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981356193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1389837421}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is more of a technical marvel of story telling than an actual game.  The interaction/gameplay is minimal, as the entire game plays out like a movie.  The story itself is incredibly artistic and abstract with no narration, and will probably turn off a lot of traditional players of games (including a few PnC diehards).  The 'director's commentary' is very enlightening to bring a more mundane approach to the story, highlighting small details, to help gamers that found the story too confusing to begin with.  The game is sometimes so subtle in the story that smaller details can go completely unnoticed.

I completed the entire game (seriously, everything the game offered), in 75 minutes.  This included time to hunt for bugs and glitches, do a little in game physics experimentation, watch all of the 'making of' movies in the commentary, commit suicide (wheeeee!) where possible, and of course explore every option in the option menu.  The average gamer will maybe get 45 minutes of entertainment out of it.

I thought it was fun, but this game is better suited for aspiring game creators as a prototype to learn the art of storytelling than it is an actual game for most people.  If it was more fleshed out with back story and interaction/consequences, it would be more suitable for the PnC crowd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027581143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1389474470}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010520460', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1389676138}
review:
A lot of people seem to hate on this game, and while I almost understand the reasoning it is still a bit unfounded to me. Most people seem to make mention of either "Why would I pay $5 for a game this short?" or "This isn't even a game." Then they'd probably say "Don't waste your money." I am here to tell you otherwise.

The game functions much like a film though it isn't, there is little interactivity but that seems to be the point of the experiance. I classify it as a game because there is interactivity, you the player are a part of the stary and you can interact (however limited) with the world around you unlike a film. From what I understand the game seems to be an experiment to try to fit as much story into a limited time frame, and with no dialogue. And to that it succeeds, even without dialogue the game accurately portrays a story just from the very limited character models and it even makes it engaging. It's paced well and is just overall really well made, especially for a game running on the Quake engine.

It also comes with the game this is a successor to, Gravity Bone, which is a nice touch and is really great in it's own right. For $5 I still reccommend it, just for the experiance this game gives you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966560234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1389629453}
review: While I appreciate the ideas and art style, I can't help but think this extremely short endeavour (5 minutes? 10 tops?) should be called Thirty Flights of Pretentiousness instead.  The "gameplay" is the narrative, but the narrative is spotty, guesswork open to interpretation at best, pseudo-artsy film school project stuff. The contracts accessible after the titular game offer some (extremely) basic puzzling, but that's about it. This is NOT worth its current price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1352534400}
review: A hugely interesting take on the mainstream definition of the term "game" this is a great piece of interactive story telling that will leave you asking as many questions as it gives you answers. A unique art style and simple concept add to the overall design. It may not be for everyone but love it or loathe it this is a game that everyone should experience. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197991718328', 'num_games_owned': 1396, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1672732630}
review:
Take the stanley parable, remove the voice acting, put it in the Quake 2 engine, set it in a 1970s esq crime thriller, and have the entire story play out through smash cuts and implications.

Bam, you got Thirty Flights of Loving.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993232208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1388266685}
review:
There seems to be a growing trend among the gaming industry about making the big titles as flashy as a Hollywood blockbuster helmed by Michael Bay.  It's all about the pretty skyboxes and particle effects.  Story and character have been given the boot in lieu of a more visually appealing game.  Well this game, as short as it is, is the complete opposite of what the triple A gaming industry is doing as it proves that with only a few visual cues and some basic animation a story can form all on its own.

That has always been the beauty of gaming, the capacity of story-telling within a medium and allowing the player to use his imagination to fill in the gaps.  A hearty recommendation for anyone.  Although I would say to wait for the price to drop during a sale, as the length of the game may put many people off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1368946800}
review:
Un rollo de juego donde lo único que haremos seguir un camino lineal pasando de escenario en escenario sin ningún tipo de lógica. En cada uno de ellos, aparte de andar, podremos interactuar un poco con el atrezzo o personajes, pero si tú crees que eso vale los euros que cuesta el juego, ¡adelante, campeón! Además, del primer arranque del juego al final del mismo hay menos de 1 hora. Mi deseo es que el navegador me avisara de spam cada vez que aparece este juego.

[b]¿Entonces de qué va el juego?[/b] Va de que tú te gastas unos euros y después te sientes estafado.
[b]¿No eres un poco duro?[/b] Es mi review y pongo mi impresión. Seguro que tú eres capaz de hacer otra review enumerando las incalculables bondades de este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997390864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1389037289}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is not typical game.

 It's a very short product, but a great experience. TFOL took me only 15 minutes, with commentary and prequel another 30. This game has resplendent artistic design, Blendo Team had used many artistic means to create such a great, little story.

 If you want typical gameplay, you shouldn't buy it, it isn't for you, but if you want something new from indie games and not only, new sensations, a game from Blendo will be a good choose, for me it worth 5€.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093220384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1389020870}
review: A stylish little title about crime, love, sex, violence, weddings, a heist gone wrong, and the basic principles of aviation theory... I think? It's kinda difficult to pin down exactly what this is given the minimalist nature of practically everything about it. You don't really play it as such, more like you move around to progress a story told through sparse fragments of interspersed scenes which suggest much but which never really outright state anything. Instead, it's largely left to the player to give context and meaning to everything, and therein lies its greatest strength and its greatest weakness. Some will breeze through the very brief experience with little thought, others might enjoy reading the world as they play through. A great curiosity without a massive amount of substance, I wouldn't necessarily recommend it outright as a must see, as even with the included, equally short prequel, Gravity Bone, there still isn't much here you couldn't really live without. But I certainly wouldn't discourage anyone from checking it out if the price was low enough to justify your intrigue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043843679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1376839531}
review: Nadhodnocená konina! Můžete mě mít za ignorantského imbecila, ale tohle žádné mistrovské dílo není. Ty, co si slintají na triko z nelineárního supa ďupa příběhu, opravdu nechápu. Nejde o to, že tam vlastně není co hrát, ale jak to celé působí. Změť obrazů, volně rozházených. Měl jsem pocit že hraji  zabugovaná hru na superhrách, naprogramovanou na sovětské kalkulačce. Nechápu genialitu tohoto kousku. Prostě to není hra, pocity to vyvolává leda tak na zvracení a i kdyby za to chtěli 20 korun, stále je to zlodějna. Předchozí díl (ve hře obsažený) je prakticky stejná volovina, jen už je poskládaná lineárně. Zadarmo drahý! 2/10

review: The game is 12 minutes long (not joking), and it's not a particularly interesting 12 minutes.   It's not so much a game as it is an exercise in adapting movie style editing (jump cuts, non-linear story telling) to games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962544750', 'num_games_owned': 2242, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1367650800}
review:
Another "Game" thats not a game. This was originaly a perk for a Kickstarter for a famous gaming podcast Idle Thumbs and eventual released for purchase. The problem here is that you arnt really getting much of anything here for you 5 bucks. There are free indie games that have way more substance.

Thirty Flights of Loving plays out as of an interactive narative.  However you can't die or don't acctually effect the world around you (unlike games like indigo Prophecy or The Stanley Parable). Really you just control movement and the camera and follow along while the breif TWENTY MINUTE story plays you... for a fool.......  because you spent money on something that real indie developers have been giving out for free and with much more to them for a long time.

P.S The story is kind of cool but passes way to quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964443633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1388785105}

review: At 75% off, I still felt a bit overcharged by this game. This game feels like a resume that you'd send out to get hired making an actual game. Which is great, but not "I'd pay money for that" great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007040968', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1388717432}
review:
Fast, short, and i'd go so far as to say genius. 

If you're looking for the best example of linear story telling in a game, look no further. Forget Gone Home, and forget Dear Esther. Thirty Flights of Loving is everything those games want to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024979390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1362816000}
review: Got it 'cause it was cheap, short and it was claimed to be artsy. Well, two of three aren't so bad. It's cute and moderately interesting, but really nothing special. You'd probably be just as well off spending 30 minutes scrolling through cat pictures on tumblr or something, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994883558', 'num_games_owned': 2181, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1388674213}
review: 10-минутный "шутер от первого лица". Наверное, самая короткая игра в мире. Нет, я не против эпатажа, претенциозности, кислотности, но здесь моей единственной эмоцией на все происходящее было: "Что? Что, блядь?"

author: {'steamid': '76561197997929855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1388825955}
review:
В игре нет ничего, кроме "искусства", такого же  как и все современное "искусство" - безсмысленное, бездарное и слепленное из того, что было под рукой в припадке колоссального самолюбия... и раскрученное, как, что-то стоящее..
Это игра пустышка.
Рейтинг metascore и рецензция PC Gamer не объективно завышенные. Это не игра. Это чушь собачья.
Сюжет не оригинален и безвкусен. Геймплея - просто нет.
Я провел в игре 43 минуты, хотя игра займет минут 5 - я честно искал в этой игре, что-то еще, но нет...
Это как если вам, залекламируют "красный квадрат петровича", как самородок в современном искусстве и продадут билет..
Это реально тот случай, когда после знакомства, хочется вернуть деньги, сжечь билет...
Я серьезно! Это первый случай, когда я готов отдать обратно (бесплатно) стиму игру, чтобы ее забрали или лишь бы ее не было в списке моих игр...
0/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198039606950', 'num_games_owned': 1132, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1432679066}
review: I spend $5 on a new indie game. Not 10 minute trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999883652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1388642503}
review:
It had me interested at first. 10 minutes later I realized "yes the game really did just actually end." Feeling unsure if I was ripped off at 75% off. My own fault though. I should have researched the title before purchasing. 

While it is a unique experience I can't say I enjoyed it enough to play again. I won't say it's a bad title either, but if you are looking for some good gameplay, for the sake of  playing a good game, you're probebly not going to find it here. If you like abstract art, fps games that don't let you shoot, feeling confused, lost, like blocks and oddball stories that don't explain anything, this might just be for you. Cool for 10 minutes. 

...but I will say it succeeded in making itself memorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032282554', 'num_games_owned': 3460, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1388609481}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120614389', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1388455247}
review:
First of all, there is no inbetween with this game, you either hate it or love it. So before you spend that precious $1.24, let's evaluate if you will or will not love it:

1. Do you like point and click games?
2. Do you like heavily plot based games?
3. Are you into cinematography, graphic arts, and/or innovative story telling?
4. Do you value the EXPERIENCE of a game over what you can actually DO in a game?

If you answered "yes" to all 4, this is definitely the game for you. This kind of game is so different and wonderfully pieced together. I cannot believe how many emotions this game made me feel in under 10 minutes. It was heart-pounding and heart-felt. DO realize though that it's more of a visual novel and therefore your actions are chosen for you, you just are simply there to enjoy the ride. Which is exactly what I did, I enjoyed the ride.

AS A BONUS: you also get their first game Gravity Bone (can't find it? hit esc and click careers) which unlike this sequal allows the player to move and figure out what they have to do, which is much more interactive but still as fun as Thirty Flights of Loving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078768951', 'num_games_owned': 1836, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1560078533}
review: Tarantino bez słów. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027371602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1399667958}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving had a lot of hype surrounding it when it came out. It's non-linear, non-traditional, and very stylized -- what it does it does okay. It's interesting, but for me it was ultimately an unfulfilling experience. I didn't feel for the characters like the reviews said I was supposed to, and I didn't have any investment in the story or where it went. I appreciated the attempt to do something different, but I felt that it was all just too disjointed and unresolved. I played through a second time with the developer commentary enabled, and there was a lot of pretentious talk about the ambiguity of the storyline and characterization; I felt that it was all a failed attempt at justifying decisions that made little sense to me. There are weaknesses in the story, design and gameplay, and the developers are well aware of them. All told, however, I didn't hate it. What saved it for me was the inclusion of Gravity Bone in the copy I did purchase. It was longer, included puzzle elements, and offered the player more time as the character. I think this last point alone made me enjoy it more than Thirty Flights -- if only I had five more minutes to explore the heist and the relationship to the supporting characters, I might have enjoyed it more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991328447', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1387742436}
review: This game is great. More story in 15 minutes than most games manage in 15 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963042520', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1462933352}
review:
This is a non-game and there’s nothing wrong with that. It tells a short story through a dated Quake 2 engine using an interesting art style and visual tricks. Also includes the previous game, Gravity Bone.

Would I pay $5 for this? Probably not, but if you can pick it up during a sale and are open to a game where you have to use a bit more of your imagination to piece together the story, it’s worth playing. Yeah, it won’t take you more than 30 minutes to finish TFoL or GB, but it’s a nice, succinct couple that shows how games can be used to tell a story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053765310', 'num_games_owned': 1735, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1388373986}
review: Great narrative, but way to short.  Should have had maybe ten or so of these shorts and been a "short story collection".  Luckily this was a Holiday Sale purchase ... Next time put several together and this would be a great and unique experience AND value.  Will say "Yes, I recommend" for the narrative IF it is purchased on sale..."No, I don't recommend" for full price...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971711598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1388357404}
review:
I've had this game sitting on my pc for ages now, (since the Blendo Games Humble Weekly Sale) not having the time to really go through any of my backlog of games. I really enjoyed both Thirty Flights of Loving and Gravity Bone!  

Most people rate games according to stringent rule sets, going through a bullet point list of expected content or features, which in my opinion is wrong! Games always have a focus - sometimes that focus is a balance between gameplay and story, sometimes between systems and level design. Thirty Flights and Gravity Bone lay their focus upon the narrative, its delivery and the world they are set in. Both games are very characterful in every way. The narrative, visuals and music of both games are extremely charming, and in some ways reminded me somewhat of Tarantino flicks. Both games are short (though longer than 5 minutes as some have stated), but this is as a result of the focus on narrative, and trying to put the player in the right mood, at the right time, and telling the story in a way that makes sense (with a bit of fun along the way). 

I went through both games, and the commentary version of Thirty Flights, and spent just under an hour.

I was recommended this game by a friend, and will definitely do similarly!

A breath of fresh air.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984728248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1388354522}
review: This is really not a game, its an interactive story. That said for $1.24 on sale I found it to be pretty different and entertaining, but a lot of people probably would find it to be weird and pointless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984498875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1388940000}
review: I find Thirty Flights of Loving very difficult to recommend. On the one hand, it's a finely crafted story and well stylised experience. On the other hand, it's very short. Like - 5 minutes kinda sort. Where the idea falls down is that it sacrifices gameplay for artistic expression. However, it does come with Gravity Bone, which is more of a game. That too could have been expanded upon, with different objectives per mission. It's a boiling broth of potential that just leaves you with a taste of faceless brievity. If it's on sale (maybe a quid), then pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027881541', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1637792140}
review:
крутая картонная бондиана. где тем не менее нечего делать. не покупайте ее за полную стомость, если вы не фанат подобных инди. 
15 минут пройдут незаметно. да. именно 15.

геймплей: 6/10
музыка: 9/10
сюжет: 8/10


7,7/10

Господа, хочу заступиться за игру. Все что написано выше правда и от своих слов я не отказываюсь. Но нужно понимать, что игра атмосферна и не каждому будет понятна и интересна. Обзор был общим.
Лично я не жалею о покупке, тем не менее у вас целых три выбора:
1) если вы фанат исключительно разнообразных шутеров и экшенов, вы вероятно зашли сюда по ошибке. подумайте, нужна ли вам игра. есть возможность купить что-то другое.
2) дождитесь скидки, господа. игра и так недорогая, на скидке будет совсем дешевой.
3) покупайте. прямо сейчас. если вы фанат инди и вы "в теме" подобных инди. это must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055863702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1387709030}
review:
TFoL is a short game. And by saying "short" I mean "15 minutes", by saying "game" I mean "movie". First person view, a plot that quickly leads you through its corridor. You have nothing to do but move forward and see what is shown. You may look at screenshots and wonder: «So, it's all about talking boxes that represent the characters». And you'll be wrong. Cause they don't even talk.
Metascore rating based on critics' reviews is 88 out of 100.
Metascore rating based on users' reviews is 4.7 out of 10.
And that's the case when it's way too overrated by critics. Like if it's radical you should adore it just to feel yourself intelligent. It's just a story, and nothing but. Is it amazing? No, it's just good enough to entertain you for some time. It could have been much much better if the story was bigger, and there were more loose ends to connect.
I recommend it to buy only when on sale. $0.74 is okay. And don't replay it with a developer's commentary, you'll be increasingly disillusioned.
65 out of 100.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009954593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1388221671}
review: If you're looking for a superior narrative and truly unique experience, this is it! With so many big name, steaming dung heap offerings out there, trying way too hard to pass themselves off as "intellectual storylines" (yeah... I'm talking to you Irrational Games/2K with your Bioshock Infinite trainwreck) this title gets overlooked. A real shame in my book! Although some folks may not call this a game. I do. It makes you think. It makes you interact with the story. I also call it fascinating and a hell of a lot of fun. Mr. Brendan Chung put together a very memorable, very legitamate piece of art here. This should not be missed (and neither should Gravity Bone).

author: {'steamid': '76561198068296483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1388220964}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075145279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1394550338}
review:
This is one of those artistic experiences which can be enjoyed by some specific tastes. I'd say use caution if you're not into these type of storytelling games that are more about the story than gameplay.

I'd like to say- great game. The graphics aren't complex, the controls are simple- and yet the way everything is pieced together makes it a charming and fun experience you could only find in an indie game. Note that it comes with two games: Gravity Bone and Thirty Flights of Loving. I guess you could play Gravity Bone first as it is the prequel, but it didn't seem to make a huge difference for me.
The playthroughs are very short- I'd say about 10-15 minutes each game. I recommend to buy it on sale if you're going to buy it.

Overall, it's fun and short game. Recommended for the select taste, casual gamers. Not recommended for hardcore FPS collectors.
