author: {'steamid': '76561198118206815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1585983084}
review:
There seems to be a lot of frankly unwarranted hate for this game, although I will agree the price might be too high in the face of the short playtime.
I'm going to address that hate. If you want to see the review of the game itself, scroll down to "The Game(s) Itself"
What I'm seeing mainly boils down to this:

[b]1) It costs too much.
2) It's too short.[/b]
As for the cost, well, this was previously featured in a Humble Bundle. So it was part of a package, where you had freedom to set a price. Currently, it's barely over $1 on the Holiday Sale.
Is the normal asking price of $5 too much? Well, I would say yes, actually. The two games to me are effective, but very quick and not very good on replay unless you wait a while between plays, so it feels fresh on the next playthrough.
I say a range of about $2-3 would be better, though a "Set your own" option would be perfect. (if that's possible on Steam...not sure.)

Now for the game length.
Unfortunately, the 1st game, "Gravity Bone", seems downplayed by not even being mentioned as available in the "About the Game" section, it just states that this is the sequel to it.
I played through the 1st and 2nd game. It's found through "Career" in your Menu. Altogether, I spent about forty-five minutes, mainly because I got stumped in Gravity Bone while...looking for some birds. I even had to make a savepoint.
Anyway, I found a great balance between the two:
Gravity Bone is focused on the gameplay. More about finishing "Objectives".
Thirty Flights is focused on story and emotion.
Played back to back, you get far much more of a complete feel. The character is also the same across games.
Playing Gravity Bone first is better, since Gravity Bone is not as big on story and introduces you to the mechanics of the game. Also, a character in Gravity Bone later makes a cameo in Thirty Flights.

If one only plays Thirty Flights of Loving, I can completely understand that one would feel a bit underwhelmed by the rapidfire pace. Gravity Bone helps set up the story.

[b]The Game(s) Itself[/b]

For what these games are, I think both managed to be extremely effective. They present experiences well without dragging things out, without filler or fluff, and with virtually no dialogue, as far as I remember.

While playing these, instead of trying to rush through like you're speedrunning or something, it's good to at least let yourself get immersed in the games a bit.
Due to the nature of the storytelling, it's like placing yourself in someone's shoes for a while. What stood out to me is that by the end of each, you can come away from them feeling a good bit of connection to the story, especially in the case of Thirty Flights.

I personally think the way these games manage to present their stories well in such a short time frame is a great representation of what games can do. I would say I am quite proud that there is something like this that is challenging, even debatable (when considering the negative reviews) available to us gamers.

I eagerly await the next game from Blendo;  hopefully this time around with a pay-what-you-will option, or at least a lower cost.

NOTE: Two technical issues I did face. Gravity Bone crashed once while in fullscreen, I went to windowed, and never had that issue again. One small fix that would be worth the developer taking care of. Also my screen brightness seems to have been changed by the game, and I can't find out what specific system setting was altered. This does use the Quake 2 engine, so I may look into that...but I did manage to change it back through the brightness setting in the game until things looked calibrated again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025045453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1403372605}
review: Why does this game recieve praise? it was a few minutes of stupid looking, and poorly animated blocks zipping around in unexplained patterns. Almost all of the signs in this game are in spanish or even in german. There was very little to interact with. There is nothing to read and nothing to listen to, as there is no voice actining. It certainly isn't a visual experience since the graphics and animation are absolute rubbish. And above alll, there is almost no gameplay. You walk around, mostly forward. and click something to proceed to another scene where you do the exact same thing again. and then the game just ends. Please avoid this at all cost. I regret getting this game even for just a dollar. A waste of my money and a waste of my time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001263424', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1424141003}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961270379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1387824162}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996729863', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1387779246}
review:
Ta gra to większy syf niż polityka EA oraz model zarządzania THQ razem wzięte. Przejście zajmuje ~13 min i opiera się na trzymaniu "W" i od czasu do czasu manewrowaniu myszką by poprowadzić bohatera w odpowiednim kierunku. Jeszcze kilka razy należy nacisnąć "E". Fajnie, że opinia się podnieca tym, że gra jest "inna" i ma "niecodzienny" gameplay, ale zapomina się tu o jednej rzeczy: "Chłam to chłam i zawsze nim pozostanie, bez względu jak bardzo hipsterowaci jesteśmy"... "Historia" jest miałka - "Not sure if still better love story than Twilight", a sama "gra" powinna być raczej traktowana jako ciekawostka, ot taka odskocznia od gier mainstreamowych, ale już me skromne pojęcie przechodzi jak można za to bez wyrzutów sumienia chcieć pieniądze oraz jakim cudem to coś uzbierało 88/100 na metacriticu. 
Widocznie jestem zbyt wielkim prostakiem by docenić grę, która nie ma gameplayu, jakości, muzyki, sensu ani treści. Biedna ja i te moje wygórowane ambicje...

author: {'steamid': '76561197989986137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1387770456}
review:
This is the first sub $3 purchase I have made on Steam that I regret.  Which is a shame!  Because it starts off so well, and I thought "Gravity Bone" (the Blendo game prior to this) was more than decent.  

I just looked up reviews of the game, and there was an article on RPS that detailed the hidden 27 movie and game references.  So, you do the math.  With reading every piece of content in the game, it took me 13 minutes to complete.  That means that there is an in-joke more than twice every minute.

If you like to watch someone that wants to be considered an artist perform congratulatory masturbation on themselves in the time it takes to pee and start a load of laundry, then I guess this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968022690', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1365663600}
review: Thirty Flights of Puta Basura.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966276932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1387752362}
review: Thirty Flights is a short story in video game format. It purposely does away with cumbersome talk/text and relies solely on presenting visual clues. While the story isn't subtle, it could be easy to get confused if you're not paying attention. Play it twice, once normal, and then again with the director commentary and you should be able to piece it together. I can recommend this game for those who like experiences as much as games, although I would suggest waiting for a sale day as this short story is under thirty minutes long.

Consiglio di comprare il gioco quando in saldo perchè non credo che valga 5 euro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010756023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1353830400}
review: I honestly can't figure out how this (interactive story) game has received such praise, because it's the worst thing I've ever played. How people can believe that a 15-20 minutes disjointed story can provide an "emotional impact" is beyond me. You can't become attached to characters within that time frame because you don't really get to know them. I'm obviously a minority here, but despite what everyone is saying, this particular game is not a good form a storytelling. It's not worth $5, and I'm glad I bought it while on sale because even then I regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003039555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1387664313}
review: I played it this evening & to be honest I just went about it the wrong way - don't hurry through the 'game', just enjoy the mad little world it creates because a) it'll be over before you know it and b) there's not much that you can really alter in it! At least I don't think so...I'll have to try it again tomorrow & run a different way down the corridors, or something :) I definitely wouldn't pay more than £3-4 for this, but that's not a criticism, it just is what it is. While it's still 99p I'd definitely recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561197963644421', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1387634826}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is an indie art game which I found short, obtuse and largely uninteresting.

Speaking as someone who loved Dear Esther, and even Thirty Flights' developer's previous game ('Gravity Bone', which is included here as a free extra), I found myself thoroughly bewildered by Thirty Flights of Loving.

I was bewildered by the sloppy non-linear storytelling. The game hops, skips, and leaps, with all the grace of a big rig in a tutu. I've played through the whole game and read several summaries to make sure I wasn't missing anything, but even once I made sense of the story being told (a by-the-books tale of a criminal caper gone wrong), it didn't connect with me at all.

I was bewildered by the lack of flow within the gameplay. For such a short game, I was astonished to find myself stuck on at least two occasions. Normally I'd be the last person to call for such handholding tactics as blatant signposting or railroading of the player, but in this case the current state is completely at odds with the intended purpose. The developer obviously wants to tell a story, but I found it a trial just to get to the next part. This is not to mention the pointless interactions in the game which sometimes seem to serve no purpose whatsoever.

I was bewildered by the end. It came out of nowhere, and left me with the strongest feeling of 'is that it?' I think I've ever encountered with a game. I spent more time in the options menu than I did with the game itself. I wouldn't mind if it was some kind of masterpiece of storytelling, but it just wasn't.

Most of all, I was and am bewildered by the praise this game has garnered. 88% (at the time of writing) on Metacritic. Critical acclaim. Fans on the forums defending it to the hilt. I saw similar reactions to Dear Esther (which, as I said earlier, I felt deserved every bit of its praise), but I genuinely cannot understand it in this case.

Maybe I'm missing something huge here, but Thirty Flights of Loving was not an enjoyable, enlightening, or otherwise entertaining experience for me. I respect any developer who attempts to tell stories through games, but this feels like one of the more unfinished, unfocused efforts that I have played. Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059790370', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1606683888}
review:
What is there to say other than it is quite possibly the shortest game that i have ever played.

I like it however because it has an action film mood about it, the way that the game silently tells its story and that the game tells its story in such a small amout of time. there are of problems with this game that i think most players can agree with me on. 

1) Price; It is not value for money and the fact that I, have played around 15 minutes of it, porves that it might aswell be an  animation that used uploaded on to YouTube.
   A) Offers; I got this game when it was cheap and when it was on offer and for the price that it was at I thought that it was a fair price for such a small game.

2) Addons; The game comes with its sound tack that you can find in the games files and it also comes with it 'Documentry' you play the game agian only this time there's text bubbles, EVERYWHERE, every 5 steps you take theres a bubble of text that you have to read.

3) The 4th wall; At the end of the game it breaks the 4th wall to the point where the credits are part of the game and also they explain in game the pyshics of the games engine.
   A) Length; The end credit stuff is all filler to make the game longer.

I can't say wether I would recommend it or not, i going to say yes for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085174933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1387546940}
review: This game is great. It plays like an interactive story and has excellent style and flair. The only thing to keep in mind though is the length, its a little short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008560757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1623048662}
review:
One of the most interesting video game expierinces i've ever had.
It's all about air, movement, and life.
The wedding scene is one of the most beautifully surreal scenes i've ever encountered.
And it's nice to see the girl with pink bangs make a return, i knew she was up to no good the moment i saw her in Gravity Bone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995228810', 'num_games_owned': 2699, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1365577200}
review:
TFoL is a really cool game, though incredibly short - I'd say a single playthrough is about 20 minutes or so. It's still worth experiencing, though! You also get the previously released game Gravity Bone, which is also about as long, and a developer's commentary for TFoL which gives you an excuse to play through again.

It's definitely worth the $5 and if a sale pops up I'd definitely recommend picking this up!

The game lasts about 15 minutes...I know this sounds like a rip-off but it isn't!

Worth it if only for the experiment

author: {'steamid': '76561197979894180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1386148796}
review: Though it's only about fifteen minutes long, the story is certainly more memorable and entertaining than most first-person games of this generation. For fans of the avant-garde who are willing to pay for such an experience: a unique one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998694506', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1465351230}
review:
I've come back to this game and replayed it a few times. I insisted my wonderful (non-FPS-playing) girlfriend give it a try. I wanted to see if the story-telling that's packed into this silent, swift adventure was as rich an experience for someone completely uninitiated.

I have enjoyed each of the Blendo Games I tried, and I'm absolutely glad I bought this one. It's low-tech, and it's unpolished, and it's raw talent. Take the few bucks and the few minutes to enjoy this distraction.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960402457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1364108400}
review:
As an artist and part-time indie game developer, I feel like I should be especially appreciative of so-called "art games" - those games which don't follow the rules of traditional game design, and instead focus on immersing the player in a story that doesn't necessarily reward the player for winning or losing, but by virtue of the experience itself. So I occasionally try out games like this, in hopes that I will find something moving, inspiring, and interesting - not always expecting something fun. I'm willing to forgo the fun if the experience is enough by itself.

So when Thirty Flights of Loving went on sale, I checked review sites to see what they said. Right away I noticed a strong discord between the scores of professional reviewers and the scores given by the players. Simply put, reviewers seemed to love it, and players seemed to hate it. I decided to try it out anyway, in case my sense of art might give me some insight which the lower-scoring players lacked.

Unfortunately for Thirty Flights, after playing through the game, I have to side with the players on this one. This game isn't fun, and really just isn't that interesting.

The story is one you've seen many times in movies and on TV, but this time it's told via a cast of vaguely humanoid boxes. Reviewers called this game "lovingly crafted", but after the opening scene, it all felt incomplete to me. More like a sketch before the eventual painting.

At the end, which comes very quickly, you'll wonder what you just did for the last half hour. And then, like me, you'll probably wonder why you didn't do somethign else instead. You might even get mad that you spent money for this.

Don't get me wrong here - I don't like insulting the work of people who are clearly forging ahead into new, wonderful territory with games. It's tough for me to write such a negative review. But I don't feel like Thirty Flights is worth the praise reviewers gave it, and I wish that more time had be spent making it coherent, thoughtful, and even fun. It could have been a lot more than it is, and I just don't feel like what is here is something I can recommend to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012130710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1361692800}
review: I think being on acid would be similar to this game.... Good 15 mins of intresting story telling.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964416237', 'num_games_owned': 1118, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1385698645}
review: If you like surreal, artsy short films – you'll probably love Thirty Flights of Loving. It challenges what we perceive to be a game but unfortunately I cannot consider this as one. I want a game to be something that is thought-provoking and fun to play – and if it can't be thought-provoking, a game that's simply fun would suffice. I didn't have much fun playing Thirty Flights of Loving and it was all over in a matter of minutes so I can't say I was too impressed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051675171', 'num_games_owned': 1819, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1385873916}
review:
I ended up enjoying it, but i can't recommend Thirty Flights of Loving, unless you carefully read about it and knows exactly what you'll get or experience. Then you can find it cool, just after you understand what it is.

My first experience was disappointing.
Being someone who usually enjoy art games or interactive experiences, i start it thinking about a cool, deep story-driven game, but i found me just watching disordered short scenes of a shallow and confusing story, instead of really playing something. It ended really fast, abruptly and letting me with a "wtf?!" in mind. The graphics, lights, colors and music are really cool, but it was not enough to make me enjoy.

Then i try it again a few days later.
Knowing what to expect, the experience was far better, and i used to enjoy it and understand it. Using the commentaries feature, i found it was a developer experience, something really personal using his experiences on gaming design and pieces he previously wanted to use in other ways.

I don't read all the comments yet, and i still having to play better the Gravity Bone bonus, who seems to have more gameplay elements, but if you're ok with all that i said before, i can recommend this experience to you, it worth your time. But i'll not recommend to everybody, mostly without that explanation about what i feel in my first contact with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972543168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1378483575}
review: This game truly is a diamond in the rough. While the final result does not live up to the potential, it really is an interesting experiment with storytelling in games. Those who expect a more competent and complete experience will however be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970662135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1347260400}
review:
From the makers of Gravity bone (free download from the developer's site), comes an equally short game-like with emergant storytelling elements.

The game is 5 minutes long, max.  I am not joking about this.  But the plot told is better than some tripple-A titles I have played in the past (looking at you, Gears of War).

author: {'steamid': '76561197990341002', 'num_games_owned': 1344, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1348902000}
review: This game is just super cool, even though its not much of a game. This just goes to show that non-game games can be very successful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003019731', 'num_games_owned': 1876, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1345878000}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving é a continuação do experimento Gravity Bone, do exótico Brendon Chung. Gravity Bone é gratuito, Thirty Flights of Loving custa US4,49.

Thirty Flights of Loving é ainda menos um "jogo" do que seu antecessor. Você não toma nenhuma decisão relevante. Você não encontra nenhum desafio.

Thirty Flights of Loving brinca com a linearidade da narrativa e nos introduz novas formas de se apresentar personagens e situações. Não há diálogos, mas muitos mistérios. É genial.

Thirty Flights of Loving dura 16 minutos.

É isso.

Originalmente publicado em: http://blog.retinadesgastada.com.br/2012/08/jogando-thirty-flights-of-loving.html

author: {'steamid': '76561197961768818', 'num_games_owned': 4045, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review:
This is a neat tech demo, as it would be a very good way to tell a story... but the story given is not complete. There's only half a story (and not a good one at then), then it ends after literally 15 minutes.

I would recommend this if it were free, but dear god do not pay money for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982376514', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1500944703}
review: Not for non-intellectuals.  Meant to be stepped through carefully, not rushed through.  And it's an interactive "short story", it says so in the trailer, that's what you get.  So keep all that in mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018455391', 'num_games_owned': 2291, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1365663600}
review: More of an experience than a game. I bought it because everyone was raving about its originality. It's clear that the creator was trying to say something by it, but I'm scratching my head to figure out what it was. Felt like a tech demo, a tech demo which should have had someone narrating it. Walking from room to room does not a game make.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999167949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1632799667}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is an experimental story-game which uses bizarre music, weird visuals, crazy level design, and a hyper-confindent lack of context or explanation to tell an entire criminal-caper-drama-film's worth of story in something under ten minutes.

If you don't want to experience a weird ten-minute story told entirely in inarticulate mumbles, frantic jazz, and bloom effects, this game is not for you, and I'm sorry, but you're missing out.

This game also includes Gravity Bone, which exists on the internet as a free download but is convenient to have here. Gravity Bone is one of the best freeware FPS experiments ever made, and a joy to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964984451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1385447390}
review:
This review will be a double-feature, taking a look at both Gravity Bone and Thirty Flights of Loving, since Gravity Bone is included in the package. Keep in mind, however, that Gravity Bone was released as freeware, and while I do not recommend Thirty Flights of Loving at all, Gravity Bone is something that I recommend highly.

Gravity Bone is neat for a number of reasons. Despite being low-tech, the art style is quite striking, and it is used to great effect in a couple of set-pieces within the game. In fact, it is one of the few things that is retained in its sequel, Thirty Flights of Loving. Gravity Bone itself is quite short however, involving only a couple of missions with various objectives. All of this is done in the first-person perspective, but the game is not what you would call a first-person shooter. Now, I do wish that there was more to the game, as the missions themselves play out nicely, and they work as an excellent demonstration on how to engage the player without having them shoot at things constantly, which is often the case in the first-person games that it resembles. And the game comes together wonderfully at the end, with a fast-paced end sequence, and an ending that is on the good side of eccentric and confusing, which wraps up the tale very well. All taking place with full input of the player, save for the end sequence. But here this brief absence of control is justified perfectly within the contextual landscape the game has painted.

So while Gravity Bone is a demonstration of where first-person games could take us, Thirty Flights of Loving instead presents us with a few brief minutes of scarcely interactive slideshow, composed of random elements devoid of context, all taking place along a non-linear timeline. It is a mess of a presentation, and one which is just plain confusing, and there ends up being nothing thought provoking at all in the experience. What it does have are some references to Gravity Bone, but those come off as disconnected and pointless, as well as other similarly ineffective references to other things which have no bearing to what you are doing. However, there are some hidden environmental details that are revealed if you pay attention, but they have no real bearing within Loving's framework, given how non-interactive the experience is.

Now, I would not normally be so harsh on a sequel for being different. However in this case, not only is it different, those new features only detract from the experience. All that Thiry Flights of Loving manages to be, is a slideshow of variously surreal and not-so-surreal scenes cobbled together, and which do not actually require the player to be present in the slightest, and the entire game is over in under ten minutes. Where Gravity Bone was an engaging and impressive demonstration of how you could tell a story in the first-person, Thirty Flights of Loving is just an incomplete set of narrative fragments which are left to the played to  struggle to reconstruct. Even then, without any real input from the player, one must wonder what motivation the player is meant to have to attempt this, when the fragments are so far-flung, and the reward for collecting them so unsatisfying.

As far as picking up this game goes, you could say that you picked it up in order to give some recognition to Gravity Bone. But by itself, there really is no reason whatsoever to play Thirty Flights of Loving.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970403228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1356854400}
review:
TFOL has value as an experiment in storytelling, but as a game for which I paid cash, I am seriously underwhelmed.

A lot of the praise for TFOL has to do with how it doesn't bombard you with narrative and hold your hand with mindless cutscenes. They say it lets you figure out the story for yourself. Well, to that I say good luck. If you can find a coherent story in TFOL somewhere then I laud your truly magnificent gift of insight. I challenge anyone sitting on their pretentious thrones of higher criticism to tell me what the plot and story in this game are. My guess is no one really knows.

The world is kind of cute. And things like rushing through mobs of fast-moving people in an airport with a wounded team member slung over your shoulder to a soundtrack reminiscent of James Bond and The Good, The Bad, And The Ugly (a la Quentin Tarantino) are novel and a little exciting. But your actions affect nothing. It's basically a slide show. There was no purpose for several the key bindings (not kidding) and none of the objects you can pick up have any function whatsoever.

This should have been freeware for all the value it offers. I hate being tough on independent developers but I will need to be extra skeptical of Blendo Games' work in the future after this experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007428578', 'num_games_owned': 1801, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1359964800}
review:
Got this after hearing a lot of positive reviews and just didn't enjoy it at all. Grated it's supposed to be short but i just didn't see the appeal of it. After playing it a lot of the fawning over this game seems a bit pretentious.

I guess it's one of those things where you either love it or hate it.

1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197989843893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1365663600}
review:
Don't buy it, it's crap:
Minecraft looks better and you really don't need that much skill as a dev to pull that off.
You just walk around in this "game" looking for the exit.
The story is not "memorable" or "impressive".
It is a whole 13 minutes long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065334078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1346050800}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981019805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1359100800}
review:
Will you be Loving this game wile waliing up Thirty Flights? Sure, but its more of a Short Story then a Game So just know that going into it.
My Video Review:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KvBt2Cm17Xk&list=PL324F8735ECCE6C63&index=13

author: {'steamid': '76561198025292341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1345964400}
review:
O melhor: A originalidade e estilo artístico do jogo; a forma de contar uma narrativa na primeira pessoa; a sensação de novidade; a inclusão do jogo Gravity Bone e de comentários do criador.

O pior: Os 5 euros; Não existir uma “longa-metragem” do Citizen Abel

Thirty Flights of Loving é uma das experiências de jogo mais curiosas dos últimos tempos, não só pelos seus curtos, mas fantásticos, 10 minutos, mas pelo preço que nos pedem por uma sessão de jogo que dura menos tempo que um café. Vai ser impossível ficarem indiferentes quando chegarem, rapidamente, ao final e o misto de emoções pelo qual vão passar, do espanto à indignação é em si uma nova forma de jogar. Fica à vossa consideração, mas joguem-no.

Esta análise foi originalmente publicada no site RubberChickenGames

author: {'steamid': '76561198050596305', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1354089600}
review: A wierd little semi-interactive story, don't spend too much as there exists basically no replay value. All that being as it is this is a cool little wierd thing, reminds me of some kind of experimental art film, very worth your time if you can get a good deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043901006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1384928684}
review: Beautifully written but punishingly short, this game made me add it to Favorites, but I deleted local content because there's really no point in playing it twice unless you've forgotten what happens. It takes an oddly precise amount of time to play on your once-through because you are not a player, you are a decisionless window through which the story is told. A good story, of course, but I'd save your five dollars and ask a friend to let you play his copy instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961093505', 'num_games_owned': 4634, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1381786877}
review:
If you got this for under five dollars you purchased a really interesting, fun little games-as-art piece that was totally worth it.

If you got this for over five dollars, god dammit, Carl, read more before you buy shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085731163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1414096338}
review:
Amazing, unclear and funny game! Does this game have any idea? :D You don't get storyline, nothing basically. First time you spawn random room in shopping mall and you can only walk and jump.

So, this game has 2 levels. In first one you can only jump and walk, adventure on map and kid however you want.
            
The second one is more difficult and rational. You need to take photography birds and do other fun stuff! Of course you have items in this part!

Not one of the best-, but one of the funniest titles in my libary! This is indiegame is from 'blendogames'. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043902738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1384097393}
review: I don't think this game needs any more recommendation, but if you are interested in short and solid story telling by a FPS perspective, you should buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001781979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1383703019}
review:
Wonderful. Enchanting. Brilliant. Third-person pineapple; petulant ducks and Maple Victory; Quesomancy; Wheel of Morality. Midnight Hobo 7000 proof vodkahol.

Out non-games, artfags, and emo-trashes all the other indie artfag non-games out there. Best 15 minutes in gaming. Etc.

Gravity Bone is good too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968634964', 'num_games_owned': 1132, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1383549327}
review: Weird, quirky, interesting, and thought provoking.  Definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021396018', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1383496008}
review:
[h1]Expérience narrative plus qu'un jeu.[/h1]

Pas de difficuté, pas de défi particulier, un jeu réduit à l'aspect narratif. Mais pour le coup, l'expérience n'est pas inintéressante non plus.

Très court, moins de 15 minutes pour en voir le bout.
Il inclut en supplément "Gravity Bone", le mod Quake 2 d'origine du même développeur ainsi qu'un mode "commentaires du développeur".

Je le recommande pour la curiosité.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063495222', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1384190195}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961742105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1383100057}
review: It's a neat game, and a fun way to tell a story, but it's 15 minutes long, at best. So it may be a stretch to pay $5 for it. Wait for a sale. But still, you should play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027055565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1381936789}
review:
Суть игры 'Thirty Flights of Loving' в том, чтобы рассказать несколькочасовой сюжет за 12 минут. А на деле 'Thirty Flights of Loving' вообще трудно назвать игрой в традиционном понимании, так как здесь нет привычного всем геймплея.  Но зато как умело разработчики смогли рассказать историю! На протяжении всей игры (10-15 минут) история постоянно чередуется различными флешбэками и отвлетвениями, так что сюжет оказывается довольно захватывающим, динамичным и запутанным.
После финала истории, чтобы понять весь сюжет и сопоставить все факты друг с другом вам придётся поразмышлять и распутать клубок запутанной истории, а когда вам получиться раставить все точки в запутанном сюжете игры, вы испытаете просто непередоваемые эмоции.
ОЦЕНКА: 8,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197980164371', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1382818068}
review: TFoL ist mMn seine 5 Euro wert. Sehr geniale "Erzählperspektive" und intuitive Steuerung. Man wünscht sich einfach innig, dass das Spiel länger wäre. Spielzeit: ca. 10-15 Minuten xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198069118702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1382555969}
review: This is a quick mind-fuck of a game. Its narrative is fragmented, its soundtrack is bombastic, and the whole thing seems to operate under its own rules. After playing it the first time, I was still completely confused by the entirety of the experience; all fifteen minutes of it. But going through what you've seen to piece everything together is part of the appeal. TFoL succeeds in creating a method of storytelling that uses gameplay as the primary vehicle of the narrative, and for that it should be commended. I recommend it. Just don’t be surprised if piecing the narrative together takes longer than the actual game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972521061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1382494471}
review: I'm not sure if I'm high brow, game artsy enough to "get" this. The reviewers seem to give it at least an 8/10 across the board, but all I saw was shit flying around me for 10 minutes and half a disjointed story before it said "Game Over, press esc".

author: {'steamid': '76561197960414632', 'num_games_owned': 2979, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1643355525}
review: short #nice# indie eXperiEnce

author: {'steamid': '76561198050913833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1382403988}
review: An extremely simple game in terms of graphics and sound, yet the feel of it is surprisingly fluid and natural feeling.  Being someone who rarely finishes storylines in games, this was one of the few games that I have completed.  This is partly because of the fact that the entire plot fits into about fifteen minutes.  Despite the short time, it remains entertaining throughout, providing a well developed story.  For the cheap price, I would definitely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962050491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1360051200}
review: This is a sequel of sorts to the freeware title "Gravity Bone".  This is what you get when you make a story-based game about a heist, and distill it to something you can play in one sitting.  Short, sweet, and highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970265293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1382328309}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018923862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1382111893}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031438968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1382082712}
review:
[h1]VERDICT[/h1] [b]Wait for sale (6.5/10)[/b]
Completion Time: 10-20 minutes
Bottom Line: "[i]A virtual picturebook[/i]"

[h1]PROS[/h1]
+Engaging and Unique
+Storytelling like never before

[h1]CONS[/h1]
-Very very short

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]

After having completed this game multiple times now, I am left speechless. This is an incredibly engaging and unique experience that is simply incomparable to anything else out there. There is no way for me to tell you anything about the game without spoiling it. I would even advise against watching the trailer. What I will say is that this game is purely about story, and not about gameplay. Consider it a virtual picture book of sorts. 

That being said, this game is only 10 minutes long. You heard correctly. Ten minutes. If you include the second campaign in the package (which was the first project by this studio) you have a total of around 20 minutes. So if you are going to buy the game, get it on sale for a couple dollars. In my humble opinion, the money is well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043964722', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1465400639}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967714806', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1381696424}
review:
Odd little games, wonderfully realized in the kmquake2 engine.

The developer's commentary in TFOL was a great peek into game design decisions and process. I wish there was more.

I'd recommend TFOL only if it is on a steep sale and only if you're interested in experiments in narrative using games as a medium.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961744176', 'num_games_owned': 1932, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1381523246}
review:
One word, fantastic!

A great omage and insipiration for all game designers and people interested in game design.

Great visual style and a definite labor of love from the author.

The only downside is the length with is a bith short, about 30 min to 1 hour, if you play it again with commentary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046951393', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1385814423}
review:
Be advised, don't waste your time and money on half baked indie shovelware such as this "game". 
It makes me wonder who had the audacity to call this an actual game as a game's very purpose is to provide fun and entertainment. 
This game does neither of both and instead, it stands as a pretentious attempt at something
that'll most likely leave you scratching your head and wishing for a refund.

Pros: The art style is about the one thing that's been done right, the simplistic aesthetics are pleasing on the eyes.

Cons: If you were expecting a game, with...you know, gameplay, you'll find little to nothing of that here. Not for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997555099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1357632000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044558327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1346310000}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving is that one dream that woke you up, sweating

author: {'steamid': '76561197969010904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1357977600}
review:
非常に実験的な作品でアドベンチャーゲームというよりインタラクティブアートといった感じのゲームです。

往年のスパイ映画を思わせるクールな音楽がとってもグッド。
ゲームプレイに関しては分かる人は分かる、でもわからない人には全く理解できない内容のようです。
そして私は不幸にも後者でした。

同じ作者の前作「Gravity Bone」（フリーゲーム）もついてます。
どんな内容のゲームか知りたい人はGravity Boneをプレイしてみるのもいいかも知れません。

author: {'steamid': '76561197991636123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1357200000}
review: Much like Dear Esther this game (and its included predecessor Gravity Bone) concentrates on the narrative, so it's more of a story to experience, than a game you could actually "play" (apart from moving around). Also it's short. I mean really short. As in "20-minutes-short". But still manages to tell a better story in this short time than most other games do in multiple hours. I found it to be quite captivating and once you finish it, there is still a lot to think about. I'd say this "game", just like Dear Esther, comes closer to being art than to being a game. So definitely not for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036952934', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1364799600}
review: This game presents a story in 15 minutes that's better than half of the movies I've seen this year. Buy it. Play it. Play it again. Then smile; walk away; in a few days, come back and play it again, just because it's so wonderful. I promise you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066464431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1364540400}
review: This game is a dissapointment to "Gravity bone" as it is short, Not very exciting. I saw other reviews and they said this had a "Story", I'm not sure about that but notice I've only played one minute on this game.... Because that's how long it bloody took to finish it... Seal of Dissaproval [Insert Horse Emoticon here]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970522234', 'num_games_owned': 1869, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1376154800}
review: Well this "game" is not really a game at all. It's a short story plain and simple. The gameplay consists of moving through a one way corridor with no branching paths to explore. The "story" is told free of dialogue and the visuals jump from beginning to end in a very Tarantino sort of way. It's simplistic and stylish but the whole thing only lasts for about 10 minutes, so at the full price of $5 it's a tough recommendation. If it goes on sale or you're just curious give it a try. Otherwise there's not a whole lot to be missed

author: {'steamid': '76561197970493720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1558815723}
review: Beautiful interactive storytelling.  I hope to see more of this kind of game in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994527992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1376009942}
review:
TFoL is... hmm... well, it's... umm... no, that's not quite right... gimme a second to think, here... uhhhhhhhhh... ok, so................. yeah. This game is kind of hard to explain. And actually, explaining it kind of defeats the purpose, anyways. So I guess what I will say is that this is... sort of like a Quentin Tarantino film that's been super-condensed to a length of just 15 minutes and turned into an art experiment. There's no "gameplay" to speak of - it's a first person interactive story-slash-art-piece, nothing more. The graphics are as simple as can be, but it has some cool ideas and is worth checking out if you are open to these sorts of artsy game experiments. I wasn't kidding before, though - the experience is over in literally 15 minutes or so. So just keep that in mind as far as your personal "price vs. playtime" factor goes. 

One other note: this game also includes its prequel, "Gravity Bone", for free. I recommend playing this first. To access it, click "career" in the main menu and select Gravity Bone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994315964', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1358496000}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving had fifteen minutes of thrill to offer me and zero fat. But a little fat adds flavor, and this is a bit too lean to be worth more than $2 in my eyes. $2 well spent, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047580686', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1375849591}
review:
I'm not sure if I can "reccomend" this as a game.

This isnt a game, its an experence. That is in no way a bad review, simply a strange one.

Which perfectly reflects this "game".

author: {'steamid': '76561198011553078', 'num_games_owned': 2061, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1375624228}
review: This is the short, avant-garde version of Dear Esther seen through the eyes of a film student with a penchant for Tarantino, noir and the new wave. If you have any interest in game design or interactive fiction, this and the included Gravity Bone are both worth a look. The designer's commentary is also worthwhile, but even then you're looking at an hour tops. The real value is in the many more questions it raises than it ever has any intention in answering. Thinkers need only apply. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198024354933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1374758302}
review: Guys, it's like a breath of expensive wine, but only a sip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012660184', 'num_games_owned': 4460, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1374718046}
review:
I do not in fact understand what just happened.

This is interesting.  Reading the developer commentary is more interesting.  Uh... don't pay much for it though.  Seriously.  It's not really a game in any normal sense of the word (ie it has no gameplay, and the story is incredibly minimalist).

If you can get it on the cheap or get it as a gift, it's certainly a unique experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994803244', 'num_games_owned': 2218, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1374552926}
review: This has got to be the scammiest "game" I've ever played.  Short, pointless, and zero game elements.  Save yourself the money and watch a "Let's Play" video instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999200152', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1357200000}
review: Watch a YouTube walkthrough. There: I've saved you a fiver.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965090689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1347260400}
review: Sequel to Gravity Bone. First-person adventure game with style out the wazoo. Nods to great film directors like Wes Anderson and Quentin Tarantino.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993680608', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1375239941}
review:
I was told that this was the best 15 minutes of storytelling that someone had ever experienced. After playing it, I agree. 
Thirty Flights of Loving is a tale of prohibition era bankrobbers told in much the same way we remember and dream - in fragments, emotions, and scattered images. Beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053422085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1374781660}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving is an indie FPS set inside an action movie.  This game manages to tell its story in an interesting way and in short amount of time.  It takes roughly a half hour to beat but leaves you feeling more than satisfied and wishing for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971253482', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1664077620}
review:
A 10 minute dramatic non-linear jump cut narrative about love and a heist gone horribly wrong.  Cue a Steven Soderbergh film...except with zero dialogue and about 20 times shorter. 

The spiritual predecessor Gravity Bone is also included. (it's otherwise free)

author: {'steamid': '76561197992672831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1373914503}
review: An intriguing romp through a very curious  world. Though it might seem a bit short of gameplay it does a great job of  piecing together an interesting story wihtout relying on heavy text or dialogue. It's a great example of how a game can convey ideas and context in the simplest of ways. Not a bad grab for the price if you're looking for an unusual gaming experience you're not soon to forget. I think Gravity Bone also comes with the package and I really ended up enjoying even more than TFOL itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983133529', 'num_games_owned': 2867, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1373867548}
review: I honestly don't know what to say. This is more of an experience or a story than a game, but it is definitely memorable. It's shorter than I expected, and I was disappointed when it ended so quickly because I was enjoying myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054379888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1372672486}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013794241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1423597243}
review: A quick little storytelling experiment. Fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997287605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1353657600}
review: An obvious 9th symphony of modern gaming

author: {'steamid': '76561198065263763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1373562918}
review: I had unexplainable fun with this game! It's probably not everyone's cup of tea, but if you are a fan of unique storytelling, you will probably like this game as much as me. Very often players are "trained" to wait for some NPC to tell you to do something, but in this game you just need to think what are you actually doing, and it just keeps you thinking. It's a pretty short game, but I enjoyed it - it's like reading a quirky book, browsing a great collection of stylized art, with a little bit of pulp fiction, and a bit of personal connections and a bit of reality here and there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011769329', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1425002057}
review: in only a 1/2 hour of playtime this game does more in terms of narrative then most games do in 40. This sounds completely pretentious but i truly mean it--this is video game poetry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044751849', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1371781701}
review: Like Quentin Tarantino meets Panique au Village; totally bats**t insane, but with a remarkably compelling and dark story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994570583', 'num_games_owned': 3045, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review: I wish I cared just a little more for this game than I do. Oh, it's fun. I much prefer it to rather more self-serious efforts like Dear Esther (get back to me on The Path, though). It's just, uh, yes, it is fifteen minutes long. And it is a really heady blitz of a fifteen minutes, don't get me wrong. This dude can splice together sequences and there's a tone to the game that's at once playful, surreal, and kind of sad. That's no little thing. But if there were just this titch more /game/ . . .

author: {'steamid': '76561198013958277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1527431893}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964950321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1365922800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054048330', 'num_games_owned': 2263, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1366009200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048948806', 'num_games_owned': 4915, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1370522680}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960377283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1369577526}
review:
If you haven't played it yet because your catalog of 'games to play' is just overflowing : just launch it - it only takes 10 minutes to finish. 

Don't expect a game, it's a short story told in the form of an FPS. 

I don't think it's worth the 5€ I see it listed for but I got it in a bundle and I don't regret those 10 minutes of my life I spent on it, even if it was a bit quirky. Or perhaps because it was quirky.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970291212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1369448709}
review: Stylish, but empty. Like a flashy suit on a passed out drunk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996297524', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1471996139}
review: There's really not much to say about Thirty Flights of Loving that shouldn't wait to be said until AFTER people have played it. It's a fantastic exercise in storytelling and technically deft when it comes to player agency. Not what I expected, but certainly nothing to sneeze at. Check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983934036', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1368687600}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is a game that, just like To the Moon and Kentucky Route Zero, proves how powerful the interactive medium of video games can be in telling a story. Played from a first-person view, there is virtually no traditional gameplay, aside from being able to interact with the environment and explore its nooks and crannies. The soundtrack and the sound design are great, as well as its graphical presentation. The blocky characters, the usage of color, and the varied environments all mesh together into a game that looks quite unlike any other.

But yes, there is nothing the player really does in the game, at least, not in the traditional sense. The real reason to play this game is for its story and, more specifically, the way the game presents its story. By employing the mechanics of film editing and cutting freely between events and scenes without any sort of input from the player, Thirty Flights of Loving spins the classic yarn of a heist gone horribly wrong in a wholly unique way. Its non-linearity and hectic pace is a refreshing change from the banality of most video game narratives, and the player truly has to work in order to understand everything that's happening. While the game can be completed in fifteen minutes or so, the scope and depth of the story told is one that far exceeds its actual runtime. Multiple playthroughs are not only necessary but also inevitable.

Thirty Flights of Loving is certainly not for everyone. Many players have expressed outrage or frustration at the fact that the "game" isn't really much of one at all. Brendon Chung, the creator of the game, has himself described it as "an interactive short story". Ultimately, it does not matter. Thirty Filghts of Loving is a very important game, because it makes a legitimate attempt to tap into the vast potential for video games as a narrative medium. If that sounds at all interesting to you, go play Thirty Flights of Loving. It's an experience that you won't soon forget.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972314430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1527259713}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000788644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1367823600}
review:
Brendon Chung takes the the linear storytelling bar set by games like Half-Life 2 and Bioshock, turns it on its end, sticks it into the ground and offers a fifteen minute pole dance which may annoy the less adventurous gamers but definitely earns and deserves every dollar the rest of us threw at him for the privilege of watching.

No doubt, it is not as easy as he makes it look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034444591', 'num_games_owned': 6559, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1366614000}
review: Same as Dear Esther this should be labeled as interactive story, as you don’t really control what is happening. The narrative is very good, making flashbacks and forwards to make emphasis in certain aspects of the plot, which is not bad either. It is incredibly short, 45 minutes or less, but for the price is not bad. One thing I really liked is that the developers added the freeware prequel to the steam version, so you can have both in Steam. Most developers should follow this example.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044326656', 'num_games_owned': 5480, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1366700400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014237611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1366614000}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973012562', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1370974273}
review:
Do not buy this if you expect a game, this is primarily meant to be a very short movie (10 minutes or less to complete), with a unique art style. Honestly the best time I had in this game was the fact that at one point you can peel and eat an orange. That was fun, the rest.. well mostly a waste of time and I got a headache from playing it. You cannot do anything yourself, other than some small interactions that have absolutely no influence on the game. You can pick up guns and other items, all of which you will never see and cannot use. 

That said, I bought it knowing somewhat what it was, as I intended to use it for a study project. But nope, even then I cannot recommend it. Its way too expensive for what it is, and should to be priced right be free. 

You can get a similar experience and a lot more fun from both free and paid games of this type.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011647032', 'num_games_owned': 12455, 'num_reviews': 868, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1365663600}
review: This was a very unique game to play, it gets you confused in the start and then lays itself out for you as you play. You will have to play this game a couple times to understand the whole story of it. I really loved playing this game a couple times. The game takes 10 minutes to beat unless you look at everything. There are 3 parts to this game. I really like the commentary portion of the game because it gave you a deeper understanding about the whole game and why they did what they did. The graphics were interesting and funny to look at when you got close, but it was well done. This game tells you stories which are well done and intriguing to follow. There isn't any puzzles in the game, you are just told a story. There is no really challenge in the game except to just enjoy it. Its a great game and I very much enjoyed it. I would get this game on sale, then you will feel like you got your moneys worth. It was a great story to go through, just make sure to enjoy the whole game and go through all three parts of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007036924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1370654676}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024696463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1417418060}
review:
This is a good visually driven game which tells you the conclusion to a series of games this developer created many years ago.

The presentation is excellent, the music is incredibly fitting, the pacing is good and it has quite some care on few small details.

I enjoyed it a lot, Don't be fooled because the game is around 10 minutes long (with other 10 minutes for it's prequel), it's pretty enjoyable and unique, can't say much without spoiling the story other than how enjoyable it was.

review:
Well . . . that was weird.

Thirty Flights of Loving is a weird little first person narrative.  It's Reservoir Dogs without all of the talking parts removed.

Also, it's really short (fifteen minutes if you make sure to look at every little detail . . . and the game is pretty detailed) and not particularly replayable.  But it's still pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064532471', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1365577200}
review:
Love, espionage, guns, ducks, and floating people litter the bittersweet world of Thirty Flights of Loving.
The short story (~10-15 minutes) takes you on a wild ride that flash-cuts quickly from fast-paced action scenes to tranquil and reflective moments of characterization (think Pulp Fiction).
At the end you can play through again with developer commentary which I found to be informative and fun, and the pseudo-prequel (and much more game-y) Gravity Bone is included as well. 
Get it while it's on sale if it sounds like it interests you. It is a memorable little experiment, but $5 seems a touch too steep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025155543', 'num_games_owned': 2597, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1365663600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041354567', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1370590113}
review:
Definitivamente um dos anti-jogos mais interessantes que conheci até agora. Em cerca de 15 minutos, você presencia uma história viceral e confusa, sem uma linearidade narrativa, da qual te cofunde o tempo todo com cortes totalmente imprevisíveis e constantes para contar a cena de um crime. Sem dúvidas é para se jogar mais vezes, para conseguir absorver tanta coisa, além de preencher as lacunas com suas próprias interpretações.

E super recomendo esse review do João Neto do Ataque Crítico: http://ataquecritico.com.br/thirty-flights-of-loving-e-um-antijogo-e-isso-e-otimo/

(nota: ele inclue também comentários do criador e o jogo Gravity Bone, antecessor do Thirty Flights)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999345260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1364626800}
review:
So, I've been a fan of Blendo Game's stuff in the past.  I have put an absurd amount of hours into Atom Zombie Smash, and enjoyed my time in Flotilla.  I more recently discovered that another Blendo Game, Gravity Bone, was available on free from the studio's website, and after playing it, decided to throw down the $5 to play Thirty Flights of Loving.

I'm not sure it was worth it.

First thing's first: 30 Flights is really short.  I played through the game once normally and again with "developer commentary" on, and it took just a bit over a half hour combined.  I know it shouldn't be a factor, but as someone with a small amount of free money, I have to think about time value.  While I had fun with 30 Flights, I'm not sure I had $5 worth of fun.

That said, 30 Flights is fun.  It isn't a game, really...more of a short story told from a first person view.  It's a pretty wild ride, shifting from quiet moments to in-your-face intense moments with jarring smash cuts that fit the tone of the game well.  

If you are curious about the game, I'd recommend giving Gravity Bone a spin first, which is available free at the Blendo Games site.  If you like it, go ahead and play 30 Flights...but I'd recommend waiting for a sale.  Even if I enjoyed it, $5 for 15 minutes is a hard sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071540648', 'num_games_owned': 1750, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1400283179}
review: It only lasts about 15 minutes, but it's one of the most interestingly told narratives I've experienced in a video game.  Playing again with developer commentary was pretty interesting as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975031770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1364626800}
review: This game may be short (about 15 min), but it's a pretty cool experience that you'll want to play through a couple times to make sense of the whole story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970307991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1364367600}
review: Do not buy this game.  It is the gaming equivalent of modern art.  People who like it will tell you that you "just don't get it," if and when you don't feel the same way.  The game is something like 7 minutes long.  I'm not kidding. 7 minutes.  The storytelling mechanic is sort of neat, but there's just not enough story.  This isn't a game.  It's an electronic pamphlet hinting at a story that was never written.  Please.  Skip this title.  Don't encourage them to sell more of this shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970918339', 'num_games_owned': 1223, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1364626800}
review: In a day and age where the price tag should mark the amount of content and quality to the game, Thirty Flights of Loving comes up short of the former, but the latter is achieved through a unique take on storytelling where it does better in 15 minutes than what most games try to do in 15 hours. It's a quirky experiment and hard to understand at first, but it's nice to see there can be games out there that respect your deduction skills and intelligence, a fact alone that demands your time, money, and attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006476640', 'num_games_owned': 7380, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1364194800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074164330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1363676400}
review: "Thirty FLights of Loving" ist das mit Abstand verwirrenste Spiel, welches ich jemals gespielt hab'. Ein Spiel, das innerhalb von 10 Minuten gespielt ist, völlig ohne Sprache auskommt und dennoch eine in sich geschlossene und grandiose Gangsterstory erzählt. Leider habe ich den Vorgänger "Gravity Bone" nicht gespielt - nach den letzten 10 Minuten muss ich das allerdings schnell nachholen. Empfehlenswert für Leute, die auf Stories im Kleinkunstformat stehen und sich eine Geschichte nicht ausschließlich brühwarm erzählen lassen wollen, sondern auf Schnörkel und Dramaturgie verzichtend, Abenteuer suchen. 10 MInuten, einfache Story, minimalistisch erzählt und dennoch das Geld wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994242507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1366009200}
review: An amazing experiment in interactive storytelling. Beautiful. It almost made me cry (but not as much as "To the Moon").

author: {'steamid': '76561198025570993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1362902400}
review:
I played through this 3 times trying to piece together what the hell happened.  That's part of the intrigue of the game though.  It's open to interpretation and everyone will come away with a different understanding of the events.  The gameplay itself is pretty dull, but the random jumps in time keep things interesting.  The game also includes a free copy of Gravity Bone which is more fun since it's more interactive.

5/10

review:
Um...yeah.
I don't care how wierd and obtuse it gets, I will buy everything made by Brendon Chung / Blendo.
This one - it's bizarre in a lovely way. 
Look at the crazy blockhead people; you will come to care about them. In a game that potentially could be completed in about 20 minutes. Except you are never told what to do.
Soooo - it'll take quite a bit longer on the first playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980940920', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1361088000}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987050685', 'num_games_owned': 1064, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1362124800}
review:
Thirty Flights of Loving is Blendo Games short, similar, follow-up to their prior release of "Gravity Bone".

Thirty Flights follows the same style and make-up of the first game, with the same kinds of punches and surprises, but stylised in a nicer manner, with more focus on "the story" (what little of it there is) than "the game" (such as Gravity Bone).

The game is incredibly short. 15-20 minutes long, but succeeds in delivering you a firm understanding of an interesting story in that time, using dynamic scene changes and blends.

It's okay. I enjoyed it. For the price of £3.99? Not worth it. £0.99? Definitely worth the play. The game also has a "Developer commentary" mode, similar to the Portal 1 developer mode, where you can activate text-points throughout the game for more info on the scene, but whenever I ran this mode the game crashed within 1 minute of activating the dialogue boxes, so I was unable to complete it at all in this mode, sadly.

A decent injection from Blendo, but I expected more, from their clearly very talented team.

Nilesy

author: {'steamid': '76561198044773117', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1405562749}
review:
Not really a game, an interactive narrative like the more popular Dear Esther. 

It's very short, only about 15 minutes, but it's a nice little experiment and a nice narrative.  Since it's so short you'll likely play it a few times. It also has a nice commentary mode which provides a little insight into some development decisions. 

It's hard to justify spending 5 bucks on this game considering how short the experience is. If you can get it on sale though go for it, I can imagine it being a nice gift game.

TFOL also includes it's prequel which is available for free on the developer's website.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039258274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1612921153}
