author: {'steamid': '76561197970170748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1360656000}
review: Thirty Seconds of Gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061145084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1361606400}
review: After playing this, I felt like the guy staring at the blank canvas at the art museum. Others around me swear there is something there, but it's lost on me. This game is one of those 'not a games,' -- a pseudo game. It can be completed in less than five minutes and if you're like me, staring at the blank canvas and seeing art supplies, will feel your money would be better spent on something that is more of an actual game. Not a recommendation, just a word of caution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976599923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1361606400}
review:
This game... I don't know if I could even say game... This piece of wonderful art is about 5 minutes long when ran through, but 15 minutes if you take your time to absorb the world. 

This was brilliant. With its numerous film, and video game homages, and it's Spy-esque story, we're thrown into a world without dialogue but powerful narrative. It's a game that runs like a film with flashbacks and jarred sequences. This world is unique and the mysterious yet entrancing plot is one that'll stick to you for days to come. 

I HIGHLY recommend for Indie Lovers. It's a perfect game -- a perfect Art.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980909935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1361347200}
review: Just a word of warning because I got suckered into buying this steaming pile due to high praises from the critics and "edgy" fans. This misrepresented excuse for a game is a huge waste of money. It's a linear borderline non-interactive story that's over in 13 minutes or less. Most of the praise is from mental midgets who play it over and over to find the "hidden meaning", or verbose indie developers who find it refreshingly non-conformist (i.e. hipsters). Oh Come ON! The developer admitted he ran out of ideas and had no clue what he was doing. This is just an artistic experiment that should've been offered for public consumption for free. Watch a "Let's Play" video of it on YouTube if you still want to jab a fork in your eye.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989339923', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1361865600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001197142', 'num_games_owned': 2031, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1360396800}
review: This isn't even a game. The only thing you really do is hold W for 10 minutes. I was expecting a nice story driven game, but it was just a slideshow. I'm glad I only paid a dollar for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008117830', 'num_games_owned': 1135, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1358323200}
review: A very interesting experiment in first person non-linear storytelling. If you are interested in storytelling, how tales are told and put together, independent or small team games (just one man), or things that are unique I recommend it wholeheartedly. The game is also very film-like and film inspired, growing out of its influences to create a new original experiences. If you are looking for a fully fleshed and feature first person action or gaming experience then this is not it and you will be disappointed, but that is not the point of this game. Thirty Flights subverts the tropes of first person games intentionally to create a game that is different for each player depending on the baggage, or lack thereof, they bring with them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035655574', 'num_games_owned': 1323, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1360051200}
review:
I thought this was pretty good. 
A lot of people don’t, but I like unique “arty farty” kinds of 'games' like this. ‘Game’ because it seems there’s been quite a few debates as to whether or not this is a game. I’ve heard a lot of people say it isn’t and say it made no sense, but I personally thought it was fun.
In fairness, at the time I had no idea what I was doing or playing or what the hell was was going on at any point of time, I finished it and to be honest was a little impressed. But more so confused.
I like the way it was done, it had a very fast paced kind of 'movie action scene' feel going on, and I even went and played through it again with the developer commentary. It explained some elements of it, and I actually found some of the things that he took into account quite clever. He even mentioned that the "WTF is going on" kind of "amnesia" feel, was one he found hard to pull off. But I think that this game (and the developer even wrote it in one of the commentary segments) is very much for a certain kind of audience. I get where people are coming from when they say they seen the trailer and expected something completely different, it wasn’t anything like I tried to imagine either. But in my own way, I kind of preferred what I found instead. I think it’s a great short (very short) game, with a lot of thought behind it.
 I’m glad I got this on sale when it was 75% off. Although I enjoyed it, I doubt I would pay full price for something this short. If it was longer... then yeh, sure.
All in all, I think it’s a nice, little, short, interactive story, which relies more on environment rather than dialogue. Which you don’t really see all that often.

review:
Like it's predecessor GravityBone (Which is included!) 

Thirty Flights of Loving is like a painting that you quickly glance over in a couple a minutes, but then keep replaying it to rediscover what you already enjoyed. This game is to other games what Pulp Fiction is to other movies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049185949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1358236800}
review:
It's really more of a contest admission than a game. It really disappointed me, having read lot of positive reviews and opinions. I'm not even talking about shockingly short length (measured in minutes), which I was aware before buying. Maybe it's a fault of the hype around it, claiming that there's more to that game than there really is. 

The game does features some original ideas. The story is told achronologically, conveyed only through pictures and to put all the pieces together you will have to play through it couple times to notice things after seeing whole picture. If only story would be more absorbing and had less holes in it (it's derp, it's open ended!!!). Why would you play narrative game if not for the bloody story? In result there's not much incentive to put all the pieces together (you're not going to connect all the dots anyway, so why bother).

The graphics is OK (for a Quake 2 modded engine that is) and the music is quite nice. What's most annoying is that it's a barely a game, your actions don't matter at all. Leave guns and ammo? Nobody cares. Take different direction, game teleports you! That's just lazy level design (or lack of it). Goes without saying that you have no effect on the ending. It does say something about the game if "credit hall" is the biggest level in game.

In the end it's neither good game nor good story. I don't think it will make much difference in story-telling department as well. I'm glad not much developers charge for proof of concept projects. It's of course important to experiment and explore what games can be and become, but it shouldn't be an excuse. That's the hardest part, turning brave and new ideas into working and absorbing games, not just leaving them be and packaging it as a game. I enjoyed "To the moon", this not so much. Maybe it would worked more as a Interactive Fiction? Spare the money, watch it on youtube.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988807641', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1358236800}
review: Like Gravity Bone (which it comes with) the game is a short story that will take a couple playthroughs and investigation of the environment through each playthrough to fully piece together what is actually happening.  This definately falls in the art catagory of games as it tells the story through events and environment and has no dialog.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993302542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1358323200}
review: 본편인 Thirty Flights of Loving 보다 같이 수록된 개발자의 전작 Gravity Bone 이 더 재밌고 게임다운게 함정....

author: {'steamid': '76561197964982166', 'num_games_owned': 2307, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1358236800}
review: An incredible effort at story-telling. A short and sweet narrative about a job gone wrong. It manages to tell a full tale and hold your interest over such a small period of time. Definitely a must play game, because it is truly unique and one-of-a-kind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010511266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1610807051}
review: This game is freakin awesome. 20 to 30 minutes of your time for some very funny non-verbal narrative. I recommend you play Gravity Bone first (available free online; use the internets).

author: {'steamid': '76561198010720017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1697900996}
review:
Edited:

Well, just come to add some English description on this recommendation. So maybe I should write more detailed review on this game.

And yes, a 88 points of metascore should be a good reason for me to purchase this game. But since people are actually playing the game itself rather than the rating, here is the reason why I've spend 2 hours on it (long enough for this short game).
Like many indie games, this game shares some great features like everyone else, simple mechanism, extraordinary storyline etc. Thats not important for me.
The point is the way the game telling the story is funny, its weird, its more like a interactive movie than a game (C'mon, dont reminds me of the real mess of game classification). But unlike others, this one didnt includes mass amount of metaphors(Im not blaming the metaphors), the author messing up the normal lineal storyline right to the point. This game drives you to think, for the pleasure. Thats might not be a big deal, but, if taking all the people, including the ones who just dont like (or cant understand) the metaphors into the consideration, that makes sense.

Thinking is the highest level of entertainment. (for me, maybe? )

And ya, sorry for my terrible English.

Older version:

作者确实是个天才，不过再给我一次机会的话，谁买谁剁手

I like this game, but to be honest, the price should be more reasonable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040435844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1358236800}
review: An interactive movie trailer of a cubic action flick. Yep. That's the closest description i could think of. This is weird stuff. Now most player will tell you this is not worth $5.00, not even 50% off during sales. The thing is, this is not really a game. And yet it is still worth being bought and played because its value resides in its concept. The idea is awesome. The music is awesome. The plot and sets make you wish the movie existed or that this game was as long as a good movie. It also has a handful of good hints related to game development. At the end, i had fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989390070', 'num_games_owned': 2291, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review: This is a concept demo. It conveys an intriguing way of telling a story over the course of its ~8 minute length. Fleshed out, this could be awesome. What's here is essentially a proof of concept though. It's only recommended if you're fine with roughly $1/minute gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964293067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1476509894}
review:
It's like a 10 minute Pixar Short where you step into the shoes of a cube headed 60s criminal/spy. Also it features some science.

The freeware spiritual progenitor "Gravity Bone" is easilly longer, but notably less touching. Oddly they both exist in the same world as Atom Zombie Smasher, and the upcoming deep diving cyberpunk hacker "Quadrilateral Cowboy" which will take the setting likely into the early 80s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043036686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review: Extremely brief first person point and click game which hurls you from location to location rapidly weaving a complicated action story. "Artsy" but not necessarily good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968547199', 'num_games_owned': 7043, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving is an interactive piece of fiction that takes about five minutes to complete and consists of using WASD+M to move around the world as a story is conveyed to you through a series of jump-cut scenes. This was created for the Idle Thumbs podcast as a reward for backers of their Kickstarter project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030798798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review: Don't buy this.  Don't be fooled into buying this at $2.50 or even $1.25. This was a waste of money even at $2.50.  It's essentially a tech demo with a self indulgent commentary mode, too.  Just watch a playthrough on Youtube and you'll have the same effect. I liked this one: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yESakanQH9A  The game is 12 minutes and simply the ever-so-used 'not a game'. Now I wouldn't consider To The Moon a game either, but it is an incredible experience...TFOL is not, not in the same ballpark.  Do not support this cash grab scam blindly. Watch the youtube first, then decide if you want to support it. It's pretty much an 'arthouse movie' in which critics have to say its good or they'll be alienated.  Easily 0/5 stars for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994728746', 'num_games_owned': 1024, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review: Great artistic experience with topnotch music. If you'd like to check out something original, this is it. :) But take note that you'll complete both games with developers commentary in about an hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993748792', 'num_games_owned': 1201, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1379700904}
review: Это не игра, а 13 минут прекрасного пиздеца. И да, это не игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967418148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review:
A very interesting use of first person mechanics and non-linear story telling. You don't control the outcome of Thirty Flights of Loving in any way; instead, you wander through it and watch it unfold. It's only about 10 minutes long, but you get a good story in those 10 minutes that's open to interpretation. There's also a developer's commentary about the process of making a game, and the previous (and unrelated) game in the series, Gravity Bone, which is a little more involved but just as short and sweet.

I recommend this, but bear in mind that it IS a very, very short story, and not what you'd normally call a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025068097', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review:
Ok...I don't get it.
I'm into indie games and art n stuff, but this was a little too weird and random for my taste (or I just didn't get it...maybe this has to be enjoyed on acid or somethin'). I do like the style and music, though. I wouldn't, however, really recommend buying this one as there's a big chance you'd be disappointed. If you're really into experimental storytelling, though, you might want to check it out. At least when it's on sale, or maybe it'll be in an indie bundle soon. 5€ is too much for 20 minutes, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995780909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1581135284}
review:
You'll finish it in around 15 minutes, but it's certainly an interesting experience. Purely visual and interactive storytelling, and it does it very well. Not sure the game's quality makes up for the small quantity, even at the $2.50 I paid for it. Very similar to, if an improvement of, their free downloadable game "Gravity Bone", which is also worth checking out (just Google it). 
I guess I recommend this, but only if you're willing to fork out $2.50 for a very short, different, experimental experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999428325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review: Not a game, but a short story. If you're the kind of person that thinks a short story is worth three bucks, then this one is probably worth it. Don't spend time trying to figure out how to "play" just enjoy the ride (and don't exit at the end... there's a nice bit tacked on if you explore the credits)

author: {'steamid': '76561197978912798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1358064000}
review: I cannot understand why this game was rated so well. I did not like it very much. On the other hand it could be that I simply did not understand the intention of "Thirty Flights of Loving".

author: {'steamid': '76561198007136315', 'num_games_owned': 3396, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1356854400}
review:
Увлекательная, открытая для интерпритации история, расказанная от первого лица и без диалогов. Это приквел бесплатной игры Gravity Bone - попробуйте сначала ее (входит в покупку, кстати).
Продолжительность игры идеальна для иконкодрочеров и прочих импотентов - точно не дропните.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968849949', 'num_games_owned': 1139, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1373622293}
review: The minimalistic story telling and wholesome lack of gameplay leaves the game feeling not much like a game at all. I went into this experience with few expectations, but what I should have expected was nothing. The full gameplay last less than 9 minutes if you take your time. It shows you bits and pieces of a story out of chronological order, not unlike a Tarrantino movie, but never offers any real answers or closure. For $2.50, I feel like I got ripped off. I swear I'm not cheap! >.< 2/10 Would not play again, even for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052381502', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1356681600}

review: It's questionable if this is even considered a game, but after a few playthroughs (less than 15m each) and a few beers, I would definitely recommend this title.  It has a unique way of telling a story, unique for a videogame anyway.  Surprisingly the prequel is included (hit esc/Careers/Gravity Bone), and I liked that even more.  Definitely worth it if you want to see some awesome game design, and I haven't even listened to the developer commentary yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960293192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review:
Bought this on special and finished it twice in 20 minutes. There's some clever stuff in it, but I felt vaguely disappointed as I'd hoped to find it more of a step up from its freeware precursor, Gravity Bone.

Definitely download and try Gravity Bone before buying. This is around the same length or shorter, less interactive (no puzzles or skill involved) and with a couple more interesting presentation techniques.

If you love Gravity Bone and think it'd be worth paying a few dollars for a similar experience, go ahead. It's a short experimental piece that's not for everyone. Could potentially give you some ideas related to first-person storytelling if you're a developer, though, and if so that's worth considerably more than the price of entry.

review: This is not a "game". It is a movie you some times get to press W to move forward or look around with the mouse. It takes about 15 minutes to complete and comes with the game Gravity Bone which takes about an equal amount to complete but has actual gameplay. That said, it is a very interesting thing and if you have ~2,50 to spare when its on sale, maybe grab it. The game does not have any dialogue and you are left to figure out the plot your self from the little disjointed sequences you go trough.

review:
NOT A RECOMMENDATION!
Whilst this game has an entertaining and novel approach to it's (brief) story, it is impossible to recommend due to how short this game is and how little interaction there is. A playthrough will take no longer than 15 mins and a replay with developer commentary the same again. There is no replay value to the game as I see it.
Given that there are free flash games which take longer to play it is hard to justify paying cash for this. Avoid unless you are Bill Gates (younger people, insert more modern rich person as you see fit).

author: {'steamid': '76561198001614578', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1357545600}
review:
While I won't technically call it a game, I hope Brendon of Blendo Games carries the lessons of first person story-telling and level geometry from Thirty into a more substantial next project.

Built on what seems like a modified Quake II engine, he proves that games need not be restricted by technology. 

I'm not sure if it's the out of sequence cuts or music but Thirty oft gave me the feeling of a Tarantino flick, which can't be a bad thing!

review:
I hated this "game." It's apparently trying to tell a story using no dialog or text, where you simply move around and experience sudden flashbacks and whatnot. I had a hard time stringing the story together. I could probably figure out more if I played the game several times (it takes about 13 minutes from start to finish) but, honestly, I have absolutely no desire to do that.

DO NOT BUY THIS "GAME" UNLESS YOU ARE A MASOCHIST OR A HIPSTER.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990261722', 'num_games_owned': 5405, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1364281200}
review:
Disappointing. I was hoping to get something at least on par with Gravity Bone, which I found quite charming.

It's obvious this is lovingly crafted, and the way the story is told is wonderful... there just doesn't really seem to be much story to see.

Also, it's incredibly unstable. It's a short game so replaying bits to get back to your spot doesn't take long, but in the hour I played this (going through the main game and developer commentary) I experienced 4 crashes.

It's interesting if you enjoy game prototypes, but don't set your expectations very high.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996196294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1357372800}
review:
The game itself contains a lot of interesting ideas which have clearly had a lot of thought put into them, however I'm unsure all of that time was well spent. It is ridiculously short and while it might be praised for fitting a lot into a short time period, I don't think it was necessary for the game to be so condensed, there was just something missing. I recommend downloading Gravity Bone (the previous game in the series, which is free) and trying that out to see if you enjoy it (if you can get it working on the correct resolution that is, the game is an arse), then consider whether or not you'd pay for it because TFOL is the same length, essentially. Also, the game crashes no less than Gravity Bone for your money, the only upside of the duration of the game being that when it (inevitably) crashes, you don't have far to go to get back to where you were, though you will have to change all your settings again. One neat feature is that you'll never have to go to all the effort of pressing 'Esc' and exiting the game through the menu, as it will definitely crash before you do, buttonless game closing.. the future!

Ultimately I'd like to see some of these ideas put into a game of more worth and substance, whether in the Citizen Abel series or otherwise. My favourite part of the game was probably the developer commentary, which should never be the case in any form of entertainment, though nice to have it nonetheless. This game should be free, to garner interest in a much more substantial game based on it, unfortunately that was done with Gravity Bone and this is what we got. Perhaps there is hope for the future, kickstarter? Something real please and I'll pay money!

review:
*** Vous aimez cette critique? Visitez le Shnapenn's Choice!
https://shnapenn.com/ ***

*** Pour suivre la page Curateur du Shnapenn's Choice:
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33186693/ ***

THIRTY FLIGHTS OF LOVING
Développé par Blendo Games

Thirty Flights of Loving est un jeu d’action et d’aventure inclassable, situé dans un univers absurde à la chronologie déconstruite.

+ Unique et déstabilisant comme un film de Tarantino
+ Excellente narration et ambiance attachante
+ Contrôles éclatés mais maniables
+ 2 finales d’épisode mémorables
– Très court, comme une ébauche de chef-d’œuvre

EXCELLENT si vous cherchez :
+ Une narration déconstruite
+ Un gameplay simple et rapide

À ÉVITER si vous cherchez :
– Un récit sérieux
– Un vaste univers à explorer

9/10 Shnapenn’s Choice 2012

author: {'steamid': '76561197962436703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1356940800}
review:
I really wish I didn't buy this.

First of all, I like "Walking Simulator" games. I have at least 50 of them in my library, according to Steam tags. I can appreciate games as art, games as experiences, and games as a chance to reflect on the player's own existence. I've enjoyed games that were slow, vague, open-ended, and so on.

But this one is just not worth money. It's about 8 minutes long from start to finish, and there is no dialogue, weapons, or interaction. It's just a series of rooms you walk through. The storefront claims to be a shooter, and the controls suggest that it is one (select item/weapon, crouch, jump, quick save/restore, and so on), but it's a trick -- there are no items, weapons, enemies, or objectives. The whole thing seems to be a wild scam to mischaracterize a game that took probably two months for one person to make, sell it for $5.00 each, and get rich. The story's not interesting either, despite what some reviewers have written.

Also, it crashed twice. Once in the main playthrough and once in the really pretentious developer commentary.

Watch a playthrough of this game online instead. You won't miss a single thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966846956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review:
このゲームはたった10分程度のボリュームしか無い。
いや、おそらくこれはゲームじゃない、ショートムービーでもない、何だ？

一人称視点のキャラを操作できるがほぼ移動のみ、インタラクティブ動作が出来る場面は数えるほどだ。
ポリゴンも角張っており、人物に至っては頭が真四角だ、だが不思議な雰囲気をこの世界は持っていて、粗さを感じさせない。

そしてストーリーはスパイの日常のような物語が淡々と進行していくだけだが、連続性はなく時間軸もバラバラで全く繋がりはない。
だけど何だろう？ この感じ。　昔好きだった映画のシーンが蘇るような、心の片隅に追いやったホロ苦い感情を呼び覚ますような、形容し難い感じ。

最初は「なんだこりゃ？」と思うが、10分はあっという間に過ぎる。
そして物語が終わった後、心がすごく和んでいることに気づく。

たった10分だけど、FPSを数百時間やるより心に残る体験。
こういう作品がどんどん増えて欲しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025974292', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1356163200}
review:
So, what is this game? It's basically 15 minutes of story time, in which the author(s) weaves together a quick series of flash shots together. The minimalistic method is interesting, and entertaining enough for a one-time playthrough.  

It's not great by any stretch of the imagination, though. The story given does not provide much literary merit, and is not nearly long enough to provide substantial "proof" for its concept. All it appears to be is a vehicle to demonstrate the potential of a unique storytelling concept to the video game medium. It works, but I would have liked an expansion on this idea beyond a 15-minute demo reel. 

Your impact as a player is nonexistent. There are no choices to be made. Failure is impossible. Your sole purpose is to tag along for the ride and see what Thirty Flights of Loving has to show you. At this point, there is no reason why this shouldn't be a short film instead, which is a perfect medium to make itself right at home. 

Is it art? Yes. But is it a game? No.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027009098', 'num_games_owned': 1413, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review: Just played through Thirty Flights of Loving and then the director's commentary. Inspiring. Anyone at all interested in narrative in games - go play it now. Best 15 minute lesson in level design and storytelling techniques in games you're likely to have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998872302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review: OK, now I'm not saying go out and spend your dosh. But I will say this. I'm not sure what just happened, but I think it was art... and it was... interesting. I liked it. I think.... This is like one of those films where you're never exactly sure whats going on... and afterwards you feel unsettled for a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970801416', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review:
journey ain't got nothin' on thirty flights lovin'

An awesome experiment in perspective, in story-through-environment, in developing characters without dialogue in the course of 13 minutes, in what's possible with video game storytelling and where it can take us.

The only problem I found with the game's open-ended interpretation: Most of the theories that make sense--the best stuff--is shattered by a note in the developer's commentary, where a forced design decision (i.e., boxes to block a doorway) doesn't seem to follow character motivations.

I hope Chung sticks with Citizen Abel stories in the future; Gravity Bone and 30 Flights are above and beyond the rest of his output, IMO, and despite its length, I found the game well worth supporting with a handful of dollar bills.

The game comes with a copy of Gravity Bone (freeware) accessible from the menu, and, as mentioned, a developer's commentary that's definitely worth checking out. Both GB and 30FoL ask to be replayed at least once or twice. You'll notice a load of new things each time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996416028', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1488035565}
review: Recommended only if you want to support the creators of Citizen Abel: Gravity Bone, or if you want a more stable, better version of Gravity Bone (which is included). Gravity Bone is better: the story is better, the game is more fun and it makes more sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998785170', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1356854400}
review: I have spent more time thinking about what I saw than I did playing it, and I'm still not entirely sure what happened. I am pretty sure I liked it though. It's more of an interactive short film than a traditional game, with a very Tarantino-esque non-linear order of events. Half the fun is piecing together what the hell is even going on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005650315', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1356681600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968576375', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1624947757}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5704, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1382937019}
review:
This is hard to recommend as it's not really a game, but an interactive linear story.  It's pretty fascinating in what it achieves and I think that it's something that everyone ought to walk through (takes about 15-20 minutes), but I can't recommend spending money on it.

On the plus side, it comes with the more puzzly Gravity Bone, the original free game that put Blendo on the map.  Your call.  For me, it wasn't a terrible $2.50.  I've had coffees for that much that lasted a shorter amount of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986457772', 'num_games_owned': 1097, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review: This game is a wild dream.  The kind you awaken from and can't quite recall or explain, but in remembering those few details you know it made you feel something.  Maybe when you lie down again in your bed the next night, images from that dream flash back through your mind and this is comforting, somehow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031565431', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review:
Oranges, cats, and Midnight Hobo. Sooo much Midnight Hobo.

...Oh right, I'm supposed to *recommend* this game instead of revelling in my bout of complete and utter mindfuck. So basically, it's a 10 minute summary of why I should just settle with enjoying games and never get into games development. Worth a play, I assure you. Worth its price? Well, that really depends on you, gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993445299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1356681600}

TFOL has a college "my-first-level-editor" look of broken polygon smoothing and nonsensical graphical options menus, and for some reason it just works. 

It is what it is, and I like the idea that people actually have to pay money for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970791901', 'num_games_owned': 4015, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review:
Thirty Flight of Loving è una genialissima storia creata da Blendo Games.
Quest'avventura ha il suo massimo punto di forza sul fatto che voi giocatori sarete aiutati dal Mondo Circostante a capire chi siete, dove andate, chi sono le persone attorno a voi.
In questa avventura in Prima persona non sentirete una parola. non sentirete un racconto.
Avrete solo i vostri occhi, e la vostra intelligenza nel capire che fare intere sezioni correndo, vi porteranno a non capire niente della storia.
Tanti, tantissimi elementi tutti particolari, al limite del malato.
E quando avrete finito la storia (della durata di 12 minuti) sbloccherete anche il developer commentary, che consiglio caldamente: capirete come tutto questa sorta di "gioco malato" ha tutto un suo senso: nella mente del developer e nella vostra mente.
Presente anche il prequel Breaking Bone, di minor qualità artistica, con minor Colpi di Genio(perché il dev per me è tale.), in quanto un progetto (così come dichiarato dallo stesso developer).
Il tutto termina in 40 minuti.
PER FAVORE, PIU' GIOCHI COME QUESTO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988672858', 'num_games_owned': 7622, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1357200000}
review:
I’m not exactly sure what just happened. But, for the most part, that’s positive. If you want “bang for your buck” and/or want to be *told* a story, you should probably skip ‘TFoL’. You can “finish” it in less than half an hour and there’s hardly any kind of dialogue.

On the other hand, if you want your games to *make* you think, here’s the game for you. It’s less a game and more an interactive silent film. Call it an “art game” or “pretentious” if you must, but for what it’s worth your gaming entertainment can only be enriched by the likes of ‘TFoL’, more-or-less forcing you to think outside the box.

As a bonus ‘TFoL’ contains developer commentary and another game that originated from the same prototype. And the game is set in the same universe as ‘Atom Zombie Smasher’. So, there’s that.

review: More of a short story than a game, Thirty Flights of Loving uses cinematic principles to create an engaging world into which the player is thrown. Fantastic use of jump cuts and a non-linear storyline give it an almost Tarantino-eque feel. Indie gaming at its finest.

review: I'd argue this is the most important game of 2012 from a strictly scholarly perspective. This game comprises 13 minutes of the most complete gaming perfection you'll play all year, and it does so without fancy graphics, lengthy cutscenes, or excessive physics engines. Buy it. Play Thirty Flights of Loving first, then Gravity Bone, then TFOL again with the developer commentary.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990381411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1352620800}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963772675', 'num_games_owned': 991, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1353744000}
review:
Here's what is mind blowing. Buying this will give you two games: Thirty Flights of Loving and Gravity Bone (found inside of TFOL).

I have played TFOL 100% twice without dev commentary, once with dev commentary, and Gravity Bone once. Those 4 rounds of playing a game "completely" equal 45 MINUTES of gameplay.

Minutes.

So why do I recommend that you spend $3.75-$5 on a game that will last you MINUTES? There are no other games like this, you don't even know what you're missing until you play TFOL and Gravity Bone. These games are short films that some how....just some how...make you feel something.

Much like Dear Ester, I will probably remember these tiny little 10 minute walkabout game/movies for a very long time.

Isn't that what we play games for?

author: {'steamid': '76561198066895161', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1471619255}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018613296', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1584655567}
review: Much like Dear Esther, this game is more about the joy of experiencing and piecing together a disparate narrative than the challenges you must overcome to reach that narrative.  It's a blast to play, and even more of a blast to figure out what it's about once you finish it (and probably replay it half a dozen times).  The game may be less than six minutes long, but every one of those minutes is more engaging and interesting than an hour you'd spend with any other typical game.  For that, I'd say you're getting pretty good bang for your buck.  Vive Nuevos Aires!  Vive Citizen Abel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043904229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1347865200}
review: It's not your traditional game; you can literally finish in less than 10 minutes. It's barely even a game in the sense that you have any semblance of control. Rather, it's a genre-bending experiment with no linear narrative, yet is layered enough to evoke thoughtful interpretations of its meaning. Replayability is limited but the low price tag and visual flair are incentive enough to try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960873715', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1347174000}
review: If you have half an hour to spare, you should play this game. Thirty Flights of Loving is the follow up to Gravity Bone, which is included as well. Each game will take maybe 15 or 20 minutes to complete, but if you are interested in something unique, look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981512678', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1381802559}
review:
This is the future of digital games. One of the futures, at least.

References cinema while being essentially non-cinematic. Breaks long-standing rules of HCI for games without breaking the experience. Short enough to not wear out its welcome: witty, poignant, funny, fast-paced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978010332', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1347001200}
review: I'm not exactly sure where all the hype for this game is coming from.  Yes it tells a semi-compelling story in a 14 minute playthrough, but I don't think it was worth the 5 bucks.  Maybe it could have been a youtube video or something.  Similar to Dear Esther in schema, it tells a compelling tale, but come on, can you really compare it graphic-wise?  No, you can't.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965801299', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1346828400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966527290', 'num_games_owned': 3788, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1346655600}
review: Absolument "WTF!", mais artistiquement mémorable. C'est un beau tour de force que de montrer de façon grand-public à quel point le jeu vidéo peut nous raconter une histoire de façon très originale. Un peu cher, evidemment, mais tellement sympathique !

author: {'steamid': '76561198001342103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1369539678}
review: Like its predecessor, Gravity Bone, this too throws you through a quick full story. It's quite amazing actually. It also has gravity bone in it and a commentary mode too, so if you liked the first game you get a little bit extra with it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980464130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1346050800}
review:
Wasn't as interesting as GRAVITY BONE, which I suppose, might just be a consequence of having played Gravity Bone. By the way play Gravity Bone, too. This game comes with it, but it's been free to play for years.
So, the idea the creators of this game wanted to achieve was to create a very memorable, impactful short story in under 30 minutes of gameplay for a very low price.

I think I didn't like it as much as Gravity Bone because it was surprising and new, and I came to 30 Flights with expectations... That all being said, I'm happy to have supported their game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961601781', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1346310000}
review:
As indie as a video game could possibly get. The game is less than thirty minutes long, capitalizing on your own rationalizations and conclusions as to the way the story unfolds, rather than through mainstream concepts such as "character development" and "first-day DLC". In spite of its incredulous model, Thirty Flights of Loving finds a way to create a plot just as well as a 30-hour RPG.

But seriously, this game was hilarious and fun. Make sure you play the prequel to this game called "Gravity Bone" (totally free; go to blendogames.com), just to get a taste of what to expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980073777', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1389667591}
review:
Before playing this game, I highly recommend finding the nearest download link for it's prequel Gravity Bone, it's free and gives you a good idea of what to expect from this game.

Speaking of THIS GAME.

This game tells a better story in less than half an hour than most games tell in 6-40 hours.  

An amazing example of what a few dedicated people can accomplish using an old and reliable game engine, clever cinematic techniques, and a lot of love.

If you don't get at least some kind emotional response from this game, then check your pulse. BECAUSE YOU ARE FUCKING DEAD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007947111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1347778800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018724957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1501326730}
review:
Not an easy recommend, you need to be a certain kind of person with a certyain frame of mind. The easiest description would be that this is a bit like 'Dear Esther' but about a lot more things across a much larger canvas and space and time fitted into a much smaller package. Which is pretty much incorrect in every point except the bit about the storytelling method. It also includes the 'other' game Gravity Bone, which is free anyway but nice to have them together in the same place.
Actually, I can't recommend it at all like this. I've gots to know you first.
(or test yourself, find and play Gravity Bone first)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967454254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1345878000}
review: A wordless heist movie told through disjointed scenes that leave you scrambling to figure out your role in them. Amazingly, this works - better than the vast majority of videogame storytelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4498, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1345618800}
review:
It's not quite a game, it's not quite an interactive movie. It's... I don't know what the hell it is. It's short (20-30 minutes), and it looks simple. You can't really play it, you have to experience it. 
The music is brilliant though. It's the kind of music that could be used in movies. I enjoyed it THAT much. The 'game' itself... not so much though. It does a decent job of telling a story but I have no idea what it's all about. It seems you have to 'play' it several times to fully understand it. 
Worth it ? Not for this price. Other games have way more gameplay, for the same price or lower. But, I guess it's a nice tech demo.

[Rating: 57/100]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025331448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1345705200}
review: A sequel to the free game "Gravity Bone" (included).  The game's unique aesthetic brings you to a universe tells a story that transitions akin to a comic book while leaving the player to interpret the events that happen around him/her.  While the game lasts for only 15 min, it pretty much tells it without filler and allows you to fill in certain "gaps" without losing the story.  A briliant concept that is hopefully explored for future games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993836379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1345791600}
review:
A cool vignette by Blendo. The problems I had with it are:
Seems a little too short. It's about the same length as Gravity Bone (which is free). 
You get teleported around a lot unexpectedly. It is a bit annoying, because this can happen while traversing an area. I expect this was an engine limitation, but it's still annoying.

BUT, I still enjoyed it for what it is. I recommend it for Gravity Bone fans, and also when it's like 50% off.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993509482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1345705200}
review: Insanely brilliant piece of interactive storytelling. Definitely worth all 5 euros, even if the whole thing lasts no more than 15 minutes. Comes packed with the previous chapter called "Gravity Bone", also available elsewhere as freeware. Very recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048803494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1355212800}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983359608', 'num_games_owned': 1278, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1345618800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041022985', 'num_games_owned': 2270, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1345705200}
review: It's very indie, but there is something about Blendo Games that I love. I'm not sure exactly what it is. Maybe that so much work is put into 30 minutes of gameplay? Maybe it's the livelihood of the worlds they create? Maybe it's the "You wake up and see yourself sleeping" type stories? I'm not sure, but I think everyone can find something to love in this game

author: {'steamid': '76561197992719280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1345618800}
review:
Incredibly bizarre!

If you're a fan of Gravity Bone, you'll probably like this too.

The price tag is a bit high for such a short game, but I couldn't care less - Blendo Games deserves every penny and more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994139784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1345618800}
review: Thirty Flights of Loving is quite a little masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963763223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1345532400}
review:
Its a weird game. If you tend to run through games,  this will be a waste of money. In order to make this game work. You need to look at the enviroment, it tells a story through you and everything else. There is no dialogue, no voice acting. You do hear some kind of voice but I have no idea if they are in english or just blabber for the sense of having something to hear that kind of sounds like a language.

There is a lot of information in here, for one thing, it has two games in it. the prequel, "Gravity bone". Its an interesting experience, and you also get a developer commentary mode. Though this mode is kind of crashy.. but has a lot of information about the person who made this. And how he made everything in this game. And then there is another mode I havent quite touched yet. So I cant comment on that.

All in all. If you like a story without words, and like to piece everything together. By all means ,try this one. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024253308', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 575, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1345532400}
review: A surreal trip of pure fucking beauty ;)
